Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2021

Review Title: Not a security system, just a monitor system, a mediocre one at that
Review Text: I purchased multiple Blink items overall review-A real security system gives you at least 4 zones that can be adjusted and armed separately. It has an audible alarm, it may also have a cell phone connection. I have owned several such systems and had good service from them.Blink has none of these qualities.You can have "zones" but each will cost you $35 to $40 for a sync module so, 4 zones min $140 and you have nothing else. The cameras are not real motion detectors, as illumination does not set off motion detector like the blink cameras and doorbell do; hence multiple false alarms. If you use lights on timers  in the room with blink cameras they false alert each time a light turns on or off. Light control is a big part of security. Blink IR is very poor by today's standards.The Blink door bell has a sensitivity adjustment, but set to lowest setting it still alerts when a car goes down the street. It is 80' from my Blink doorbell to the edge of the road and it false alerts every time a vehicle goes in either direction.r I have mine on battery; you can hard wire it in place of your existing doorbell). Amazingly it alerts to cars but not to Amazon delivery people right in front of it. Yes it recorded 9 cars today (I live in a Cul-de-sac or I would have smashed the doorbell by now) but not the ghost that placed my Amazon package on the porch right in front of it.The Mini Cameras alert every time a light is turned on or off, but sometimes doesn't when I walk by.To use local storage instead of cloud you have to have at least one Sync module and an SD card. So if you have four zones as above example you add $10 to $20 per SD for each module which adds another $40 to $80 to your cost. Now all of your "security recordings" are on 4 different devices and totally separate. Does this sound like a security problem?The outdoor cameras are all three still in the box so I cannot tell what problems they will add. Too disappointed with Blink so far to waste time adding to my disappointment.The Echo Dot and Echo Show which Amazon recommended to go with the blink system are also still in the box so no info on problems they might have.I purchased all of this prior to Christmas in order to update and improve my 8 to 10 year old small security system. I do not use the Cloud for any security purpose so local storage was a must. Due to life in general, I did not have time to open and set everything up. When I finally got around to it, I became aware that the Mini's would work, but I had to purchase a Sync module to have local storage. Later found out that local only transfers videos to SD once a day and will NOT record Live View (yeah this is a security system LOL). You may notice that Blink does not tell you a lot of this in their description. For way less money I could have purchased a legitimate, real security system with 4, 6 or 8 zones and cameras with wifi and had something that I would trust and not hate. A friend suggested that I sell Blink on Craigslist. I told him the Blink system is bad: I would feel like a criminal asking money for it. It would make a good baby monitor using the Mini cameras, I guess.Amazon refuses to stand behind the Blink system since it is past their return date. I spoke with customer service and she transferred me to someone else for assistance with the Blink and they just hung up on me when I told them it was totally unsatisfactory.Buyer Beware. Just because Blink is owned by Amazon does not mean you will be pleased or they will stand behind it.I bought it, I didn't use it before return date so my fault for not doing my research. Now cut my loss and go to Costco and purchase a real functional security system.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2022

Review Text: Unless your property is facing absolutely nothing, avoid the headache and get something better.Granted, my setup is worst case scenario, busy street a few yards from my front door, but that's no excuse to be triggering constantly while completely MISSING PEOPLE, capturing people is the whole point!!Seems this is a software issue, the cameras are set up to capture changes in brightness, as opposed to movement of contrasting pixels. This seems to be causing the camera to trigger every time the onboard white balance adjusts itself based on light in the image, which can be caused by lighting outside the detection zones. I tried everything, from using the smallest capture zone to using the lowest sensitivity, and still it wasn't working properly, continued to capture passing vehicles outside of the zones, while missing people. I could write a better detection program in a weekend myself. So MAYBE if Amazon hires actual programmers instead of dumping the work on unpaid interns, they might fix it. Until then, I would avoid.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2021

Review Title: Good for the Price, but not high quality
Review Text: Overall, for the value you get and the features I would recommend the doorbell because it isn't horrible.  I'm coming from a Ring Video doorbell 2 because I don't want to pay for recorded videos of people I have missed.  It only allows you live views, which is garbage!  I installed and am currently running on battery vs wired.  Integration with my existing Blink ecosystem was seamless and easy enough to do.  If you have an existing synch module, then you already know how to operate and setup things from the app.  All the features I had from the Blink mini and outdoor camera are the same, so there isn't a learning curve there.  I appreciate the fact that I can store motion videos in the cloud for free with the legacy synch module and don't have to pay for this service.  Maybe that will change in future?  I also like that I can upgrade the module to use store video on an external SD card locally and still not pay for cloud service.  Haven't used this feature yet, so I cannot comment on it. As you would imagine Alexa integration works fine as well, so alerts and door bell rings can be pushed to your Alexa powered devices.Now for the bad as I guess you get what you pay for.  The Blink outdoor and mini are easily 5 stars, but doorbell not so much. The reason I am giving 3 stars is because of a few things:1) the build quality is not the same as a Ring doorbell for example. Feels a little cheap and the mounting bracket and angle mounting brack are very cheap thin plastic.2) the release mechanism from the mount is absolutely horrible. I see this being a big issue for longer term and see it breaking. This is probably not a problem for those that are hard wired, but for those running on battery and need to take the doorbell on/off this is not good design. I can pretty much guarantee you will need a new mounting bracket or even new doorbell after a few battery changes. Also, the tool you use to detach the doorbell is hard to use and takes a little jiggling around to unmount the doorbell.3) there isn't a quick start guide and everything is online or in the Blink app so get it SETUP with the synch module BEFORE you try to mount!That's all I have for now.  Will update on battery life and if quality makes it past a harsh Winter and/or blistering Summer.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2021

Review Text: I purchased the Blink Video Doorbell + Sync Module 2 and Blink Video Doorbell Corner Mount. The Blink itself came with a corner mount, so buying the extra corner mount wasn't necessary. (It probably said that somewhere, but I don't remember reading that). Overall great product and I plan to buy more for the ret of my home.Likes: Easy setup for the sync module and doorbell itself. The app works well and the directions were easy to follow along. The app is nice. Easy to use. Once we set it up, it worked perfectly. We get notifications for any activity. The voice function works well.Dislikes: so-so installation. The directions could have had more details. I'm not sure if it exists, but a video installation would be helpful. One disadvantage is that you have to buy a subscription service.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2021

Review Text: The product description states that it works with digital doorbells. It does and it doesn't.What it doesn't tell you is that some doorbells need to have a Diode installed. It did not work with my doorbell.When I contacted Tech support and told them my problem, I asked if a Diode was needed. I was told that the device did not have the option to attach a diode but they have identified some customers using one.After messing around with a diode for a period of time, I got the bell to function properly, the way it is supposed to. I emailed the tech I was dealing with and suggested that since they are aware of the need for a diode in some bells, their engineers should into it more and let potential buyers know.Lets see what happens.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2021

Review Text: I’ve had Blink cameras for years…I was an early adopter of their brand well before Amazon bought them out.  Because we get unlimited online storage for free (grandfathered in on that deal), we haven’t seen much need to stray to a different company.  I was excited to see that Blink also made a video doorbell as that’s something we had been discussing.  I snatched this up on Black Friday and was ready to give it a shot!  I read all the reviews about installation issues and was expecting to have some, but I found installation to be easy.  And I’m a woman with limited installation experience of pretty much anything.  This camera works with either a Sync or Sync 2 box, but must have one or the other to use it wirelessly.  When I took my old doorbell off the frame I looked at the wires and thought, “Heck, I could probably wire this bad boy.”  After some reading, I found out that most doorbells don’t run on enough juice to power a video doorbell.  This would have been nice to know beforehand!  I realize they say the amount it needs to run on in the description, but who really thinks about what kind of power is running through their doorbell?!  Not me.  And I wasn’t interested in replacing the transformer just to have the dumb doorbell sound that you can’t hear unless you’re on the main floor so mine runs only through wireless and notifications via phone.  It’s nice that they included plastic caps for the doorbell wires that are already in place—I just didn’t happen to see them until after I had wrapped the ends in electrical tape.  An extra screw or two might be nice as I’m pretty sure I stripped one of them.Overall, the video picture is clear, the alert on my phone is unique (so I don’t mistake it for an alarm that utilizes a doorbell sound) and I’m mostly happy with my purchase.  What I don’t like is that it takes FOREVER to pull up the video feed of who is actually at the doorbell.  As I’ve never owned a Ring doorbell, I have no idea if this is SOP for video cameras or not.  It’s not enough to deter me, but it’s not quite as instantaneous as I was hoping for.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2021

Review Title: Good not great...installation is harder than it looks and still no PC app
Review Text: This is the 5th camera we have in our Blink system. To be honest, we have them more to watch the wildlife than as a security feature, but they do that, too. The wall our doorbell is on is uneven rock, which is not really an issue for doorbell that is two inches long and half an inch wide. This Blink doorbell is much bigger, so the uneven surface is an issue; it was hard to get the unit to slide onto the mounting bracket, and there are lots of big gaps around where it mounts. Nonetheless, eventually got it relatively stable and in the right place. It would not be very hard to rip it off the wall, though not sure why anyone would do that. It seems to work well, though I still have two big issues with the Blink system overall: 1) There is STILL no PC app, which is really odd. It's great to be able to access the system via your phone, but phones are not ergonomically the best way to access and control such a system. 2) Battery life is not great, though it is impacted by your settings. And it is binary. The battery is either fine, or you get a message to "replace the battery" and that camera shuts down soon after. It would be great, though, if the system could manage the battery much as my phone and PC manage their battery. Specifically, when it hit a certain threshold (such as 15%) the Blink system could automatically scale back the settings to conserver the battery while still functioning. In the case of Blink, it could step down the resolution, shorten clip length, lower the IR (night vision) illumination, etc. All of these things will save the battery life while still functioning so I have more time to get to it. Today, once it hits that "replace battery" if I'm on vacation or a business trip away from the house it will likely shut down before I get to it, and then I have nothing.The Blink system overall is pretty good, but really surprising they have not done a few more easy things to make it a great system.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2021

Review Title: Seems like an immature beta product - needs some work to be good.
Review Text: *Second update* I'm downgrading my rating to one star now. I needed to remove the doorbell to install the wedge back so it could be mounted at an angle. When I removed it, apparently four mounting tabs broke off. I just noticed because it wouldn't attach to the backplate anymore and I heard some rattling inside. See the attached picture of the pieces I managed to get out of the main camera body after shaking it about a bit. That is just terrible plastic quality. And yes, I used the recommended tool and procedure from their website. Also, the rubber grommets in the backplate seemed completely disintegrated already. Be warned, if you ever need to detach the camera be extremely careful and be prepared that you break stuff. I can no longer mount it and will need a new backplate.*Update* After about a week of using it there was a firmware update that fixed the chime volume at the doorbell and it's now silent. Customer service was very responsive and followed up to confirm the issue is resolved. The view and installation issues remain though so I'll update from 2 to 3 stars for now (the installation issues only seem fixable with a new design of the physical hardware).*Original Review*I was over the moon when the release of this long awaited doorbell was finally announced! I've been waiting to get rid of those terrible Ring doorbells and replace them with this.I have to say though, the only saving grace for this is the long battery life (Ring's are horrible even with all motion features turned off). With so much development time and delay under its belt, I would have expected more. Some details:* Mounting experience is horrible. I don't know what product design was thinking but that backplate you have to press the device on to is something else. You have to press really hard and push up, and there's not much feedback to see if it's secure or not.* I saw a feature in the app to turn off the ringer - which I like to do, what's the point of the outside person hearing a chime anyway. Unfortunately, this doesn't work - at all. When I asked customer service, after two back and forth exchanges, they finally admitted (and I quote) "Seems like the ringer volume on doorbell settings is not fully functional since this is a newly added feature on the app". Oh you figured that out when a customer told you? Shouldn't you have found this during your own testing? I'm not impressed.* With the Ring ones, I can see a picture of who's at the door on relevant Alexa devices with a screen. This one for some reason doesn't do that although it does announce that someone's at the door.* I have two doorbells, front and back door, and although they're both connected with a corresponding unique name, all Alexa does when someone rings the doorbell is "Someone's at the Blink Doorbell". Well, which one is what I would like to know - why can that integration not be fixed to actually use the designated label or name of the device?I do understand there will be feature and maybe some quality differences between a low price segment device such as this and more expensive ones such as the Ring range, but honestly if it weren't for the long battery life there'd be virtually no difference to me in terms of functionality (they both are bad). Honestly, for how long we've been waiting for the doorbell, and assuming it's undergone a fair amount of development since the original announcement, this product is a bit of a disappointment. One can't help but wonder, given they're both from the same parent company, if it's almost designed to push you to the more expensive range, but then why put effort into development in the first place.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2021

Review Text: This thing was pretty much plug and play. I already live in the Amazon ecosystem, so it took no time at all to get this set up. The picture looks good, and it is easy to tell everything you're looking at. I saw a few comments about people having issues with the motion sensor, but I haven't had this issue, and kinda surprised that it doesn't go off every time a car goes down the street or a cat walks by, but definitely comes on when a person walks through the yard. The microphone isn't amazing, and the person at the door has to talk louder in order for you to hear them properly, but it's not unusable by any means. The backplate that holds the batteries was defective in mine, but I contacted Blink and they had a replacement here in 2 days, so good on them. The mounting is "meat and potatoes" unless you want a super specific angle.The only reason that I'm knocking a star off is because the local backup only supports 256GB flash drives. I bought a 2 TB external USB HDD for the backup, and can't use it. I found where it stated this on the website but; A. It was something that was not easy to find and; B. This is a small amount when you are talking about recording video and audio. This means that in order to clear the drive, you are going to have to unplug it and delete everything manually, and often. Cmon, Jeff. It's 2021, and we can only use 256 GB? Kinda ridiculous...All in all, I'm happy with it. I'll be getting some of the cameras to sync with it and using the subscription service for the cloud storage. I've seen complaints about this by the way, but I don't feel like $10 a month unreasonable. If you don't like it, don't pay for it. People pay more than that for Netflix, and that does nothing to help secure you're house and property.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2021

Review Title: First iteration of some must-have features
Review Text: The Blink doorbell camera has some really interesting features, and some others that remain to be desired. I bought this together with the Sync module 2, and have been using it with the Premium function (on a free trial) and without the Premium function. Here are my thoughts:Pros:1. It mounted well and had easy to set up instructions, including with the sync module2. It runs on battery - I’ve used it for about a month now, and the battery seems to be okay. It does boast a 6 month battery, but so far so good and no problems unlike other reviewers who faced battery issues. I don’t have a wiring capability at my apartment so this was key.3. The Sync Module 2 works without the Premium function, but do read on for more details.Things that need improvement:1. Chime - because the doorbell is not wired, it only rings outdoors (no one inside the home can hear it), through my phone and through the my Echo devices (dot and echo show), but I have found these notifications not great and sometimes very slow. So a chime system together with the Sync Module 2 would have been perfect2. Slow… everything is just so slow on the app. To get a notification of motion or when the bell is pressed, it is at least 5 to 10 seconds before you get notified. To load the videos even on cloud, or on live view, it takes at least 5 seconds to load. The live view part is extremely extremely annoying, because in 5 seconds someone can run away with something!! Viewing pre recorded notifications of motion is possible without a subscription through the Sync Module, but it is also slow to load, and doesn’t show previews. But it works, and you don’t have to pay extra for it.Overall, I am happy with the device, but I find myself unable to give higher than 3 stars. If the connectivity issue is not slow, I would have loved it more, but for now, I believe this is a first iteration of the features that every future doorbell devices should have.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2022

Review Text: I've had a Blink security camera system for about 2 years and I have few complaints. I have the cameras up high in my exposed roof rafters looking down so the don't pick up my front fence line or the street view. I purchased the door bell to get an outward street camera. Now I added the door bell to my system and I've notice that its has some differences that I don't like.1st off you have to go outside and press the door bell button when you make a setup change. I don't keep my camera system armed during the day as I've been home a lot (Retired) but like it on at night. So to arm my doorbell camera I have to open my front door and press the button after every setup or arming change.2nd there is no live camera view now option, it only records video if the bell button is pushed or if armed there is movement. I like being able to hit the live camera view if needed at night from my bedroom if I'm notified there's been disturbance.3rd I wired it to my old low-voltage door bell but it doesn't ring when the button is press. It rings if you use metal on the posts to complete the circuit on the mounting bracket. So I'm not sure what's going on there. The system ring is adequate so I've not gone back to get it to work.I do like that it records if the bell button has been pushed even if its not armed. Its got a great wide angle camera view that picks up my whole front yard. I didn't have any problems installing to the app or mounting it.I'm stumped on the Alexa Blink setup, it wont email me the setup code after many attempts. I have to go back and look at my Blink hub to makes sure it the 2nd gen...I don't regret adding this to my Blink security system but its has its limitations.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2022

Review Title: Great addition to my Blink system
Review Text: The delivery came quickly. I took my time to read instructions on line (the email with information was delayed and there was little in the packaging). I needed to upgrade my sync module so I could take advantage of the USB memory stick to save clips. The doorbell was actually very simple to install in the most basic way. Connecting it to the existing door bell buzzer is turning out to be more complicated. But both the door bell button module and my cell phone both chime loudly when the button is pushed and the video is taken even when the rest of the system is turned off.The one thing that was a bit fiddly was adjusting the sensitivity since it faced out to the street and anything moving out there triggered the video. So before I tried to connect the existing doorbell wires, I just fiddled with the sensitivity for a few days. Then I used the corner mount and moved it over to the left of the front door so it aimed more at the side wall/fence yet still picked up any localized movement. There was a comment that it works best if people don't approach straight at it but from an angle. So now it does not pick up anything further away than my driveway but I have a lot of clips of our local hooligans, the raccoons. I am also moving one of my solar powered outside motion activated walkway lights over to the door frame so that at night there will be ample lighting. I bought the solar powered system of 8 lights also from Amazon a few months ago and they work great even when their location is shaded. So so far, I am delighted although this is my first video doorbell and I have nothing else to compare it to. It fits in nicely with the Blink cameras I bought back in 2018.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2022

Review Text: I was really looking forward to the doorbell feature of a Blink as I have four Blink cameras throughout my house.  What a disappointment!  When someone rings the doorbell, it takes close to two minutes before it rings on my phone, so I haven't actually had a conversation with anyone.  I also have no photos of any delivery person dropping anything off on my porch - and I have received packages.  I will continue to experiment with the sensitivity, but I'm not hopeful.  Also, when I go to take a photo of the front porch from my phone, more times than not, I get the message, "Thumbnail failed."  The live camera works adequately but the background sounds like an airport.  I'm thinking of returning it in hopes of getting a better unit, but it's such a pain now that it is secured to the wall.  I have not tried the integration with Alexa.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2021

Review Title: Piece of Junk,  not worth even trying , waste of time , effort and money - Returning it.
Review Text: First of all mess with Order status :1) Got a Amazon notification that my item was delivered, then when I checked the USPS tracking it showed it was picked by an individual from post office at 7 am in the morning. I got really confused and checked my mail box and front door . It was not delivered.  Finally, after chasers, the item was delivered late in the evening.Now about the item itself. ( Great Toy for kids).My 12 year son was super excited to do a unboxing video and went ahead did the unboxing and setup .  Had my USB drive connected to the sync module for storage. Setup done and good to go.Issues :1) The app takes for ever to load recorded clips or it just keeps spinning. I am sure Amazon wants your nice monthly subscription for cloud storage. Local storage is just a joke. It works one time and just keeps spinning most of the time that is loading from USB drive. App complains about USB drive could longer to load. Wow, loading from internet seem much faster than local storage. What a rip off ?2) My townhouse front door area has bright sunlight , when someone arrives or rings the door the bell the background , trees etc. look awesome except the person. The camera quality is so bad and cannot capture the faces clearly.  If you have  a  bright sunlight front door, this device is useless and works great just a normal door bell.3) Unable to delete unwanted videos, you have wait for the video to load and pause the video to see the delete button. If the video does not you cannot remove the video from your local storage. I ended up formatting my USB drive on my PC to clear the space.4) Finally , I wasted 1 hour of my time toying around this junk. Going back to the Amazon. :)Avoid this!Update 2/13: honestly I wanted to give a chance and kept for couple of days.. it has been terrible experience. To reset the camera settings,require a tool take the device out. The plastic is fragile ,it actually fell down n floor.Today when someone was at the door, bell outside rang but it took couple of minutes to ring on the phone. Sometimes this never worked . Had tried Deleting and adding the device.  This product is certainly not mainstream and still a prototype that Amazon is trying to profit .
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2022

Review Title: Does it's job. But it really needs a standalone chime.
Review Text: We've been using Blink outdoor cameras for quite awhile. Back when they were independent Blink. So we're grandfathered into the old no pay plan.I think that the Blink cameras in general do a good job. The doorbell is no different. It was easy to install and it works. We have it scheduled to film at night with the other cameras, or when we are away during the days (my wife and I both work from home), we activate the system manually. The cameras and doorbell do their jobs as they should. So the doorbell camera functions pretty much like a regular security camera that you can schedule, but still activates and records when someone presses the doorbell button off schedule.Installation of the doorbell was seamless. If you are familiar with the Blink setup process of adding an additional camera, it's a cakewalk. First timers should have no issues either.When you install the backplate, you just need to ensure that you haven't caused it to buckle/warp out of shape via your drilling in of the screws, otherwise you may have a hard time sliding the camera onto the backplate/mount. If that is good, then you simply slide the camera down onto the mount until it clicks into place. All in all it's a 10 minute install give or take.I do see a number of people stating that there’s a big lag in the recordings. But I’ve never really had that issue. We have an Ubiquiti mesh system so maybe that helps?Is Blink the end all, be all in home security? No.But it does what it says it will if you set the cameras/doorbells up correctly. It's an easy to install system, that requires no wiring and it acts as a deterrent. Reasonably priced too. Which is why I chose it over Arlo. It's also great for when your dogs go out to potty at night.My only true beef with the doorbell itself is the lack of an add on chime. Seems like a pretty big oversight to me, and hopefully that will be an option soon (Blink if you're reading this).Some people don't have an accessible wired chime, or wired chime period - like me. And many of us don't want an Alexa unit in the house - me again.Yes- the bell does emit an audible tone OUTSIDE at the bell itself when pressed, but inside I cannot hear it. Yes - you can get the notification on your mobile. But I keep my phone on do not disturb while I am working. So the lack of an add on chime is the downside to the doorbell.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2022

Review Title: Great video bell and great price
Review Text: I had a ring doorbell that I purchased from Costco a few months back. I liked it ok but then started having issues with the motion detection and the actual ringing of the bell. Saw this on a black Friday deal at a tremendous price difference for what I paid for my ring. It's pretty comparable to the ring. Has detection that you can turn up or down depending on how sensitive you want to keep it at. Mine was picking up my neighbor across the street putting up Christmas lights which was a little too much for me. So we lowered the sensitivity. It rings to my existing chime box in my house which if it didn't would have been a deal breaker for me. I'm old school. Like to hear that ding dong instead of having to have my phone only make the sound. I did order an echo show to connect it to so I can see who's at the door when I'm cooking or doing something where I don't have my phone right next to me. Still waiting on delivery of that. It's still on back order I'm assuming because it was at such a great sale price last week. Hope that works out. The bell itself is very sleek looking. Fits on my door nicely although I must say I have it to the side so I needed to order the tilt bracket so it would face my steps properly. But that was only $7. No biggie. No issues installing or putting backing on like others have said. There is a tool in the box that helps with that. So far so good. Definitely a more cost effective alternative to a ring and so far to me this is superior to ring. If you are deciding between this and ring, especially at the price point, I say go with blink.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2021

Review Title: Not very durable - good entry level system
Review Text: I bought my first Blink Video Doorbell camera and installed it on December 2, 2021 in a hard wired fashion.  It was relatively intuitive and instructions provided were terrific.  It was also easy to integrate with Alexa.  Initially, I didn't have the same issues of mounting the camera to the back as others have mentioned they have (the first time).  The doorbell camera worked well with explainable issues.  1) The camera is designed to trigger when there are changes in temperature.  My dryer exhaust vents at the front porch and would, on occasion, trigger the camera.  2) The front of the house faces Southwest.  Sunsets can very easily blind the camera - shadows of people walking by also set off the camera (the "Zones" functionality doesn't work all that well).  The snow plow that comes to the street will also set it off.Fast forward to the end of February (3 months after installation) and I receive notification on the Blink app that I need to replace the batteries.  My understanding is that the batteries are supposed to last longer but 3 months is reasonable I guess.  I removed the camera from the base, replaced the batteries, and could not get it mounted correctly.  The tabs to mount the camera broke off (plastic).  I ended up having to purchase another unit to replace the old one (corner plates are available, but I don't see standard mounting plates available for sale).About the best piece of advice I can provide is don't tighten that wall plate as tight as you need it - it will bend the back plate and make mounting more difficult.  Lesson learned.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2022

Review Title: What I needed to compliment my Blink cameras
Review Text: I have been using the Blink cameras for several years and I have always liked them. When I got the pre-order notification for the doorbell I immediately placed an order.I am more than satisfied with the video quality and settings of the device, the video is crisp and clear but of course you can adjust these settings to suit your individual preferences. Whether you want to preserve battery life or sacrifice it in spite of video quality and consistent monitoring of your home is up to you.I mounted mine with batteries as opposed to hard wiring, I also used the corner mount which had to be ordered separately (oddly) for free with a code provided by Amazon.The installation took maybe 5 minutes, it was simple and instructions are provided. Keep in mind that, to lock the doorbell in place you need to press hard. Remember, the device will be exposed to the elements and possibly tampering so it needs to be sealed tight. DO NOT throw away the small key provided in the box as you will need it in order to remove your device for whatever reason.The chime sound it emits when the doorbell button is pressed, is definitely audible and the speaker is loud and clear. The motion activation works as it should. I tested mine with a grocery delivery and the person was definitely spooked when they heard my voice, but I was glad it worked as the delivery person was not sure if it was the right home and their app was not working at the time, so we were able to communicate through the Blink doorbell. I’d say it’s totally worth it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2021

Review Title: 45 degree angle using my old Ring mount!
Review Text: My doorbell is set into an alcove in my home and the old button doorbell was flush mounted to a side wall, so a 45 degree mount is the only option for my home. I had a Ring doorbell (720 dpi) and it was time to upgrade it to the newer Blink system of cameras that I already have inside my home. I waited for the new Blink doorbell that just released (shipped 11/01/21) with the higher video resolution, but had to do mod on the old Ring mount so as to make it face the correct way out. I created a faceplate out of an old clear plexiglass scrap I had laying around. Marked where holes were on the old Ring doorbell were located on the Plex which was easy since it was clear anyways. Cut, drilled and mounted it to the old 45 degree Ring base. It's not half bad and a fresh coat of house paint over the mount and new faceplate will serve it well. It took awhile to figure out the most optimal way to set the setting in the phone app... but with a little trial and error I figured it out. Put all your Blink cameras on the same category as your Blink Sync Module 2. Arm the entire system then click on the little runner icon above each camera to turn off your interior cameras so as not to get false alarms as you walk around in your own home. This way only your outdoor cameras are armed during your awake hours.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2021

Review Text: I've probably had this doorbell on and off the wall a good 20 times to get it setup. For starters, it's basically mandatory to have wired power from the house. It's useless without it, even though it comes with batteries. The lithium name brand batteries it came with failed in less than a week and any other batteries I use produce a low battery indicator in the user interface. Anytime I dismount the unit to address these issues I have to hit the reset button on the back, rediscover my wifi and re-enter the password, very irritating. Like the other blink devices you have to manually go through every motion notice to clear the notifications. I should have the option to clear them all. This is super irritating when you have a lot of movement like family visiting, and you see 178 notifications in the app. You also can't disarm just one camera, it's either all or none. The doorbell will go off when the cat walks by but if someone legitimately comes to the door it magically doesn't work for whatever reason. I've yet to have it successfully tell me when someone is at the door and also ring when they press it. It should do both. It also had an episode where it just wouldn't work with the alexas I set up. I had to reinstall the system to get it to connect to the alexas again. I really wish this thing was just plug and play but it's buggy and I've spent way too much time fiddling with it. I'm writing this review because 30 minutes ago someone came to the door and it failed to announce the movement and it failed to ring when they pressed the button. They had to knock. I check my other camera and I see the person press the button and just stand there wondering why nobody came to the door. But I bet 100 dollars tonight in my sleep the cat will trip the motion and my alexa will wake me up. And then the next day a delivery will come and nothing will happen. Should have gone with the Ring, you know, the device Blink is ripping off.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2021

Review Title: Check your account creation date on Legacy systems because not all Legacy systems are grandfathered.
Review Text: Added to my existing Blink cameras was easy. Doorbell works good and have it ringing on my Alexa devices.But I have issues with the whole marketing of these.I have a legacy system with several XT2 cameras and enjoy the 7200 seconds (2hrs) of free online video storage. No monthly fees required. I had read that these doorbells would be grandfathered into that legacy system and share that video storage time.BUT NO!!The fact is not all legacy systems will not honored...only those activated by April 15, 2020. I apparently activated mine in June. So I have a Legacy system but no, not really.I bought the first system under the assumption based on their advertisements that I would enjoy 2 hours of lifelong free video storage online, no subscriptions required and may expand the system piece by piece as necessary....but NO they changed it all up and gave a big fat middle finger to their early adopters and said now you will have to pay for said storage if you want to expand your system and picked a arbitrary date of April 15th, 2020. Note the people who purchased the XT2 systems after April 15th were not told they had a "red headed stepchild tweener of a system" that wouldn't be supported as advertised into the future.To make it worse, when you install the doorbells it automatically starts a 30 day "Free Trial" of online video storage that you cannot opt out of. By the time that the "Free Trial" expires and you realize hey this isn't working on my "Legacy" but not really Legacy 7200 seconds of free online video storage you are past the 30 day Amazon return window...so screw you. We have stuck you with these useless, non- returnable pieces of crap unless you now pay us $10.00 a month to get what we originally promised you would get subscription free.Seems like a classic case of bait and switch..
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2021

Review Text: I may update this later.  Overall the blink system does what it says it does.  Since I just installed, and am still tweaking, it we will see about the battery life.  This system is very easy to install and set up.  There are instructions in the phone app to assist in mounting the doorbell.  There are a couple of things that are not so great though.  One is the mount for the additional camera.  The one that comes with it is garbage.  It is a friction fit that does not fit.  I wonder how many people have broken it trying to mount the camera.  I found an add on mount here which works very well.The other concern I have is with the motion detection and clip length.  I currently have the motion sensitivity set to 6 for both the doorbell and the camera.  The doorbell does well at picking up motion (i.e. cars driving by) albeit late.  Often the clip will start with the car 3/4 of the way across the view.  The other camera I have mounted on the opposite side of my garage from the doorbell.  There have been multiple instances so far where the doorbell camera picks up and records motion but the additional camera does not.The clip length is adjustable but finite.  The one thing I think would be nice is the option to have the camera continue recording as long as there is motion.  As it is the maximum clip length is 60 seconds with a minimum pause of 10 seconds before it starts again.  I would love the ability to set clip length to 10-15 seconds with the option to keep recording if there is still motion present.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2021

Review Text: TL;DR Actual positives/negatives are below this paragraph.So I purchased this doorbell recently because I currently have two systems at my house; ring and blink. The doorbell I have is ring and so I wanted to make everything I had talk with each other properly and easily. I love the blink outdoor cameras and everything went smooth with them so I decided to replace my current doorbell and go with blink. Turns out, this doorbell is not NEARLY as nice as a ring doorbell. The only issue I have that has nothing to do with my issues with this doorbell but may help someone in the future who is doing the same replacement, is that the holes that mount this doorbell do NOT at ALL line up with the ring doorbell mounting holes. Thus, you will either have to fix holes or figure out how to make them non-visible in your house. So onto the actual review of the doorbell:Positives:- Slick packaging- Nice looking- Easy to set up- Good quality cameraNegatives:- Doorbell overall has a cheap feel to it; has a lot of cheap feeling plastic.- Hard to mount. To mount this correctly, you have to apply a decent amount of downward force to the doorbell. It just made me un-easy trying to do it correctly (even after watching the video).- Very easy for someone to steal. The 'special tool' they give you did absolutely nothing to help me get this off the mount after I heard and felt it snap in. I thought I did something wrong so I removed the mount from my house and engaged everything by itself. I was very easily able to disassemble the doorbell from the mount. This is far from able to be accomplished with my ring doorbell with the security measures they include in the mounting kit.- Gasket material to prevent water intrusion through the screw holes are useless. While I was screwing into the provided wall anchors through the mounting plate, the gasket material easily dislodged itself and was sandwiched between my house and the mounting plate. Might still do the job, but it's not how it's supposed to work.- Does not include mini level for ensuring template is actually level when attempting to drill holes for mounting bracket. This may seem like a petty thing, but the ring doorbell comes with a tiny level to help you make sure your doorbell isn't crooked. With how they tell you to mount this, it has a piece of paper that you eye-up to drill the holes. You'd have to go above and beyond and pre-mark plum/level lines to ensure it's accurate. The ring doorbell includes all the stuff you need to just do this, which eliminates an extra step of the process.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2021

Review Title: Not sure how secure it is, a bit of lag on the video
Review Text: Installed on my porch.  The Blink is located in the corner, so needed the corner mount.  With the corner mount installed, it covers the entire 90 degree field of view.But I'm not sure how secure it is.  Seems you could rip it off with enough effort.  It's not easy, but if you knew how to do it, doesn't seem hard.Plus is, it connected to my XT2 system kit that I bought in 2019.  Connecting it to the app was really easy.Also, doorbell will not work till you calibrate it in the app.  It kept frustrating me, because I kept pushing the button trying to make it work, then rewiring, before mounting everything.Now the bad.  Unlike my XT2 camera and Blink Mini, there seems to be a pretty large delay when the video starts.  As a for instance.  On the Blink Mini, the video seems to start before I see any movement in the video by a second or two.  Same with the XT2.  It'll start recording, before you see any motion.  But on the Doorbell, there seems to be a delay.  For instance, I had the XT2 mounted on the porch.  When an animal passed, the video would start before the animal was even in frame, and video his entire movement past the door.  On the Doorbell, the animal is almost completely out of frame before the video even begins.  This becomes a problem for something that quickly passes.  Especially porch pirates that don't stay long.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2022

Review Text: Please read the entire review.Though you only have to pay as little as $30 per year, and the customer service at Blink (when you finally get through) is awesome, be aware you will have to purchase a membership.  Had they been clear about this upfront, I would have given them a much better rating.They CLAIM:"We want you to knowBlink Video Doorbell Standalone does not include Sync Module 2. Without a Sync Module, live-view and two-way audio are available only in response to a doorbell press or motion event. With a Sync Module or Sync Module 2 get these features anytime on-demand." ~ from seller's listing on Amazon.BUT!  Even with Module 2 and a USB memory stick (which it says NOTHING about), this doorbell does NOT give you the ability to see LIVE who is at your door.  It is NOT like our other cameras (we already had a 5 camera system), and it does NOT allow you to communicate with the person at your door UNLESS you pay the $30.  We initially mounted one of our 5 video cameras at the front door and had a regular doorbell.  That worked perfectly because you could talk to the person at the front door and see them immediately.  We thought we would upgrade, but really it became a downgrade!IF you don't want to pay a $30 subscription fee, purchase a single video camera, mount it at your front door, and use a regular doorbell.  It will be cheaper in the long run.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2021

Review Title: Strange limitations and frustrating to setup
Review Text: So most of my issues are with the app. It is not clear that things are split into "Systems" where cameras sharing a Blink Module need to be in the same system. Within the system, there is not control over scheduling by camera - all cameras in the system follow the same schedule. If you accidentally add a camera to the wrong system, or heaven forbid add the blink module to the wrong system, be prepared for a frustrating stream of repeating steps and mashing reset buttons. It is klunky and poorly thought out to say the least. In addition, the mount plate for the doorbell requires just the right touch. You have to sorta put the top on, slide down and while pushing down push the bottom in. It is an unsatisfactory connection. The camera works fine, the blink module does what it should, and in a surprising find, I was able to program a routine in Alexa to play a chime on my ecobee thermostat with Alexa when the doorbell is pushed.All in, the app and UI needs to be polished and thought thru better.Update: the sync module does not work for storing videos. It recognizes the USB drive and it is connected to wifi with no issues. Just no videos ever get recorded, which makes it a pretty useless brick with a blue and green LED. This system is annoying and frankly, pretty lousy. It seems as if Blink set out with the goal of making things only work with a subscription, but not work at all without it, even with hardware specifically designed for it (supposedly). Quite clever of them actually. But also pretty despicable.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2022

Review Title: I Want To Love This But I Can't
Review Text: I have a Blink system and have been running it for 8 months at the time of this review.  I have 4 cameras and a Sync hub that I use with a flash drive for local storage so I don't have to have a cloud storage subscription.I really want to love this doorbell but it has done nothing it was promised to do since I ordered it.  Day one, out of the box it wasn't recording any motion.  After a lengthy battle with Amazon I was able to return it.  However, I bought it on sale and the price had gone up so after another battle with Amazon I was given a promotion credit on my account to cover the price difference.  The second doorbell was purchased and arrived.  It was doing the same exact thing.  Connecting, saying it was running, but no video recording.  After a back and forth with Blink support via email over the course of a week or so, they finally come back with "Oh, there's an issue with the doorbell and it not recording to local storage. Our engineers are working on a fix."  There solution was to give me a free 30 day cloud subscription.  It's recording but now ALL of my cameras are recording to cloud storage.  Great. It works. However, in 30 days if the doorbell doesn't have a firmware fix yet, what am I suppossed to do?  Contact support and see if they'll extend my free days for another free 30 days.  I went with the local storage option so I wouldn't have to pay for an annual subscription.  I feel like this "issue" is just a way of Blink trying to get more people to go with a Cloud subscription.Additionally, I still cannot get it to display to my Echo Show.  But that's a hill I haven't been willing to battle yet given everything else I've already went through with just getting the doorbell to do basic functions.If they ever get the doorbell functioning to where it will work and record to local storage, I'll update this review.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2022

Review Title: Needs good WiFi signal, and watch that WiFi channel assignment!
Review Text: Updated rating from 3 to 4 after I made some WiFi network adjustments.After I have not extended my cloud subscription trial and opted out for local storage option, this system started to have recurring issues with recording video clips. The system at some point would just stop recording. After call to customer service, the problem was diagnosed to be an unreliable WiFi issue. I troubleshooted some more on my own and figured that my WiFi will sometimes get stuck on a channel that has a lot of contention (traffic) which affects the transmission speed. This is a router problem in the end, however I think problem like that make this system very unreliable as a security camera, if you have no subscription plan.  Makes me also wonder, why these WiFi issues didn't have any negative effect while the trial cloud subscription was still active? All the clips were recorded to the cloud with no hiccup when the subscription was active. After using WiFi analyzer tool, I have identified the best channel to use and assigned that channel to my WiFi network, since my router's algorithm  couldn't pick a good channel, when set in Auto mode. The system worked fine since then. With no cloud subscription plan, you can opt to store your recorded clips locally on a flash drive. You will still be able to receive notifications and play your files in Blink app., even when your phone with Blink app. installed is out of the range of your WiFi, which is good. That means, cloud is still used to rely notifications and retrieve content, just not for storage.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2022

Review Text: Let's start with the fact that the Blink app does NOT work on fire 10 HD tablets.  When trying to login, it provides a 6 digit code texted to my phone BUT no way to enter the code because the app simply shuts down before the screen comes up to put the code in.  I have uninstalled and reinstalled the app three times to no avail.  Same problem every time.Next is the fact that you can not even watch the camera very long beofor it shuts down.  I am trying to use it to keep an eye on mail arriving so that packages don't get stolen ...and since the motion detection only notifies you but does not open the camera, you have to keep saying "Alexa open the camera, Alexa open the camera, Alexa open the camera, Alexa open the camera, Alexa open the camera, Alexa open the camera..." every 30 to 60 seconds.  Where is the ability to just open the camera and it stays open until you close it?Night vision is kinda generic.  Most night vision cameras (of decent quality) provide a no-shadow effect that also prevent high glare.  The light glares off of anything reflective to the point where the rest of the image fades out and is blurry or unable to be seen.It's a waste of money in my opinion and ready for the garbage when the new camera system arrives.  I wouldn't even curse anyone by giving them this for free.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2022

Review Text: I have had the blink doorbell and two wireless outdoor cameras for about 3 months now, and i am extremely disappointed.first of all, you are not getting enough value for your money. these cameras aren’t that much better than some of the really cheap $20 ones you can find on here.secondly, the app IS HORRIBLE. I have fiber high speed internet, i will be the only person home and this app takes at least 10-30 seconds to load the camera on my phone. sometimes even longer than that.third, the night vision is TERRIBLE outside. there’s this giant glare in the camera and you can see the lens?? even when no outside lights are on. some kid was throwing rocks at my front door in the middle of the night and you can’t make him out AT ALL because of how crappy this camera quality is. if you’re extremely upclose or it’s daytime it’s fine. but night time.. NOPE.also, the reason i am leaving this review, it said it spotted someone on one of my wireless outdoor cameras. i go to open the app and it just signs me out and will not sign me back in. just keeps saying error. imagine if this was an intruder?? imagine if this was a threat that was trying to hurt me or my children? luckily it wasn’t. i wish i could give less than 1 star. definitely does not give me the peace of mind i was hoping for. look elsewhere
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2022

Review Title: Complete garbage clarity, mobile app and operation overall
Review Text: I seriously do not understand why this camera has so many good reviews when it’s really a pathetic competitor to Ring. Amazon owns both companies so I also don’t get why they decided to launch a competing product against an already insanely good doorbell and security camera system. Yes, it’s cheaper than Ring but the difference in clarity both day and night, motion detection, other security features and the mobile app UX, make it worth the few extra dollars to get any Ring doorbell product. If you already dropped $90 on the Blink doorbell system, you CAN shell out another $30 for Ring.  You want to be cheap, then you get what you pay for.The mobile app is unbelievably glitchy and clunky to use. It’s difficult to find things or adjust settings. Even after you have things set up how you’d like, they don’t work.The biggest issue is motion detection. I had it set to 10/10 for sensitivity and it doesn’t pick up anything. Doesn’t record or save as promised to the cloud, only doorbell events. The tenant that lives next door, and our doorways are adjacent and we share the same stairway, was never triggering the motion detection. We then had a robbery next door, camera was pointing in the exact direction of my neighbor, and it didn’t catch/record anything. This was during the day. I wouldn’t count on this to deter any package stealers either. Not like you’d see anything recorded when or if it does happen to you.I have the Ring doorbell system at another rental and it’s light years better than Blink. I thought I’d try out this new competitor to it that was slightly cheaper, but I’m am sorry I wasted my time and money in the end. I will be returning it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2022

Review Text: A very nice addition to my home, with one exception...I could not use the wired option.  It came fast to the house, was easy to add it to the Blink application, and attaching it to the house was a breeze.  Again, the wired option was an issue.  I connected the back of the doorbell plate and there is power from the transformer, but once the doorbell was installed, no power to it.  After about 2 hours of frustration, I decided to use the batteries, ONLY knowing how long the camera will last with the lithium batteries (about 1.3 years).  I will work with Blink and HOPEFULLY we can get it working with wired...then I will update this review.  Overall, another really good Blink product!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2022

Review Title: Very happy with the performance so far
Review Text: I purchased this and have been using it for a couple of months now. It was easy to set up and install. Based on the 2 months of use so far, it has performed up to my expectations. I get timely recordings of activities and the pressing of the doorbell.The ability to edit and  block certain areas from the motion detection is great as my wife likes to fly various decorative/holiday flags from the front door and I can eliminate false alerts, caused by those flags moving, by adjusting the areas that are picked up. I can also eliminate cars going up the street if I want to yet still detect someone walking on the sidewalk in front of our place.It has a nice angle of view the essentially covers my entire front yard.Since it is integrated with my Alexa devices I can call the camera up and view my front doorstep on any of my Echo Shows at any time. Plus all my Alexa devices notify me of a doorbell press.Full disclosure, I have subscribed to the cloud service at $30 yr. This is not a requirement to use the doorbell, but if you want to save all "activity" it is reasonable for the added functionality. There is limited functionality without the subscription service.This device has met all my expectations. I am considering replacing my other security cameras with blink as well.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2022

Review Text: $35 currently for the Blink doorbell unit only vs $60 for the Ring Wired (both amazon owned)We already have installed a Blink outdoor cam system so adding the Blink Doorbell was a no brainer.  And just in case we purchased a Ring Wired if the Blink unit was a fail - it is not.I have a wired doorbell now (house was built in '89) so install as a wired unit was pretty easy - I did also order and needed both the wedge and angle pieces (sold separately) Follow the instructions and easy peasy - done.When "Armed" motion detected will prompt your echo devise to say - Motion detected @ door bell or something(?)When Armed OR Disarmed and Doorbell button is pressed - My wired doorbell rings, the unit chimes, my phone chimes AND Echo devise states some is @ your doorbell(?)  so so far very happy.BLINK DOES NOT INTEGRATE WITH SMARTTHINGS - Ring DOES - this in not an issue for me.  about the only good thing of our Ring when we had it was its integration as a motion detector (Ring Pro) video was excellent but the latency was horrible and it's what 4-5x the cost of Blink.if you have Ring cams and need a doorbell - get the Ring (wired seems to be the best option now, or Pro)if you blink cams - get the Blink doorbellgood luck!

Review Title: Decent camera, has become useless as batteries don't last
Review Text: I've been a Blink user for many years and still have several devices around my home. It made sense to look into the doorbell as well since it would easily integrate into the existing system. Installing and mounting was pretty straight forward. The view angle is great as it captures the whole front of my property with a pretty clear picture. At night however, the images get blown out. I have a Blink camera at the top of my driveway and the IR light, in conjunction with this the doorbell IR causes the image to get blown out.The BIGGEST complain however is the battery life. I installed the camera on 12/18/2021. On 1/17/2022 the batteries died. On 2/18/2022 the new batteries died again. I only used the recommended Energizer Lithium batteries. I've reduced sensitivity and recording length and it had no impact on battery life. There is no possible way that these would EVER last 2 years as they state. At this pace changing the batteries so frequently will end up weakening the backing plate over time and at some point I see the possibility of the device no longer holding to it. Not to mention the additional cost of the batteries, which are not cheap.When contacting Blink, their solution was to uninstall the device from the app and reinstall. When that did not work, they said to put it on a reduced schedule. That completely defeats the purpose of the device. We have it so that we can see what goes on in the neighborhood, especially as car break-ins are on the rise.Blink needs to come up with a way to externally power this device, similar to their cameras. Whether it be via AC power or solar.** MISSED OPPORTUNITY BY BLINK **
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2022

User Name: Allen Tiffany, author of Youth In Asia, a Vietnam War novella
Review Title: Can NOT remotely RESET SYNC Module
Review Text: Why are you buying a security camera system? If your buying it, to be secure while you are AT home, or only leave, and are within a few miles and /or going home soon then, this product is for you. It's easy to set up. Good quality video's and good price point. If however you ever have plans for a vacation, or leaving for any amount of time further away, DO NOT GET THIS SYSTEM. If your Sync Module goes OFFLINE, for any reason. Most likely a power outage or WI-Fi goes down, system is suppose to reconnect. It does NOT. And this is the most important point. You CAN NOT RESET IT FROM FAR AWAY. So if you have a vacation home,or have gone out of town. Your system is WORTHLESS! YOU CAN NOT REMOTELY, RESET the Sync Module 2. So be especially cautious, if you live in an area, that has frequent power outages or WI-Fi goes offline often. BLINK DOES NOT tell you this anywhere in their literature. They do NOT mention it in their FAQ section on Sync Module 2. If you can show me where this information is in any of their Support/Troubleshooting literature, you win a Detective of the Year Award!When the system is up and running it works great. Just pray the system doesn't go offline when your AWAY. It's worthless and basically your unprotected. I want a refund.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2022

Review Title: A Great Starter Video Doorbell for a Reasonable Price
Review Text: I like that it was easy to setup and reasonably easy install. I wanted a basic doorbell system to see if this kind of thing will work for me. I did have some difficulty with affixing the camera to the backplate and experienced minor difficulty removing the camera from the backplate.  It would be great if there was a more affordable antitheft case option.  I believe doorbell camera theft is a real risk.  The option to use this system without a monthly subscription is important to me.  Pairing the Sync Module 2 with your camera enables features such as local video clip storage and and live camera views without a subscription.  Alexa integration could be improved.  I can easily arm the system with an Alexa command, but disarming it is more complex, I suppose for security reasons. Also, it would seem a natural extension of Alexa to allow a single command to enable both Alexa Guard and arming the Blink doorbell.  Alexa routines are unnecessarily complex to set up. Some of the online reviews are critical and point to other more expensive systems.  I disagree.  I paid $59 for both the doorbell camera and the sync module during a special promotion.  This system does exactly what I expect of a lower tier system.  Likewise, I don't expect an economy vehicle to drive or perform like a high end luxury model.  Both do their job as expected.  I'm very satisfied and would buy it again.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2022

Review Text: Prepare to Hard Wire‼️‼️‼️ Doesn’t matter what it says, if you want this to ring inside the house you HAVE TO HARD WIRE IT!!  Settings: privacy & Activity Zones: Aarrgghhh‼️ If you live on a street that has traffic prepare to black out half the screen where cars go by, or you’ll have 97,143 recordings by the end of the day. Set the sensitivity any lower, and 10 people could load your house into a U-Haul and you’d never know! Your choice is dings all day or no coverage at all. Have fun with Alexa.  She’s going to tell you you’re “Not connected to the internet at this time” when you have 99 bars, and your holding your router while running a speed test showing just how connected you are.  And I thought Siri was stupid. The picture & sound lag, even in live view, the sound and visual quality are fantastic, though! I have this connected through my Blink Indoor/Outdoor System w/ an Echo 5. Changed Echo’s name from Alexa to Echo right Away so my Alexa App/iPhone and Alexa on Echo didn’t both try to answer me when I said ‘Alexa, I’m Leaving.’  I like having it, but I didn’t think it would be such a pain!!  I really liked catching my HoRrIbLe Mail Man throwing my mail all over the ground and street & showing the Postmaster. After 3 years of complaints, he finally had the day he deserved.  Enjoy your doorbell, hard wire it, Watch live view for entertainment, … Oh super easy to install and sync, no instructions so find a video!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2022

Review Text: I mistakenly believed that this would integrate well with my Echo Show device in a way that when someone rang the doorbell, the picture would automatically pop up on the Show device... That is not the case.  The audio alert comes quickly however and the phone notification comes quickly but it's still awkward to have to manually "summon" the camera to show you who is at the door.  That's just one of my disappointments.  Beyond that, why does the chime ring LOUDLY outside when someone rings the bell?  They don't need to hear it, I do!  Yet inside the house,  the ding is softer on both the echo show and the cell phone, and if you aren't in the same room as either of those devices, you are not going to hear it!  So overall it is an ill conceived device that has many shortcomings.  Unlike many, I did not have any mounting issues, but then I am handy with tools.  However for the price I will keep it for use as an additional on demand security camera, that works on same app as my Blink xt2 Cameras.  In fact it is at a  lower price point than the individual wireless Blink  outdoor cameras anyway, and does the same thing from what I see.  But it's pretty worthless as a "video doorbell,"  because its too much trouble to bring up the video or still picture.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2021

Review Text: With high expectation and good experience with Blink's products, the unit came in with backplate that cannot snap easily with the unit, huge disappointment, initially. Then, we decided to contact Blink's Support Dept., and surprisingly, the responses from Blink were prompt and to the point of solving the issues at hand. Kudos to their customer service dept.. A 5 Stars Dept..  We discovered, after receiving a few models of backplates from Blink, we found the most basic one with no weather wrap protection fits our doorbell unit the best and easily reinstalled with no issue. To our surprise also, the Blink's doorbell camera angle is much wider and exceed the spectrum of the older ones than we had and can take good quality videos with harder to reach corners of our front porch easily viewable, an excellent feature of this camera for the doorbell. Highly Recommended. Then, Blink's rep. Haitham and Amera also offered added advises to add function of the doorbell with a separate sync module that will expand the features already in place for the doorbell unit.  Recommend getting the extra sync module unit for more great functions to record and arm features.
