Kudos to their C.S. Dept...thanks.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2021

Review Text: Brought this over from my Blink Mini review.I'm at a loss. We've had two different "pet" cameras for a similar cost (the mini alone), and while they've had their issues leading to me looking else where after a bit of use, Blink is just as bad in its own way.Mini was for indoor use, and doorbell was for outdoor (less about the doorbell, more about finally having a camera that works at night) plus needing the sync module that came with it. I didn't want to get trapped in their subscription so I cancelled the trial immediately to know what it would look like with the sync module and local storage. It's kind of weird that it's a USB when, again, cheaper pet cameras have better SD card options but I'll take what I can get here to try. Plenty of people have covered how it's a ploy to get you to have their subscription that you can't record live view (ie, you get a notification about motion, watch it, someone's breaking into your house, but because you're watching it live it doesn't save) but I didn't get my cameras for notifications. We have too much street traffic for motion detection to matter.That being said, I do WANT motion detection. But the doorbell doesn't do this consistently for humans in the least, and the Mini won't stay connected to the internet long enough to watch even me walk inside. All the cars when I had the doorbell out front? Totally. The raccoon that walked two feet in front of it? Super delayed on when it started to record, but sure. When I walk in my own drive way? Nah. I have to be moving the camera to be recorded. I drove ALL THE WAY up my driveway (it's long) and it didn't start recording until my car was already halfway in the garage. I get that some of the issue may have to do with "battery saving", but I feel like I'm asking for the bare minimum when it comes to proper recordings.The Wi-Fi connection also almost makes no sense to me, specifically for the Mini. The doorbell has worked on the front door, and on the garage which again is looong and quite a ways from the house. But the Mini? Works in one place in the house. And not even at the halfway point of what the doorbell works with. Even the cheapo pet cameras I mentioned had better Wi-fi connectivity in ALL the positions I tried in the house.I think the Mini probably has a chance of recording more consistently than the Doorbell, but the Doorbell is the one that stays connected to the Wi-fi. Like I'm considering using the doorbell inside when we go places (I literally haven't bothered mounting it with how much inconsistency there's been). But I really finally wanted something for outside, too.I'm tired. I'm not even someone totally needing this for feeling like our house is safe and yet it IS supposed to be a security system. For me it's more to keep an eye on neighbors who keep using our yard for stuff but I would really, really love something that works for peace of mind for the unknown, too. I just don't think that with all our technology, it exists for a reasonable cost.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2022

Review Text: I have 4 cameras and the door bell and they all have the same issue uploading and delay. I made sure they all have as much connection to WiFi and the little blink module yet as you can see in the pictures they have full connection to both.Had the cameras for about two years and the door bell for a few months. this past year they been so bad.. replaced batteries, reset system, updates as much as possible and it just got worse with every update. Makes me wonder if they purposely make stuff fail so they want you to buy their new equipment. NEVER AGAIN.Whatever happened with the updates this whole system is terrible. There is 1 to 5 minute delay in alerts or even trying to view live video which, rarely works, making it pointless. Non of the cameras record longer than 1 second even though it’s selected to record 10s. I cannot wait to replace this system and never will I ever buy a product from them again.Not only do they barely record they also have terrible playback and sometime don’t record anything. Please refer to pictures.  I cannot stress how terrible experience I have with this and I even pay for the yearly service. I’m going to SimpliSafe because I haven’t had any issues with them for my other security system.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2022

Review Text: I got this video doorbell a few weeks ago. Tonight I heard someone smack my front door and try the door handle. I checked the app, and saw a man who was not in a sane state of mind had come to my door. I also saw that the same man had come to my door 35 minutes prior (I didn’t receive a notification about that even though I have motion detection turned on, so that’s an issue with the Blink app). I called the police, and when the cops arrived, I was able to show them the videos I had of the man so they could see what he was wearing (or not wearing since the man removed his tshirt between the first and second visits to my door), and see his behavior. I was home alone when the man came to my door, and the whole ordeal was terrifying. But having the doorbell take video so I could see the man without having to open my door or interact with him in any way, and being able to provide video evidence to the cops was a really good thing in the middle of a terrible situation. As the title of the review states, I’m so glad I have this.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2022

Review Text: I would give a 3.5 if I could. I just couldn't say it was a 4 star but it is just a tiny bit better than average. 4 star to me means very solid and I'm nitpicking on some small issues but the motion detection at night and unable to change volume separately are pretty big issues to me.Pros:- much cheaper than Ring doorbell- integrates pretty easy with Alexa- Simple to add to my existing Blink account- nice wide angle viewCons:*** Unable to control ringing volume separately on an Echo device, like you would with an alarm. It seriously needs this feature. I set it up for my father and he has a hard time hearing the chime. ***- like the Blink outdoor camera, its night time motion detection is very limited, like within 10-15ft- sometimes when depressing button, it does not ring even though you felt the click so needs a more robust push. Hopefully that doesn't mean this will break soon.- having to use a black mount on a white doorbell. Overall, it doesn't look too bad but I can't believe they do not offer the mounts in white.Wishlist:Control volume of chime on the doorbell itselfChange chime on the doorbell itselfBetter motion detection at nightUpdate:A representative from Blink was kind enough to reach out due to my review and even offered the white corner mount sent to me at no cost. I refused as it is already mounted, doesn't look too bad and there is no reason to throw more plastic away but it was much appreciated. They also said you can now control the chime volume on the doorbell itself which is great. The only thing left for me is to be able to control separately the volume of the doorbell on the Echo devices. I added a star for the response and also being realistic for what I am getting for just 35 bucks.Overall a good value and the doorbell has been helpful in alerting to package deliveries, something we didn't have for over a year since dropping Vivint.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2021

Review Text: Update: received a new one, works so far. Sadly the Blue Ring Light doesn't stay on at night like you would assume it would. Even when WIRED (so has nothing to so with battery life) to a 16V AC 30VA transformer (Ring one). Hopefully a new firmware update can happen to rectify this and I will increase my stars happily.The mounting wasn't as hard as I thought it would be. Total installation time for .e was 5 minutes, 1.5 minutes of that was the mount. I wasn't trying to break this thing, so I wasn't putting in the necessary amount of force it required until at the end, I was like, well here goes nothing and it clicked finally. But I thought I was going to break it with how hard I was pushing down.It was working pretty well for a few days and but for some reason it only did one announcement via Alexa, and then never again. Slowly it stopped doing motion sensing, then I couldn't do thumbnails and finally couldn't do live views. So it was basically dead. Tried replacing batteries and refreshing via the app (updating), got some strange "command not found" errors, then just deleted it and asked for a replacement.I'll update if my new one works better. Hopefully,  QA did their job with my replacement.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2021

Review Title: Easy to set up, hard to install
Review Text: I would like to preface this review with the fact that I might have made the install a bit hard for myself by attempting to place the device too close to my siding. However before I tried to install the device, I was trying to put it together on my desk and was struggling to get the clips of the front part of the device to clip onto the back. At the time, I figured it was just too hard to do without the back screwed into a wall but it was just as hard during the install and I was constantly concerned that I was forcing the clips too hard such that they would break or I was not forcing it hard enough for them to catch especially after I pulled the device off my wall without the security tab the first time.The device seems to work great as I get a notification each time I ring the bell from the app, but I am concerned how long the batteries will last and how will I replace the batteries when they die out considering how much I struggled to install it the first time. Add the fact that you have to pay a monthly fee to save clips in the cloud or buy a sync module and deal with the laggy communication and this doorbell will only serve secondary door duty as I would never use this doorbell for my main door.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2021

Review Title: Unlike the Ring doorbell it won’t show the live view on the echo show automatically.
Review Text: I would’ve given five stars if it wasn’t for the lack of automatic live view on the echo show when the doorbell was pressed. It notifies that there’s someone at the door but it won’t show the live view unless you ask Alexa show me the doorbell. This is so odd when one amazon company (Ring) can do it while another (Blink) can’t. I might have to put my Ring doorbell back on the door.Edit: After I contacted blink support they reached out to me and as I requested the live view to be automatically shown on Amazon echo the representative mentioned "I am sure, you will see improvement in the near future". So I am hopeful that a software update will fix it. So I have increased my rating from 1 star to 3 stars as other than the live view this product is pretty good. It even lets me use my analog door chime which Ring wired doesn't. If I see a software update that fixes this live view issue I will then change my rating to 5 stars.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2021

Review Title: Used to love Blink Products, but not this! Too much Pay-to-Play!
Review Text: Purchased this after having a Blink XT camera system for a few years. While I love the Blink doorbell itself, Amazon has lost their marbles with their new "Pay-to-Play" business model. Bottom line, this camera will not record video unless you have a Blink Subscription (currently around $30 a year) AND you cannot set arm/disarm schedules unless you purchase and link it to a sync module. ALSO - you cannot link one camera to two separate Blink accounts, therefore all family members have to use the same account....The camera itself is great and the wired integration to my existing doorbell and power supply worked flawlessly. Unfortunately, Amazon's money-grabbing ways backs the capabilities of this camera into a corner, so it's really only useful if someone walks up to it, pushes the button, and you immediately pick up your wireless device to see who is at the door. Unless you buy into their subscriptions, the camera won't save any recordings, so if you aren't home and someone rings the door bell, you have to catch the app notification immediately or you'll never know who it was.Disgusting to say the least - disappointed in Amazon and will no longer be purchasing Blink products.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2022

Review Text: We had a Ring Doorbell camer as well as the flood/security camrea and decided to give Blink a try. Our main reason for switching was the ability to integrate it with Alexa. We had an older first gen doorbell, so it wasn't compatible. For the price, we could get more cameras from Blink than go with Ring. Our Ring camera batteries were starting to constantly drain within 30 days. We had bought replacement batteries at $30 each and they were still running down just as fast. Blink does not have the people detector that Ring has, but for us this wasn't a big factor. We are concerned about any motion activity regardless. The first thing we noticed is that the field of view is a little more zoomed in on the doorbell camera than wht the Ring was, which is great because we can get a clearer view of faces. The sound quality is so much better. The installation was so simple and quick! We have ordered two more cameras from Blink and the Alexa Show so we can utilize that functionality as well. The subscription plan is the same cost as what Ring is for unlimited cameras, which was another reason why we decided to go with Blink. We would recommend this product if you are looking for a decently priced doorbell camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2021

Review Title: I really wanted to love this
Review Text: I ordered this because I have 3 Blink Cameras and a subscription already that could support more.  I also had  Ring subscription for my OG Ring Doorbell and figured I could save some $$$.Nice product - look and feel.  Easy install, for those that complained about how hard it was to snap the doorbell to the back plate - try a little silicon grease on the seal.  Snaps right on.The Good -  great picture and it rings the old school doorbell.  That's really about it I guess its a solid value for ~$50.  But...The Bad - it hooks up to the house wiring, but does NOT use that as a power source!? That makes no sense.  As I said I have 3 blink sec cameras on a dusk to dawn schedule.  Well after adding the doorbell, I assumed you could create different schedule.  You can't, so I ether have my door bell only armed at night :-/ or I have the other 3 cameras armed all day (and get a TON of movement notifications)  - Neither works.  Lastly, they include a little "special key" to remove the doorbell (remember you will have to change the batteries!).  Well a small screwdriver works just as well, so not really a key and some one could steal your door bell.These limitations may be fine for others it wasn't for me.Anyway - Like I said I really wanted this to work, but its going back and I am upgrading to a newer Ring.UPDATE 11/16/21 - I have upped this to 4 stars based on customer service and support(via email, the phone guys are trying but reading from a document so no real knowledge).  They couldn't fix any of the issues above, but did help solve the motion schedule issue(you need a 2nd Sync2 module).  They have been awesome at communication and when I had an issue with pink image sent a replacement in a day!and Yes I decided to keep it, for the back door.  The front (sorry to say) has a Ring Pro.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2021

Review Text: What a POS - one star is wayyyyy too generous!  The idea is great, but ability to deliver is a complete joke.  Bought this doorbell to go with our little bevy of Blink cameras.  Had no problem with install and adding to our grouping.  As suggested, put it in Sync Module mode without any trouble.The issue is - when someone rings the doorbell there is a couple second delay in sending a notification to our devices.  Not a big issue you say? Wrong.  Then the little counter spins indefinitely while it tries to connect to the camera/doorbell so you can (1) Actually see who is at the door and (2) have a two way communication with your guest.  After many experimentations - the quickest we could get our devices to connect to the doorbell was a full 2 minutes.  Not sure about you, but I'm not waiting on someone's doorstep longer than 20 seconds.  By the time we made the connection - the person and their car would have been long gone.Just troubleshoot you say?  Should be a simple fix?  Another big Debbie-Downer.  There website is written for a five year old.  Their FAQ's cover nothing more than the basics you get for install.  Their online customer support is non-existent - they are "experiencing a large volume of enquiries" - read: their product is so crappy everyone who has one is trying to get it work like advertised.If you don't mind spending a lot for a useless and pretty uncreative door decoration - be my guest!  But if you were expecting a doorbell that actually allows you to see and communicate with who is at your door (and as advertised) pass on this POS product!  Particularly disappointed that I have two big screw holes on my beautiful wooden door - shame on me for making assumptions...
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2022

Review Title: DONT BUY: Amazon won’t backup replacing, bad quality, poor Integration choices
Review Text: Bought it. Set it up. Blink app is slow and clunky. Video feed was slow and app crashed.I also can’t for example just have echo play a doorbell sound( setting up  from the device gear in Alexa app), it has to be accompanied by Alexa speaking and announcing someone is at the “front door”.Setting up the routine is equally frustrating and Blink website instructions only tell you to setup a routine using “message”. I believe this is because if you try and setup an Alexa routine with a sound you can only choose 1 echo (which isnt good for anyone that wants to hear it at multiple locations like basement or bedroom in a house.So… I also bought this on Black Friday special and it arrived with broken backplate tabs. Amazon will NOT honor their replacement terms and would only offer to refund $60 even though the same product and package is available on Amazon. Customer service would only state they do not have the option to provide the promised replacement, so I have to buy the now $85 unit with a $60 refund.The above in my opinion really shows how I will be treated when buying amazon products such as blink from now on.Buyer Beware!!!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2022

Review Text: Updated, AGAIN.  I purchased a total of 7 new Blink cameras. 3 solar units, two Floodlights and 2 new Doorbell Cams. I had been a long time Arlo user but wanted to upgrade my system. What I ended up doing was downgrading and introducing problems into my home security system. In the month that I’ve had these AWS/Blink servers have gone down 3 times causing the cameras to be completely non functional, one time for an entire day. That’s unacceptable in and of itself. Since these outages the lag time has been terrible, taking anywhere from 6+ seconds to load a cameras live stream or timing out completely. When you receive an alert and try to view the camera live by the time it decides to load any activity will have likely already passed by the camera. All cameras have both full WiFi signal and full signal to the sync module so it’s not an issue on my side of things. This morning I noticed one of my Solar units said the batteries needed to be replaced (the expensive Lithium AA batteries). This specific Solar camera is in a position that gets sun any time it’s out and is also in the least activity area, only receiving maybe 1-2 alerts a day and other days 0 alerts. I’m not sure if the rechargeable battery inside is bad, the Solar panel doesn’t work or what but I’ve had enough with the problems in the very short amount of time I’ve had this system.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2021

Review Text: I don’t have any complaints that are dealbreakers at this price point. I wanted a doorbell which is what I got. I like that it can be connected to the echo show and alerts you that someone is at the door. Seems to be much quicker than the blink camera that was in the same area to alert you of motion. Especially the app. Alexa has a slight delay. If someone pushes the button, the Alexa  announcement is a couple seconds behind. The app takes you straight to live view if the notification is tapped and you are able to catch someone and talk to them before they walk away. Setting up a routine with the echo show will automatically open live view too if you choose. A little slower but not bad. Much faster then asking Alex to show you.Yes, getting the doorbell attached to the mounting plate took a minute to figure out but figure that’s not a bad thing. At least it’s secure.  People are a little dark in the video so assume some front light would help offset all of the backlight but you can make people out.I haven’t had any other video doorbell and understand there’s others that have more bells and whistles. I also don’t have a regular doorbell either so adding this to a system I already have that is much cheaper than the others and alerts me when someone pushes the button is great!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2021

Review Text: I like the cost but its so delayed. I have REALLY high speed internet and I have it located just about 5 feet from my router and it still lags, someone rings my doorbell and theyre gone by the time I open the door because it takes so long to notify me 🤣 the battery life i cheap and Ive modified the settings to extend the life as much as possible. The camera will cath movement reaally late and all I can see is when the person is almost off of my property and I have it centered to my driveway and the other on my doorway. I'm sure if I would have invested more money I would have goen a better product but Im good with what I have, definitely scares off potential porch pirates.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2022

Review Title: Requires Subscription plan for recording even with Sync & USB
Review Text: Blink is really well thought out, and as of 12/2021 the app seems to do what it's supposed to do. I have all brand new 12/21 devices. A Doorbell, two outdoor cams, two sync 2 modules, and 3 indoor cams. The nightvision on the outdoor is meh, it works, but it's not great. Plants reflect a lot of the IR and makes it hard to see past the reflection. It's battery powered, so what do you want? Overall I would say I like the Blink system, but my headline is my number one gripe. I bought this expecting that I would be able to record to the USB drive connected to the sync 2 module for free. THIS IS NOT THE CASE. You MUST pay for a subscription plan to record. There is a free plan, but that only includes live view, and motion ALERTS. NO RECORDING. Doesn't matter if you have the sync module with a USB drive or not, all new cameras must have a subscription plan to record. 10 bucks a month for unlimited cameras. I don't know if it's worth it honestly. The motion detection doesn't really put it in that subscription price range for me. I would rather have one of the actual alarm options out there for around the same price.  I probably will just stick with the free plan, or I may even return them. I'm not sure yet. I'm going to look at the other options out there.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2021

Review Text: This is a very simple setup, ...identical to any other blink cameras you may have.  If you don't have blink cameras, they are quite simple to install and adjust settings,...to include sensitivity.  I don't use Alexa, so I can't answer any Q's on that.The unit synced right up once I scanned the QR code.  I used the existing wiring from the push button only doorbell, which screws onto the back of this unit.  Adjusting the activation time so the chime cycled completely was easy and adjusting the motion is again, just like a standard blink camera.Mounting the camera may require a bit of mechanical skill if you have never used a hammer drill on concrete/stucco finishes to install the anchors.  But, your previous door bell screw holes may line up?In my pic, you can see this unit is smaller than my previous designer doorbell plate mounts.  I just need to do a bit of paint touch up.  **Note: Just a suggestion, you receive a small release tool to undo the unit from the mount to change the 2 batteries (provided).  Simply use a ziplock sandwich bag, mark it, and put it in a close by drawer.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2022

Review Text: First let me say this, the package arrived 1 day earlier than expected. I’m not tech savvy but the instructions help me get me through the setup. I missed the step about how to synchronize the doorbell with my existing door chime so I was bummed. I retraced the steps and realized I missed a step and redid the setup. After synching my doorbell with the door chime it all worked. I didn’t need to have the existing doorbell installed. Don’t forget to go pay through the setup and SAVE YOUR SETTINGS. Mounting on a flat surface was a cinch. No problems as it was stated in other reviews. When I refer you o instructions, I’m referring to the instructions in the online setup, not paper instructions. All in all the setup was easy and the quality is what I was looking for in a doorbell camera. In my opinion it beats the more expensive Ring version. I’ve since added to three more cameras to the house and the quality and performance is superb. The only cons are you can only view through one camera at a time and I haven’t been able to share the live videos on more than one phone. If anybody knows how this can be done let me know.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2021

Review Text: I bought 2 blink camera and a doorbell. I've used Nest and Ring in the past.  Upon setting it up, I had issues with the app on my phone and was not able to use it. I called Blink twice and no one answered, rather it sent me to a voicemail both times and asked that I leave my info and someone would call me back which they never did. I sent an email regarding the same issue and did not hear back from that either.  So I set it up on a friend's phone just to get it up and running since I was about to leave town and needed the camera service on while I was gone.  The day I left the cameras all went out and I could not see them on my app (which I set up and figured out without any help from Blink who never returned my calls).  After a whole day of the camera being off, we called again and finally spoke with someone. They said I had to be home to reset the device for them to be turned on.  How unfortunate for me though, I bought them and installed them just in time for me to not be home to reset anything.  I've used Nest for about 7 years and in all that time they have not gone out once that I needed to be at my house to reset them.  So these security cameras that are suppose to help you monitor your property when you are away or asleep may just go out and you'll need to be present to fix them....and then, good luck getting a hold of anyone there when you do need help.  Terrible cameras!!!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2021

Review Text: Since I already had blink cameras and an extra sync module it made sense to go with the blink doorbell. I read all the reviews both good and bad and decided to purchase.ProsInstallation was straight forward. Easy to follow steps on the app.Setup for everything is done on app and easy to modify if needed*was concerned about the reviews that said you have to remove the seal to get the bell to lock into place. I discovered it is a two hand process. You have to press firmly on the top and bottom of the bell and slide it down.Also was concerned about the mention of it being plastic mounting brackets. We live in Florida so it won’t take long to be destroyed by the sun if it’s going to be.Cons:Even though it is wired it still requires batteries. Last Honeywell doorbell didn’t require batteries.No way to turn off one thing attached to sync module. It’s all on or off. Consider this if you have cameras.No option to record continuously. Being battery operated it wouldn’t last long, but other blink items are plugged in and still no option.Overall I have been happy with my blink cameras and doorbell. For the price and easy of use it was worth the investment.

Review Text: I've been part of the blink ecosystem for a long time, and always wanted a video doorbell, but i didn't want to have to deal with two apps and get one from [the other guys]. So glad this finally launched.Installation was super quick and easy. I have mine wired into the original doorbell, so it runs off wired power and uses my physical chime box that came with the house. Video quality is just like the XT2 or Mini cameras, and it's super responsive.  Build quality feels nice.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2021

Review Title: Beware-- they want you to pay a subscription for the doorbell
Review Text: The cameras work fine with the local storage (i.e. the sync module). However, for the doorbell, they will want you to pay one of the plans or you will be greeted with the message:"The doorbell is not recording because you do not have a blink storage plan"This is of course unless you have a plan from April 2020.The other aspect is that the motion detection is not very good, it misses the first 5 or 7 seconds of action...this is true for the cameras as well. If you think about it, 5 seconds is a long time when recording a video (count from 1 to 5 Mississippi) . So for the most part I am catching the back of the delivery person (or potential thieves) -- It seems like a nice and stylish product...but I think I am returning the whole thing.- I was not expecting the performance hit or the forceful payment schema form Amazon --All the bestGCUpdate:After trial and error, I realized that you should add the doorbell to your existing system (if you have the cameras) and not create a new one, unless you have a different module.That will allow the videos to be saved to the USB card
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2021

Review Title: Great doorbell camera and easy to set up
Review Text: I added the doorbell camera to my Blink XT2 system without too much trouble.  I read that getting the back on after mounting is a bit of a hassle and noticed that it is offset about a 1/4 inch or so into the frame.  I used some weather stripping to push the doorbell frame away from wall about a 1/4 inch and it worked pretty well.  Took a bit a maneuvering to slip on and off, but since I wired mine I won't have to take it off very much and not worried bout it.  The camera acts pretty much like the cameras do, so I was familiar enough to set it up quick.  It is a bit late on motion detection when the object is straight on, but my yard is setup that side to side would be most likely route.  I already had a camera on the door, and I have just left it along with the doorbell.  This get my coverage much better than just one and works for me.  The doorbell is better for communicating than what the camera is and the camera does a better job of picking up movement and some aspects of clarity.  All in all, I am happy with Blink Xt2 and the new doorbell I added.  The pics show the bell installed, the back where strip sits and finally the stripping I used.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2022

Review Title: A great idea that will hopefully get better over time.
Review Text: I bought one of these when they were first announced and was pretty stoked about it.  The price is perfect and if you have other blink cameras you can add this to the system with no problem.Installation was pretty easy and what I expected but don't lose the little tool that comes with it to remove the front to change the batteries if you need too.  It's a little tricky to get the back off if you need.The one thing I can say that I really don't like and makes this a little less useful is that if someone rings the door bell and you use the app or your Alexa show device to see who's there it fails 90% of the time.Seeing video of who was at the door after the fact works but by then it's really a little to late to talk to them.  Some time when trying to update the settings if fails to update and some times when you are trying to view live video it fails.  Motion detection works great but the feature that allows you to mask off areas so they don't trigger doesn't seem to work.But all in all not a bad thing to spend $50 on.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2021

Review Text: I purchased the bundle containing the doorbell, snych module, and corner bracket (which I didn't need). The assembly instructions were a bit confusing, with several sets of often vague instructions available in printed and electronic form. But finally everything came together OK despite my spotty assembly skills.Attaching the doorbell to the door bracket was a bit tricky, as others have noted. I found that aligning the top of the doorbell with the top of the bracket so that they are touching, then pushing in and down works fairly smoothly. Removal of the doorbell with the supplied key is easy.The synch module readily logged into wifi and I had no difficulties with the phone app and video playback and storage. But it has only been a week. I plugged a flash drive into the synch module, so we'll see how that works for local storage when my free cloud subscription expires.All in all, a functional video doorbell at a good price--better if you bundle and get it on sale. Only apparent drawbacks are unclear installation instructions and some difficulty installing doorbell, as noted.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2021

Review Text: Love the device etc., BUT the baking mount literally takes forever to attach. It's complete garbage if it takes me an hour to attach the camera to the backing. I already broke one of the backing teeth because (even properly angling it as shown and moving it down per instructions) it doesn't fit. It shouldn't be such a pain in the ass to setup from app download to physically attaching it. Get it together BLINK. I want to return it but I'm gonna have to macgyver this b!tch.UPDATE:Blink has very responsive reps that care about their products. I had a nice exchange for a replacement to be sent. Just another option to look into if you don't have a flat surface near where you mount.

Review Title: Great doorbell for blink ecosystem - one caveat
Review Text: I’ve been waiting for Blink to have a doorbell to go with my extensive blink ecosystem. This is a great addition.Pros: Great image, ,option detection, connection to hardwired doorbell, installation couldn’t be simpler.Con: Hideous static noise in all captured video whether live view or motion detection capture.Reset my router as requested by tech support. Review Title: Blink Security Camera Users need look no further…
Review Text: First, lets sum this up by saying this is a fantastic option for Alexa smart home users and Blink Users, for those familiar enough with the Amazon/Alexa ecosystem you can set this up many ways in your smart home. If your a Blink Camera Security user this is a no brainer. Installation is a breeze, I used my existing wires from my current hardwired doorbell and it worked perfect (Turn off power at the circuit breaker). Doorbell is pressed, the guest hears a chime at the doorbell itself, and the original indoor chime works on the wall as it always has. There is even the ability to adjust your electronic or piston based wall mounted powered doorbell from within the app to get the best sound from your bell (genius). That’s the easy and straightforward part, this is when the fun begins. The doorbell itself can be set in various configurations. It can be set/armed along with your outdoor cameras and notify you as well as record when it senses motion, with the same settings to record as your standard cameras. You can also set and customize motion zones as well as privacy zones in it’s field of view (nice features). IR intensity, recording time, trigger time, end recording early, it’s all there. There are also a series of actions you can set for when the actual doorbell is pressed, or it sees motion. For example, if the doorbell senses motion at the door you can set Alexa devices in the house (you choose which ones) to announce that someone is at the front door, or in addition you can have it play one of a half dozen or more “chimes” that play right on the Alexa device of your choice which are selectable within the Alexa App (Echo speakers, Fire TV, Echo Video Screens, etc). For video enabled devices, you can also have the live video feed start automatically and you can enjoy two way audio as you speak with your visitor. This also works on your cell phone while away from the house. For those with Alexa “Auto”, these notifications can be set to announce there as well. For those looking to take things further, motion or a button press on the doorbell can also be used to set custom actions within your smart home, turning lights on, Changing a Hue light’s color, etc.. you have many many actions. As an example, I have mine set to Turn on the front outside lights (at certain times of the day to give the visitor a visual cue that the house is aware they are there), I have Alexa play a customized notification on three Alexa devices in the house (Verbally announcing what I typed it to say, have fun with this one), and a custom Chime (in addition to my house doorbell). It also sends notifications to my phone, my car, and records the visitor. Original Blink buyers continue to enjoy free cloud storage as with their other cameras, and if you install and use the most recent sync module, you can choose to record locally for the doorbell off the USB port to a Drive. I also have the ability to answer the door either manually or if I set it automatically off the FireTV in the livingroom.. Bottom line, the Amazon ecosystem gives you an almost unlimited amount of customizations for your smart home if you choose, including the ability to automatically turn on outside and inside lights (you select which ones) when someone comes to the front door based on either motion, or a doorbell press. I find the video quality to be quiet good keeping in mind this is a fisheye setup, the IR light is strong enough for people at the door, daytime quality is great, sensitivity is great, sound is great. While there is a delay when speaking I find it more that acceptable (around 1-2 sec), much better than what you experience when using the outdoor cameras speaker function (Which do not provide two way audio like the doorbell). I would recommend those buying the camera to buy the wedge/corner mount to properly aim the camera towards where the person is likely to be standing, but this is not a must have depending on your door. I also found mounting to be very easy, secure (if they really want it they are going to get it, but your likely to have video of who took it anyway), and despite the negative comments about mounting the slide-on camera it was super easy and secure (not sure why some are having issues, there are no issues). Just another excellent addition to the BLINK offering.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2021

Review Text: I bought this because I am already committed to the Blink Ecosystem (I have five cameras), so I figured this was a no-brainer.While it works pretty well, I'm less than impressed with the mounting.  Mine came with the corner tab (a must because my doorbell would otherwise be looking at the back of a decorative pillar), and the installation of the corner mount made the whole system a mess.  The mount screws make it kind of flimsy, and the doorbell unit itself was a pain to mount.  Sure, I could go buy other screws (which it looks like I will have to do, but it should have just been better designed.  The corner mount made the whole doorbell less than awesome as an experience.Also, the requirement that I need to press the doorbell to "arm" it after enabling it is poorly thought out.  I want to be able to arm/disarm my whole system remotely.  If I remember to arm it after-the-fact when I leave the house, it now will not work unless someone pushes the doorbell (or it waits a full 24 hours).  Not a good feature.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2021

Review Title: Wait for the tech to mature
Review Text: First of all, I'm not a fan of needing a subscription for a camera. There's no reason why this device shouldn't have limited local storage.The doorbell is WAY too big. It is massive when comparing to other doorbell cameras. It's also very easy to remove without the included tool (which is good because you're going to lose it right after you install it). This makes it less secure unless you have other cameras.Unlike competitors, the device cannot be shared with other blink accounts, so you need to share your blink account with your household if you want everyone to receive notifications.Alexa integration works BUT you cannot set it to chime only. It will always follow the chime with "Someone is at the door".When it rains, the lens is very prone to fogging up.Lastly, when setting the activation zones, it's inversed from Ring. Instead of selecting the zones you want motion detected, you select the zones to exclude from motion detection. It took me a couple weeks to figure that out.Overall, wait for the next version or just get a Ring.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2022

Review Title: Horrible Battery Life and Over Priced Mounts
Review Text: It's a decent camera but not really worth the money even at low cost.Let's just talk about the 13 dollar angled mounting plate that should come free with it.  Way to nickle and dime your customers even more Blink over something so cheap.It's outright horribly delayed for its motion detection also.  But that's common with all of their cameras so it was expected.  As far as customization goes and recording times it's the same as the rest of their cameras,  horrible.Update - After owning this for over a month it's still extremely disappointing.  It does a great job of picking up cars in an area that has already been blocked for motion detection and almost never triggers in a timely manner for someone at my door.  Sometimes it doesn't even record even if someone has rung my doorbell.Now I see why they didn't release this year's ago.  Probably shouldn't have released this either.Oh and what a wonderful price cut this has been getting since its release.Done with this company and it's products. It's worth taking the loss over it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2021

Review Text: UPDATE - Blink support reached out to me after my initial review and offered to send me a replacement free of charge.  They took the initial feedback seriously.  After receiving my second camera and mount, I installed the mount using my own screws meant for hardi-plank siding.  This worked fine.  When the mount bracket and back are solid and stable, the camera clicks on fairly easily.  Doorbell camera is now up and running.  It integrates nicely into my echo with video.I was able to wire it in the existing doorbell spot and it controls my chime as expected.I plan to use it for a while and then add more to the review.I'm changing my initial review from one to four stars.  I'm found this solely on the effort from support.  Haitham with Blink went above and beyond to make sure I got taken care of.  Much appreciated!!--- Original Review --Let me first say I've had blink cameras for almost three years now.  I've been happy with the blink system and camera function.I patiently waited for a doorbell to add to the system. I was excited when one finally was released.  Then I got it...First off, Amazon needs to realize that people mounting these with screws are likely putting them into fiberboard cement siding.  I got the angled mount (which should come with the camera but doesn't) and they give you two teeny tiny machine screws to mount it.  To your house.  So right away I had to go find different screws.  Fine.  No big deal.  Got it mounted and moved on.Next they tell you to mount the camera cover.  The hardware that they send for this job is so soft you can practically squish it between your thumb and finger!  Every turn of the screw you can just see the metal coming off.  By 6 or 7 turns, I couldn't tell it was a Phillips screw anymore.  When I got the bottom one snug, the head of the screw just broke clean off in the mount rendering it useless.I thought maybe I could make it work with one screw but like others mentioned you have to be Bobby Fischer to figure out how to get the camera to slide onto the back.  I tried several times and finally gave up, shoved it back in the box and returned it.  Save yourself a headache and just mount one of the outdoor cameras above your door.  This cheapo product is not worth the effort.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2021

Review Title: Excellent product at a great price
Review Text: I live in an apartment building wheee our apartment is on a blind corner so we worry about people hiding around the corner. With the blink doorbell we can actively see what’s in front of our door before we get home to make sure it’s safe.With remote work now I get to see when packages get delivered from any room I have our echo show which integrated easily. I did have to unpair and reconnect the blink to get the notifications working on the show but it’s awesome. We love the many rings you can choose from and ability to track motion in the hallways before we leave our apartment too.I did a bit of research before and the other brands were more than twice the price so we thought we’d give this a chance first and are really happy with our decision.The mounting was a big finnacky but got it mounted without too much work.it isn’t the most secure and with a little force people could rip it off but is definitely be able to get a photo of them if they did.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2022

Review Text: tldr: In general I like the Blink product line but the all-or-nothing alert system makes the Blink doorbell just another outdoor camera.If the only Blink product you have is the doorbell, I’m sure it’s a four or five star product. On the other hand if you have other blink cameras, the lack of control over alerts makes the doorbell worthless. I have three indoor cameras and six outdoor cameras plus the doorbell. In order to get motion alerts from the doorbell I also have to accept  motion alerts from the other cameras. No thank you. My phone would never stop. Also, the Alexa integration is spotty for the entire Blink ecosystem. Sometimes asking to see a camera gets me an image in a few seconds, sometimes I just get the wait wheel of death. Picture quality is excellent and sound and night vision are on par with similar products. In general I like the Blink product line (lots of cameras), but the alert system makes the Blink doorbell just another outdoor camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2022

Review Text: I read the reviews and figured it came from folks that weren't skilled at following instructions.  Most  reviews implied the actual doorbell was hard to mount to the back plate.  I received the unit and followed the instructions and, yes, the doorbell was very hard to mount.  In fact, it took several attempts.  Looking closely at the design, I came to the conclusion that the small plastic tabs that hold the two pieces together could easily get bent.  In addition, my unit did work but, not for long.  After a long call with customer support, the technician determined I had a defective unit and my unit needed to be replaces.  Blink team shipped a new unit quickly and I installed the next day.  The replacement unit was even worse in terms of "ease of installation".  I ended up removing the back plate and, after further inspection, determined that there was simply an alignment problem.  I ended up bending plastic tabs so that the doorbell would snap in place to the back plate.  Conclusion:  Blink could have made this very simple by designing a unit that could be mounted using two screws at the top and bottom of the doorbell itself.  Other than that, I am pretty satisfied with the unit but, I wish the response time was a little faster.  Seems like there is a lag time between the motion detection alert and when we can view the video.  I won't be to critical because it could be the placement of my router.  I hope this info helps you with your decision to purchase the Blink doorbell.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2022

Review Text: Easy Installation, though I have to say, they could figure out an easier way to attach and disconnect the doorbell to the mounting bracket. You have to use the included key to disconnect it from the base to change the batteries, see the serial number at set up, etc. I had to disconnect it several times to trouble shoot why my voice was cracking and distorted when speaking through it. The reason it only gets two stars is because blink is having an issue with the latest Android update (12) and this is what is causing the voice feature to not work. If you have an IOS device, you will have no problem. So for now, if you are an Android user, I would not recommend this device. I have spoken with Blink support and they are aware and are working on the issue, from what I can tell, they have been working on the issue for months, there are forums with people experiencing the same problem.  The picture quality is great, overall I will keep it for now. I will update this review if they fix the issue.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2022

Review Text: Love this great little inexpensive doorbell camera! Low cost, outstanding video quality for the price, expecting battery life (if not connected to doorbell transformer) to be similar to our other blink cameras, and overall a quality piece of security equipment. No, it's NOT 4k video. No, it's not 8k video either. Doesn't need to be either, and does not cost nearly what I am paying for 4k outdoor cameras either. The entire Blink ecosystem is quality product at a good price. While this may sound like a paid testimonial , believe me I can show you paid receipts for the 4 blink doorbell cameras i have purchased so far, along with the several dozen blink battery operated and mini blinks I own. The only negative i have seen so far is the lack of a temperature sensor built in, something also left off the mini blinks, but included on most other blinks. Handy to receive temperature alerts, and  if you are curious what the temp is at some location, log in and take a look.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2022

Review Text: I love my Blink doorbells! I just recently replaced my 2 wired Ring Doorbell cameras with 2 Blink Doorbell cameras. The Ring Doorbell cameras were offline more than they were online ( at least 75% "offline" ) and required one of their proprietary chimes to sound off inside the house. The Blink Doorbell cameras have yet to go "offline" and correctly ring the built-in house chimes that are easily over 50 years old - 1 bell for back and 2 bells for front. I have 6 additional Blink cameras - 3 minis and 3 outdoor - for which I pay $10 per month for cloud storage and the 2 doorbells added nothing more to the subscription... and I stopped the $3 per camera ( $6 per month ) the two Ring Doorbells were costing me for sporadic service. Replacing them was simple. I had to drill one additional hole for each because the mounting holes are around a half inch closer together than the mounting holes on the Ring Doorbell cameras. Took about half an hour for each doorbell to replace them.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2021

Review Text: I just installed my Blink Doorbell and it is WONDERFUL!!!  I did the wireless installation.  I had some problems in the beginning because I wasn't getting notifications on my iphone. But, I called customer service and they were GREAT!  The guy walked me through every step and now it is all PERFECT!!  I love that you can use the microphone even if the person doesn't actually ring the doorbell.  Might have some fun with that next Halloween!!  It is even more wonderful than I expected! I already had the Blink module and 4 cameras. I've had those for years...keeping an eye on my cats!  Now, I have the Blink Doorbell and I couldn't be happier!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2021

Review Title: Great for the price, a little quirky
Review Text: I have multiple “Rings” and now a few “Blinks” (doorbells and floodlight cams for both). Between the two the Ring is the best for video, notifications and ease of app use. For the price point of Blink it’s definitely worth it though. The Blink functions perfectly, I like that it takes a standard battery size (non-hardwired version) and it definitely does the job. The Ring has their own special battery type (rechargeable). The Blink notifications and videos are a bit odd on the feed when going back over previous alerts - sometimes one is marked as not viewed when either I know I saw it earlier or it was never there before. The app is a bit convoluted but manageable for the settings (no where as easy as the Ring app). All in all for the price point I’m not complaining and would recommend it. If you are looking for a bit higher quality and easier app use I would recommend the Ring, but would still buy the Blink again and recommend it for a budget price.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2022

Review Title: Not bad, not what I was expecting.
Review Text: I may just have high expectations for what is advertised and what people write reviews on. I received the item(s) quickly, came in great condition. The setup was pretty straightforward, scan the qr code on the blink app, no problem. The wifi issue is most likely my wifi(s) fault, I do have an extender but it's still giving me issues. I was not impressed with the doorbell cam AT ALL. It's cheap, flimsy plastic, but that one connects pretty easily and the daytime picture is clear, nighttime is not great, that goes for all of them, night "vision" is blurry and static, the sound also has these weird intervals were it sounds like footsteps? Idk how to describe it. Overall I'm not absolutely displeased but I was expecting a clearer nighttime picture/video and some other features. The outdoor cameras take 2AA batteries, battery life so far seems good even after using them frequently. Hopefully this review helps someone make a decision, hopefully your not as picky as I am. 🤕
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2022

Review Title: Doesn't show video automatically with doorbell ring
Review Text: When someone rings the doorbell, it tells you on your phone and the Echo makes a sound (like any doorbell), however it doesn't show the video until you ask it to.  When you ask it to show the video, it takes another 10 seconds to load the video.  Seems like by the time you get to Alexa & ask to see the video & it finally loads, the  person at the door has already left.  Pointless.You are able to create a "Routine" that will show the doorbell automatically, but it won't stop showing the doorbell video until you ask it to stop.  There doesn't seem to be a way to tell it to show a finite amount of video, as the "show me the doorbell" command has to be the last one.If what you want is a motion detection camera, this does the trick.  If you were expecting this to be a video doorbell when combined with an echo, then I give it 1 star.I updated to 3 stars based on interaction with tech support - they definitely stand by their products.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2021

Review Text: I have had this thing for 37 days so far. And I hate it. the doorbell feature takes upwards to 2 min to let me know someone is at my door. as for the motion detection. its horrid. Unless its right up front to the doorbell. It wont pick up anything that is 5-6 feet away.lets talk about how the App pushes you to get the subscription (yeah you need the app for the blink so when it does work you can view videos) The plans are either $3/mo or $10/mo depending on what you want.I wish I could get my money back, but I just threw this thing away in the trash. Thats all its good for. TRASH.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2022

Review Title: Idk why all the bad reviews?!
Review Text: So to make a long story kinda shorter I live in apartments and my mom is disabled, she walks slower and with a cane and she can’t see well. Well some little kids always knock on our door and run, it’s funny to them bc she takes longer to get to the door so they can take off with out getting caught. Well the completely crossed the line this time, they told her they had a free pizza for her but she declined and closed the door. They came back later and left a pizza box at the door and took off. The box was full of POOP the picked up from around the complex. Turns out they were hiding behind the tree to see our reaction. I tried to video them on my phone so I can report them but there was 5 kids and one of me so I couldn’t manage. So I immediately started looking at doorbell cams BUT obviously we don’t have doorbells in apartments so this option was perfect for me. You don’t wire anything just install the app, install your module and drill it on. I ordered a mount but It actually comes with one. It took me 5 mins to set up on my phone and 6 mins to install outside. I love this. I will be buying the subscription when my free trial runs out, the basic plan is $3. If you live in an apartment get this. I feel so much peace of mind now. I will update if anything happens / fails.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2022

Review Text: The basic doorbell is OK. It rings my phone & the closest indoor camera when someone presses the button. But it doesn't seem to alert me if someone is on my porch delivering something & they don't push the button. My main complaint is about the mounting plate that screws to the door frame. The doorbell unit clips on to this mounting with 6 tiny latches that lock into place. The problem is that 2 of them broke off when I was trying to snap the doorbell into place. The problem gets worse, because there doesn't seem to be a way to get this part, either paid or free from Amazon, & gets even worse with the 'tool' that is supposed to help you remove the doorbell from but doesn't. I guess in 2 years or less when the battery dies, I'll have to take a hammer & remove it by breaking it.  I like my Blink corded indoor camera & own 6 of them. The doorbell mounting design is poor & should be changed to a more robust design! I really can't recommend this unit.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2021

Review Text: I owned several Blink camera before, they all work nicely until this video doorbell. This doorbell will mis-detect motion for lighting condition changed, it is even mentioned in the FAQ page.In my situation, I have a no busy community street in from of me, though I disabled the blocks (with advanced mode very carefully) which conservatively excluded street. It still announce motion detected (maybe) because the passing by vehicle headlight shine on my grass or bushes.Lowered sensitivity to 4 or 3 solved this problem but it sometimes missed Amazon delivery (they are fast and stayed in frame in a short time).The tech support was pretty responsive but refused to accept my support because I submitted mov file instead of mp4 file they wanted. First of all, they never asked/specified only mp4 will be accepted, secondly, the file was created directly from Blink app and the support says they are not in the business of video support...what an attitude!! At least they can guide me how to create an mp4 file easily for their like.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2022

Review Text: My experience with the blink doorbell has been pretty bad.  First I bought the stand alone version where I missed some of the restrictions on what you can do with the wireless version.  So I returned and upgraded to the version with the sync module.Since upgrading, my doorbell is more offline than online.  When it is online the live view only works about 10% of the time.  Sometimes it is online but just stops registering motion events.  I've contacted support who told me to try the usual things... Unmount and take the batteries out and put them back to restart it.  Move the sync module closer.  Restart the sync module.  These sometimes work and sometimes not.The sync module is 5 feet from the doorbell and about 15 feet from my access point.  Still highly unreliable.I have tried calling support but after waiting a long time it eventually tells me there is no one to take my call and it hangs up.  Email support takes several days to respond and then after explaining the issue they told me that my doorbell was not armed.  I replied it's not armed and that I cannot arm it because it's offline.  Tried resetting and it will now not even come online.  I sent that info to support and they replied with a link to an article on how to arm the doorbell.  AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!Would return if I still had the box, but looks like it's just going into the trash can and I am eating 60$.Very disappointed the in this product and their support.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2022

Review Text: I've had the Blink wireless outdoor camera for about a year now.  Love that thing.  I've never had to replace the batteries in it since we purchased it.  Motion detection works great, storage is wonderful as the subscription price is fair in my opinion.As for the Blink Doorbell, we have only had it for about a week now and so far, I'd say it's good.  I have found that we prefer to have the motion detection turned off on the camera so we only receive recorded videos when someone rings the doorbell.  We are using our Alexa device as our doorbell sound inside our home, that was somewhat easy to set up.  Found plenty of information online as to how to do that.  Only negative thing i'd say is that it is very difficult to mount the camera itself to the mounting bracket if you do not know ahead of time what to do.  Once the bracket is mounted, you will need to line up the grooves on the back of the camera slightly higher than the ones on the mounting bracket so that you can FIRMLY slide the camera down and lock in into place.  A fair amount of force was required for this.Overall, we are happy so far.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2021

Review Title: It works, but only with the sync module
Review Text: Update:(I was sent the sync module and now the doorbell works better. With the add on you have a live view which is very helpful. There is no reason to sell the doorbell without it. It does not work without the sync mod)I pre-ordered this and didn't get the wedge to help angle the product which would have been very helpful. The only thing I wish it had was a live view.  Update. I've had this for a month and find it to be nearly worthless. It takes too long to realize that it's seen something. By the time it notifies me and I look at what it's recorded nothing is there. I have gig internet so it's not that. I will have a delivery driver park in front of my house, walk up my driveway and drop the package in front of the door, walk down the driveway and leave and it doesn't start recording until the vehicle is gone. Then it says you have a live view but the action is gone. Plus I really wanted something that I could drop in on and see live because I wanted to not just because of a package. Like if I hear a car I'd like to open the app tap live view and look out the doorbell. That should be an obvious addition. I'm considering just sending it back and paying for the ring doorbell
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2021

Review Title: I don’t have to open the door
Review Text: There are many things to like about this product. I’ll get to all of them. The one specific for me may not be for everyone. I’m immunocompromised and don’t like strangers to come to the door and breathe on me during the pandemic. Most people are respectful. However, there are just a few times when you have to talk to someone at the front door. Now I don’t have to open the door. I can talk to them through the app from anywhere and complete my business without risking germs. This works for normal conversations with people at the door. You may find it useful for yourself.  Also, I have integrated the doorbell with my Alexa echo  and when the doorbell rings outside, Alexa says, “Someone is at the door.” You can learn how to do that with the email that they send you that talks about Alexa skills. The camera is sensitive enough without being overly sensitive. It’s also adjustable in many different ways, as are all of the Blink cameras.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2021

Review Text: Trying to configure the system in the family room to install on a warmer day didn't go well. Everything went wrong but, to make a long story short, connection to doorbell wiring was what was needed. Once Blink was installed and connected to the doorbell wiring, features that were failing came online and I did some initial configuration and testing. A work in progress but motion detection settings and basic video and audio levels are at a good starting point. Hopefully, I'll be able to improve video quality but, too soon to tell.I found mounting on a flat surface would require more sophisticated installation than there was time for but it's secure and can be adapted, if needed, in better weather. It's in a protected area but I doubt it would be vulnerable to moisture. Sunlight? Don't know.I'm looking forward to fine tuning Blink's features but it's too soon to offer a detailed review. So far, I like it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2022

Review Title: Very Decent Camera for the Price
Review Text: I am pretty satisfied with the Blink Video Doorbell. I am impressed with the video resolution at 1080p and the motion detection even if an object is about 10-12 feet away. Of course, this is all contingent on the sensitivity settings in the parameters in the Blink App  that is used in conjunction with the doorbell and Blink Cameras. Night vision is pretty good too. When you have adequate light at the door, such as a bright porch light the camera will pick up the brightness and give you video in color. The only thing I don’t like that I had to figure out is that if you want to talk to someone over the doorbell or cameras, you almost have to treat it as a walkie talkie. In other words, if on Blink App I enable the talk feature at that moment, even though I know there is about 2-3 second delay in receiving/responding time, you cannot hear the individual respond if the talk feature is enabled. Your enabling this feature supersedes the audio of the person at the camera. I figured that once I respond I have to disable the talk feature before I can really hear the person clearly. I’m actually thinking of getting a Ring Video Doorbell just to compare response time and voice clarity in communication. This is the only drawback I experienced. But for the price it’s a great deal.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2022

Review Text: This is a very attractive looking doorbell that feels very sturdy in the hand and installation was super easy! I am 6'2 and I mounted it slightly higher than the 48" from the ground recommendation but because of it's very wide viewing angle, 48" would have worked fine as well. It will definitely capture the visitors face and upper torso. The daytime image is super sharp and the motion showed zero lag when viewing the recording. This product is half the price of it's number one competitor and full of useful options and settings to suit every need. The moment someone rings the doorbell you are instantly notified via message on your phone and or any Amazon or Alexa device. I expect the batteries to last at least two years because I don't get many visitors and delivery drivers, although they come almost weekly because I'm a shopaholic, rarely ring the doorbell, which is the primary reason why I purchased it. Highly recommended!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2021

Review Title: No need for a subscription with Sync 2
Review Text: I originally left an angry review after learning about the subscription service for Blink. I did not want to continue paying $120 a year for a camera I already purchased. They are vague on their products and services but with the Sync 2 module you essentially get the same function as the subscription but without a few features they decided were "premium". With the module, and a mini USB drive, you still have all your triggered recordings saved and are able to access them from the app. One of the "premium" features you lose out on is being able to record while watching it live; so if someone is robbing your house, just dont watch them do it live or you wont have proof!!! (sneaky work around with recording live is to do a screen recording on your iphone while watching live in the app). I would rather see the Sync module cost a little more and have all the "premium" features built in for life but our cultural fad is to have a subscription for literally everything right now so that will never happen.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2022

Review Text: It is ok. I got Blink because you could still use it without the subscription. I think they remove more features than necessary after the trial just to make it a pain in the butt to use without a subscription. For instance now I can't see a still shot of the motion clip.  I have to play it. Then I can no longer delete multiple clips. I have to do it individually. I can't record live view even though it would only save to my sim card. There is no reason for those features to be removed except to make it a pain in the butt. Motion detection is either too sensitive or not enough. Hard to find that best setting. I set the active area but still get trips on motion outside the zones. Alexa works most of the time saying "somebody is at the front door." The notification is slow and often delayed. By the time I get a motion alert and try to bring up live view, there is no more activity. Live view fails half the time anyway.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2022

Review Text: I purchased this because I switched from ring to blink because I could ditch the cloud subscription, so I thought. This thing is cheap garbage. It took me forever to figure this thing out. I chose to hard wire using my old doorbell wiring because I figured it would be best not to have to worry about replacing batteries. But that’s not the case. After a few YouTube videos and some digging, I came to realize that connecting it to your existing wiring only allows it to ring through your existing chime. Well that’s just dumb! It should also power the unit as well. But nope it doesn’t. Who needs a chime anyway if you have an Alexa, because when you ring the bell she chimes and says someone is at the door. I think I’m going to send this back along with all the cameras and sync module and whatever other blink junk that I’ve recently purchased. It may be good for some but it truly wasn’t good for me. I’ll be reinstalling my old ring door bell and renew my yearly subscription for storage. At least I’ll know I can rely on it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2021

Review Title: Great value for the money, if you already have Blink
Review Text: If you already have Blink set up, you wont find a better value. This camera works great, simple to install and easy to use. It works just like your other cameras and shows up in the app the same way. The motion detection works similarly to the other cameras, but the quality is a little sharper than my older blink cameras.My only issues are that it does work off the blink app and either your phone or Alexa, which means if you have your phone on silent, or in the other room, you may not hear somebody ringing your doorbell. It also has a slight delay, and there have been times where I don't think it even rang the first time.If you are wanting a solid doorbell replacement, I would recommend getting an Alexa screen or something that will be stationary and always on for when the doorbell is rang. If you do not care that much, the phone app works great for the most part and won't require additional expense.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2022

Review Text: UODATE: I ordered the corner mount and that made all the difference in getting my doorbell in place. Blink was very responsive to my concerns and I was able to get someone to assist me with the final mounting, and I am grateful for the added layer of vision this new angle allows. I love my blink system and how easily it works with Alexa!  If you have trouble, reach out to their customer service folks. They will not disappoint!(Original post written in the throes of frustration: The instructions to mount the frame are easy to follow. Attaching the unit to the mounted frame has, thus far, kept me from using the device. Either I’m an idiot or the mounting and securing is too difficult for an elderly woman with a bum shoulder. I want to return it, but I need the security measure. I’d welcome any advice you’ve got.)They read it, reached out and responded with kindness and help! I love Blink!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2021

Review Text: We purchased our first Blink Home Security Camera July of 2018. We were going out of the country and wanted to make sure our 18 year old son closed the garage door and locked the house. It did the job and we felt better knowing while on the other side of the world we could monitor our home.The following Summer we were so happy with our indoor system, we decided to purchase 2 outdoor cameras with the 2 way audio, and were so happy with the video and audio quality, we bought another add on outdoor camera, the next month.A year later we found the mini indoor cameras. We have one for a child's bedroom and one for the playroom. The video and audio quality is great.A year after that we bought another 3 outdoor Cameras, again video and audio quality is great.Just before Christmas 2021 Blink came out with the doorbell camera, and we purchased it. One, because it was blink and 1/2 the price of a ring doorbell camera. Two, because the doorbell that came with our new build home was so quiet, we couldn't ever hear the bell ring.In total we now have...3 Indoor battery powered2 Indoor mini corded power6 Outdoor battery powered1 doorbell wired to exciting doorbell.Cameras purchased...July 17th, 2018Blink Indoor Home Security Camera System with Motion Detection, HD Video, 2-Year Battery Life and Cloud Storage Included - 3 Camera Kithttps://www.amazon.com/dp/B018HC6PVA/ref=cm_sw_r_apan_glt_i_E4N35AJJXM4QAYYN1S03?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1July 15th, 2019Blink XT2 Outdoor/Indoor Smart Security Camera with cloud storage included, 2-way audio, 2-year battery life – 2 camera kithttps://www.amazon.com/dp/B07MN67BCR/ref=cm_sw_r_apan_glt_i_2VZV3YZ7F3X4F5WSF9SF?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1August 20th, 2019Blink XT2 Outdoor/Indoor Smart Security Camera with cloud storage included, 2-way audio, 2-year battery life – Add-on camera for existing Blink customershttps://www.amazon.com/dp/B07M8DTHGL/ref=cm_sw_r_apan_glt_i_7XGZ93G8PTGGNHTNBGEK?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1November 22nd, 2020Blink Mini – Compact indoor plug-in smart security camera, 1080 HD video, night vision, motion detection, two-way audio, Works with Alexa – 2 camerashttps://www.amazon.com/dp/B07X27VK3D/ref=cm_sw_r_apan_glt_i_dl_0CVS1GZCPQPJE577M0JV?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1August 3, 2021Blink Outdoor - wireless, weather-resistant HD security camera, two-year battery life, motion detection, set up in minutes – 3 camera kithttps://www.amazon.com/dp/B086DKSHQ4/ref=cm_sw_r_apan_glt_i_dl_9F09K8M142MATNJY1C7P?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1November 29th, 2021Introducing Blink Video Doorbell | Two-way audio, HD video, motion and chime app alerts and Alexa enabled — wired or wire-free (Black)https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08SG2MS3V/ref=cm_sw_r_apan_glt_i_dl_JTH38J37N7ST707FMW4P?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1Blink offers two subscription plans.1 Blink device$3 per month or $30 annuallyUnlimited Blink devices$10 per month or $100 annuallyYou do not have to have a Blink Subscription if you do not choose to, but you won't be able to store videos.With the subscription you are even able to share your videos by text, or email. To neighbors, Friends, Family, and even the police department.Cons/irritationsWhen an outdoor camera faces the sun at any point of the day, the motion detection will go off, until you adjust the motion activity spots in the camera settings. This can take a few days to work out the kinks.Indoor mini cameras the motion activity spots don't always work. Sometimes it will go off when there is motion in the grayed out zones, and sometimes not go off in the non-greyed out zones. This maybe human error on our part. We are looking for a longer cord for the mini's to mount on the wall or ceiling.  The are options to rotate the camera view, so that you are able to mount the camera wherever you need.Overall we are happy with our Blink system and hope the company continues to grow and come out with new products.Compared to my parents very very expensive Arlo system, Blink is more reliable, and is more cost-effective. So much so, my parents have ditched the Arlo camera system and have purchased a new Blink system.We highly recommend Blink to anyone who would like to have a home video camera system that works, and won't break the bank.We love that you can start out small and work your way in to as much as you want/need.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2022

Review Text: After reading professional reviews that said the detection and image qualities were good but not quite as good as Ring and others, I decided to give it a try when I could get this for $35 vs. $100+ for other makers.  I use the Blink system and have 4 cameras outside for security and know they are reliable.  That said the Doorbell is just excellent.
