The doorbell is fairly close to the blink module inside the house which may result in improved reliability compared to the reviews I read.  The image quality is exceptional (you can change it from low to high, I have it set on high).  The detection is also incredible, always lets me know when there is someone there at the door.  I have it integrated with Alexa and one of my echo shows and you can view the last activity instantly from the show and see who is there.  I would highly recommend this over other products as it is a lot cheaper and works as advertised.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2021

Review Text: A couple of months ago, I bought a Blink doorbell. In order for the doorbell to record, I had to buy a storage plan for $30 a year. The doorbell is anything but reliable. Press the bell, and the doorbell may or may not ring on my phone. But that’s just one problem.Since I bought the doorbell, I purchased two mini (indoor) cameras and two outdoor cameras. I’ve been notified that in order for these cameras to record, I have to buy more storage, and for all of the cameras to record, it will cost me $100 yearly.So when I buy a camera, I fully expect that I own the camera and therefore, should NOT have to pay additional fees to have these cameras record… especially when I have NO need to store the videos off line.So bottom line…. Don’t waste your money. You’re not going to own the cameras unless you’re happy having security cameras that won’t record unless you pay additional fees. I STRONGLY recommend you look at others systems. The cameras are not very expensive, but without the ability to record, they’re completely useless to me. Am I unhappy with blink…. YOU BET I AM. Don’t waste your money.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2022

Review Text: It’s a nice looking doorbell. Easy setup. Good quality audio and video. Unfortunately the motion detection goes off constantly all night every time a car passes by. I have set it on its lowest sensitivity and even went to grayed out the center of the picture to leave the street out of the detection. Still goes off 10 times a night and 10 times during the day. I am not going to by a wedge, for one that looks dumb, but two (and more importantly) I want my bell to look straight ahead, not point at the sky or the ground.Also I think it’s dumb software to have to physically ring your doorbell or wait 24 hours for ANY setting changes to take place. What’s the point of that? Just let me change the settings and move on.I will continue to tinker with it for the next couple of weeks during the trial period and if I can’t get it to act right I will be returning and getting a Ring or Google Nest.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2022

Review Text: I was an early adopter of the Blink camera system. I own several, and have recommended Blink to many, many people. Sadly, this new doorbell missed the mark - the mounting system is a design failure. I attempted to mount and and dismount the camera from the backplate prior to drilling holes in my steel siding. Now, I'm very competent, and confident with DIY projects, however, even after watching the instructional video and reading numerous reviews, I truly struggled with this design. I eventually managed to get the camera mounted to the backplate, but even with the supplied tool, removal was simply too cumbersome. Sadly, I'm returning this even before trying out the actual performance of the product. After all, how am I supposed to eventually change the batteries when it's mounted to the house when I can't easially open it on my kitchen counter? Sorry Blink. Back to the drawing board.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2021

Review Text: Overall, it's an ok product.  It took several days to adjust the camera settings and activity zones to avoid getting car traffic alerts.  This did involve dialing back the camera sensitivity which may be the reason for the inconsistent results we are having with motion detection.  There is still a degree of confusion about the motion detection - some say that it detects motion even with the overall system is disarmed (we already have Blink cameras operational).  Others say it only detects motion when the system is armed or someone rings the bell.  The camera does turn on when the bell is rung - that is consistent and the sound quality of the chime and the microphone/speaker is good.  We have two instances of motion detection when the system is off, so I'm guessing the first claim is true, but it is really inconsistent.  Since we have the other cameras (that are very reliable) it's not critical for our purposes (doorbell with camera).  However, it would be nice to know if, perhaps, we have a malfunctioning unit.  We did not experience any difficulties with mounting the unit to the house as some have stated.  It is a snug fit, but the instructions are very clear and it was up in one try.  Syncing to the existing system was simple and literally took about 2 minutes.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2021

Review Text: updated review comment:After leaving a 1-star review, I received a message from an "Amazon Executive Representative specialized in Blink devices" with clear instructions on how to link Blink and Sync Module. Now I can ask Alexa on my Echo Show 10 to show me the front door. He did, however, admit that the automatic show of front door when the bell rings is not supported when Blink is on batter power. Which is a shame, because I have to always ask Alexa to show me the front door when the bell rings. I would much rather replace my batteries often and have Echo Show display the camera automatically. Because Amazon was able to help resolve the issues, I changed the rating to 4-stars. I still took away one star for not letting the customer choose whether or not to automatically display what's viewed on Blink door bell.original review comment:Alexa can't connect to the Blink camera, and when the doorbell rings it doesn't automatically display either. I got the Sync module with a compatible USB, but it keeps showing an error message. Honestly, this whole thing is a hot mess...
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2021

Review Title: Difficult to install, but seems worth it
Review Text: I read all of the reviews and the thing I saw the most was that the doorbell was difficult to slide onto its backing when mounting it to the doorframe.  I kinda shrugged that off at the time, but WOW!  What a pain in the backside to install.Other than that, the camera appears to work very nicely.  I have it in wireless mode until next summer when it's warm enough to fiddle with small wires in the frozen northland.  It makes an annoyingly-loud chime sound that I can't seem to figure out how to adjust, but I can live with that because I won't be hearing it, the person pressing the button will :)I'm a bit skeptical about battery life (in Minnesota we can regularly have a week or two of below-zero F temperatures, and much of the winter is at 30-degrees F or colder), but I guess we'll see.  This is the first year I'll have this camera along with my outdoor Blink cameras in winter.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2021

Review Text: The doorbell doesn’t always ring/synch well with my Alexa devices. Hence I sometimes miss when someone rings. My main issue is with the app. It takes too long when trying to view live when someone is actually at the door, if it even works. Often it just keeps spinning but never lets me view who’s at my door for so long that eventually they leave or ring the doorbell again. Then if you do go to click on the camera again it tells you “live view in progress please wait”. It takes so long that the person just leaves. I think the camera works okay enough but the app kinda sucks.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2022

Review Text: I was nervous to buy this device because of the negative reviews regarding mounting. However I’m glad I bit the bullet and did it. I had a Ring 2 doorbell however without the Ring alarm system and already having Blink cameras to watch my dog, I wanted to consolidate my apps for security. So I got the blink doorbell and I had no issues mounting — unless I did it incorrectly? The app walked me through all of the instructions in order to get it set up and installed on my house. And because I live in a duplex the wide angle was a nice surprise. It gives me the right view so I can see someone coming up our stairs without invading my neighbor’s privacy. It also gives me a good view of the front door even though it’s not mounted right next to it .I haven’t quite figured out if the connection with Alexa is as seamless as the Ring was. But I think I’m handy enough to make things work.You really can’t beat the price. And now I’m able to give my Ring to someone who just wants to watch their doorstep.Curious to see how long the batteries last. I think it said over a year. For me that’s nice because I hated having to charge the ring battery. Even though I had it hard wired, the cold weather would eventually deplete the battery. I find it much easier to just pop in AA batteries.Overall I think none of these doorbells have it all. You’ve just got to find what works for you. Between my simplsafe alarm system and smart lock and my Blink indoor cameras that are so affordable, and now the added security being able to see my front doorstep, I’m a happy camper.So far the only complaint I have is that I can’t set the doorbell to have motion alerts unless my system is armed. I kind of want to get motion alerts even when I’m home during the day but I don’t necessarily want to arm my system because I have other cameras in the house that I’ll trigger while I’m home. I don’t want to turn off motion announcements on those other cameras because I want to watch my dog while I’m gone.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2021

Review Title: Works well as described easy setup
Review Text: The doorbell works great with my wired doorbell. The picture is clear on the camera and the adjustable sensitivity will let you dial it in. No complaints and at $34 how can you go wrong. Easy to add to Alexa and my current blink app.Update, I bought a 2nd unit and about a week of use I get the battery should be replaced. I put a new pair of lithium AA batteries then after another week I get the same message. 6 batteries in 2 weeks is a problem. Contacted tech support and after 24 hrs they responded but already requested return. Rec’d several emails trying to troubleshoot even after informing them of the return and for a different problem and not the battery issue I reported. So far tech support does not get a high rating from my experience. I rec’d the replacement today apparently replacements are returned units as it was dirty and inner packaging ripped. I hope it works at this point only time will tell.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2021

Review Title: Works with Alexa but not quite
Review Text: What is good. The video on this camera is extremely clear and sharp. Motion detection is very good. The doorbell chime is pleasant. I wired in place of existing doorbell, and it rings the original doorbell in the house. I added a routine to Alexa to announce on select Echo devices when the doorbell is pressed, perhaps redundant since the bell rings. The Blink app on my phone allows two-way conversation with visitors. I can open the camera view on my Echo Show with verbal command and after a bit I am looking outside.What is bad. Attaching the camera body to the wall-attached panel was extremely difficult. I wanted the Routine to automatically open the camera view on my Echo Show. I talked with Amazon support and we determined the Blink camera is an UNSUPPORTED device for the Alexa app to manage the Camera in a Routine. Only Ring can do this.Really?  Isn't Blink owned by Amazon?
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2022

Review Title: Newly installed, seems excellent so far
Review Text: I usually wait for a month or so to review a product like this to see how it performs but since it is new and there are few reviews I am submitting this after only a few days.I already had four other Blink cameras installed so this doorbell was added to an existing hub.  I replace a wired doorbell with the Blink doorbell. The physical install is 2 screws for mounting and an additional 2 screws to connect the existing doorbell wires which is optional.  The setup is ridiculously easy on the Blink app.  All together installation was about 15 minutes, most of which was reading the instructions.The picture quality is excellent.  Motion detection is the same as the cameras and night vision on my front porch is excellent.  The existing doorbell dings and dongs like it should and my phone notifies me in second of the doorbell being pushed.  Remarkable for $50 is all I can say.  I will update the review in a month or so. So far, so good.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2021

Review Title: Worst Amazon Product EVER MADE!!!  STAY FAR AWAY
Review Text: It is no exaggeration to say that we have over a dozen Amazon products in my house right now, connected in different rooms to my TVs etc.  This product is so poor it makes me rethink using any of these other products. I’ve lost respect for Amazon. We may be switching our entire house over to either Apple or Google products I’m starting to do research now on quality of those vs Amazon.  Where to begin, the setup is a nightmare correct Wi-Fi password used over 10 times it took to connect to the blink servers.  By the time it actually started to work it was dark the night time quality looks like it’s 20 years old.  After any settings are changed a doorbell press is needed over 30 presses later nothing registers any of the button presses to start the changes in settings.  It doesn’t register motion detection it doesn’t work with the echo show it doesn’t work as intended as a doorbell.  I have 20 years of experience building computers and working with different software languages.  This is not a lack of IT knowledge this is a subpar product from $1 billion company and they should be ashamed of themselves for even selling it.  I’m getting my money back it would be nice if they paid me to fill in and repaint the holes that I put on the outside of my house.  And pay me for the hours of time lost on the worst product I’ve ever purchased.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2021

Review Text: UPDATE: okay after speaking to Blink’s technical support they immediately offered help. I love this doorbell camera! I have an echo show and an echo dot in another room and I am able to hear when the doorbell is being rung simply through the Echo devices! It’s super convenient to see who’s at the door on the echo show as well! The picture and sound quality on this doorbell is sooo great. They also let me know they are working on bringing on a chime as well, which is amazing! Thank you blink :)Preordered this device since everyone had something negative to say about the ring but at this point that must’ve been the better option. I won’t be able to know if my doorbell has been rung unless my phone is on loud and on??? Where is the chime? Something to plug into wall to hear it from another room? It’s inconvenient, plus it takes a while from the click of the doorbell to actually get a notification on my phone. Not liking it so far. Other than that, it’s hard to put on the wall but picture quality is good and motion detection works so far.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2021

Review Title: Must pay for subscription for recording-not working properly
Review Text: The only thing I have good to say is that I like that you can wire it and it will ring the wired doorbell as well and notify you on app and works with Alexa. However it does not work about half of the time. Typically it has to be pressed two times to actually activate the doorbell & notifications. When I contacted customer service they provided a YouTube link on how to install. That was not helpful, it was installed correctly. I purchased 60 days ago and they refused to allow a return, only a replacement. Also after the free 1 month subscription to the app, you must pay to have any recordings or install additional equipment. You will still get a notification, and can view "live" but cannot see any recordings. Wish I would have looked more closely at other reviews/questions so I knew this. I would not have purchased. Also the app is not great. I have seen much better options out there. I would not recommend this product.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2022

Review Title: Could be better, but most of the time OK
Review Text: Fairly easy to install and integrate with Alexa. After 30 days you have to purchase a subscription to store your videos or purchase a sync device and add a USB stick. I bought the sync. Unfortunately it is not straightforward to connect the sync module. I could not get it to work so I called blink tech support. Tech support walked me through the process. First you have to delete the doorbell camera and then add in the sync. Once the sync is connected, then you add back in the doorbell camera. You also have to delete the app and then reinstall it. But finally it worked!  Night vision could be better, it’s a little muddy. Daytime is very good. Can’t beat this setup for the price. I preordered it and paid around $50.  Ever since then it has been selling for around $34.My biggest complaint is that once you get notification of movement, the moving object is already gone. I recently bought the Ring Pro, which provided at least 15 seconds of video before the motion.  Much happier.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2021

Review Title: Not Sure if I Like It
Review Text: I got the doorbell, sync module, 256 storage, and three cameras.Doorbell. Two problems with the doorbell/storage so far. 1) There is a moderately busy road about 100 feet and downhill from my front door. It catches the edge of my screen so I blocked it with the privacy block to inactivate this part. It did not work. My notifications went off about 20 times in 2 hours. I tried adjusting the location of the doorbell. I finally removed the doorbell from outside. I could not find a place it worked. 2) I bought the 256 USB drive and tried to be very careful about not using the cloud. I got a notification my cloud service was interrupted. I do not know where the information is going. Positive note: I had one person ring the doorbell. I easily heard it inside my home. I was towards the front door. I do not know what it will be like in the back of the house. If there is a non-wired chime that could be place inside the home centrally that would be good. If I don’t have the phone on me, and I am not in the front of the house, I might not hear the person at the door.Camera: I have not installed them. It takes two people, one to hold the camera and the other to look at the phone to see where it is best to install it. There is a delay between live view/camera and when you see it on the phone. The camera can easily come off the adjustable mounting bracket, so I do not want someone stealing the camera. I am trying to find a high enough place to make it difficult to steal, but still give the coverage I need. I decided on one location, but I need to build an additional bracket to get the angle I need.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2022

Review Text: First, the system actually works pretty good. Daylight video and pictures are sharp...night time not so much. But what frosts my ---- is the loss of my ability to record video unless I subscribe to Amazons cloud. No where in the original ad (the first page where all the info on a product is normally listed) does it mention this. In fact, I was looking long and hard for this kind of system because they pointed out you could install your own thumb drive for recording video on a local drive. If you scroll down about 3 (4?) pages they actually break it down and show you how little the system will do after the original 30 day free trial. I don't use the cloud and the reason I never bought other systems is because I did not want to pay a monthly fee to have clips saved to the cloud. This is nothing more than bait and switch and I would have thought better of Amazon.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2022

Review Text: This setup is quite affordable, especially during the holiday season—it’s definitely a loss leader in the Amazon world, like many other Amazon products.  However, the fail point of the affordability is that the device’s primary perks (motion detection and recording) become worthless if you don’t purchase the cloud plan.  I misunderstood the advertising to believe that if I bought the hub I wouldn’t have this problem, but that is not the case.  I have two blink cameras in my house so a cloud subscription is around $10/month—a price that can hinge on whether or not I can budget out a night in a medium quality restaurant once a month and still pay all my bills.  If I were purchasing a security camera in the future, I would most definitely do more research and ensure that the product I purchase doesn’t require a plan that costs me over a hundred dollars a year.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2022

Review Text: Now perhaps I don’t know how to work it properly. Idk. But from what I do know I don’t like it too much. It is definitely a great camera for the price. It picks up sound, motion etc. and is very clear. What I don’t like about it is I can’t get it to have a live view. ONLY when it detects motion or someone rings the bell does it have a live view. I wanted to be able to open the app and look at my lot even if no one was there. But it  doesn’t allow that. Or like I said perhaps i don’t understand the app fully. I have gone through the app meticulously and can’t see where I have that option. Also, if someone rings your bell and you tap the notification and close the app you can’t go back in for a live view.  Idk. For the price it’s good. But I’m going to try ring.Update: returning it because, No. the notifications stopped coming through. I’m not sure how to get them back. Even if you press the button notifications don’t come through. So I opened the app and pressed it then I got a notification. It appears you have to be on the app to get a notification. I’ve had this bell hooked up for 2 days now and I’m over it. I’ve had many visitors and I get no notifications that anyone is on my lot. Such a waste.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2022

Review Text: I pre-ordered the blink doorbell as soon as I heard about it and it finally arrived!Ignore the bad reviews! I honestly believe that they are all based on user-error. The setup and installation literally took me less than 10 minutes. I used the wired connection to connect the doorbell to the chime in my home. Instructions were straight forward and clear. Doorbell snapped onto mounting bracket with a little effort, but that’s what I want for security purposes.I tested the motion detection and video and all works great! The only complaint that I have and will change my review to five stars once fixed is the video color. Faces are blown out by the sun and bright light behind the person. I’m expecting that this will be fixed with a firmware update.I am very happy so far and glad to add the doorbell to my blink camera system.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2021

Review Text: Overall I like this doorbell.  I would give it five stars except for the long delay before I can view or talk to the person ringing the doorbell.  If I set the video to record clip when doorbell is pressed then I can't talk or view until the clip is finished recording.  If I don't record clip the fastest is saying talk to front on the echos.  The echo show take longer because a prompt "waiting for blink camera" comes up for several seconds before I am able to talk.  Ideally, I would like to record a clip when away and talk to person ringing the doorbell immediately.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2021

Review Text: The installation was easy except for mounting on brickmold. I made a wood spacer that worked well. Integration with Belltone chime works well. If you use a Blink Module 2 you need to cancel the free cloud trial to get it to work. You need to pressfirmly on the bell housing to compress the rubber gasket to engage the housing to the base. My Eco Show 5 has issues with not recognizing my Blink cameras. They show in Alexa app but Alexa can’t see them.Revision;The doorbell was working fine for about a week, then it stopped ringing and disconnected from the Sync Module 2. The flashing red would only stay on for a few seconds which did not allow enough time to pair it again to the Sync Module 2. Tech support wasn’t much help. I also learned that it doesn’t work with Alexa when paired with Sync Module 2, only with cloud service. I decided to return it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2021

Review Text: I think I must have gotten a defective unit. Even though I have motion detection set up, it absolutely will not work. Motion detection was the number one reason I wanted a doorbell camera. My neighbors protested a camera since my front door faces directly into their home. So this was the solution to catching porch pirates and people walking around my home. But it doesn't even catch me when I am right in front of it waving my hands.Also getting this to attach to its back was nearly impossible. It brought me to tears and I'm not actually convinced it actually attached so I put gorilla tape all around the edges to make sure it stays up and is protected from the elements.When it does record because someone rang the bell, the picture looks fairly clean.I am not sure what to do now. I baught the one year subscription when I baught the camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2022

Review Text: So we like the rest of the system and other than a few setbacks, it has been working well.  The doorbell doesn't perform so well in the winter when temperatures get down in the single digits.  The mini cams do a good job when aimed out of the window though.  We get some strange activities going on at night, but since we have had this system, it has stopped.  We are not satisfied with the night vision though because it is not as clear.  The motion detection works a little too well...it catches everything and I mean everything.  I decided not to get Alexa, due to some reviews stating that the system doesn't work as well or possibly not at all when Alexa is added.  Other than some bugs that still need to be worked out, it's a great security system overall.Update: Had to disable the doorbell.  Brought it in the house.  Just doesn't work in extreme cold.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2022

Review Title: Does a few things really well; but is attrocious at others.
Review Text: Previously, I was using a video doorbell from a different company. It did well, but was damaged and I started shopping for alternate units. I came across this item and read reviews, observed functions, etc.. and was fairly excited. The Blink Doorbell had integration with Alexa, which caught my eye. I own an Echo Show 8, my previous doorbell did not work with Alexa. This was my main purchase point. I was sorely mistaken.The doorbell itself isn't flimsy or about to fall apart, but you can tell it's cheaply made with cheaper materials than other products. Connecting the front of the bell to the backplate is damn near impossible... it literally took me 15 minutes to attach it, you have to put so much force on it from multiple directions that one would wonder if it would break beforehand. The issue is the mechanism that holds the backplate on, not the greatest engineering.THERE IS NO SEPARATE CHIME OR RINGER ON THE ENTIRE PLANET COMPATIBLE WITH THIS DOORBELLI mean... seriously? Isn't that sort of the whole point? The only was to get notifications that someone is ringing the bell is through push messages on your Alexa device or mobile device. Even then, they're subtle, AND THEY ONLY WORK IF YOU SUBSCRIBE TO THE ENHANCED FEATURES. Without a subscription, you can get alerts that the bell is pushed or detecting motion, but it's simply a blurry picture as far as video goes and it's not live. You would think the camera view would pop up on the Echo Show when the button was pushed, but it doesn't. It's also not saved anywhere at all; the Sync Module that is supposed to record locally will not save notification pictures or video, and if you use the sync model to record locally (recording what I have no idea) it disables all of the motion alerts from the doorbell. Because you have to pay more for those, right?  Even with the subscription, it simply records a small video clip or notifies you so you can live-view the camera to see who it is. Without the subscription... you can quickly live view video and get a notification on your phone when someone pushes the button.This is hands-down the most terrible engineering and sales model I have ever seen. It's along the lines of buying a cell phone and then having to pay to use it. The only difference is that the cell phone companies tell you this way ahead of time, very clearly, and it serves a purpose. Such a major disappointment. This is the only time in my twelve years of being a loyal Amazon customer I have *EVER* been upset with Amazon for making a product that behaves like this. Somehow... Amazon finally let me down.Did I mention there's no separate chime for the doorbell?Not happy.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2022

Review Title: It functions fine but not at all what I've been waiting for...
Review Text: The unit is fine and it functions properly. I've been waiting for a few years for this to be released, under the full assumption that the power would be hard connected to my home... Not ever requiring batteries again.After a few days I received warning that the batteries were low and that's when my heart sunk. I had connected it to my door chime but there is no way to hard connect it to an electric source where it draws power only from your home and not batteries.I enjoyed the simplicity of blink, and have owned these cameras since way before Amazon bought them... If I were not grandfathered in to the free plan I'm not sure I would purchase the entire system again. I'd rather have a hard wired system that reliably records. I've missed at least three security events in the past year with my neighbors due to low battery.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2022

Review Text: Well, I had hire expectations from Amazon than this poorly designed door bell. Let's just say it's an outside camera. Because if you do not hard wire it to an existing door bell, you will never hear a door bell ring. You would think Amazon would have created a separate device that you can plug inside your home so that when someone rings this video doorbell, you would actually know someone was at your door. I just spent an hour on the phone with Blink support. They did their best to convince me I could hear it ring, although I told them it was not hard wired, but they said, I could hear it no matter.  Finally someone else got on the phone and told me only if it's hard wired can you hear the door bell. Very, very disappointed in whom ever designed this ridiculous "door bell". It just an outside camera unless hard wired. Misleading advertising by saying this door bell is wireless.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2022

Review Text: Updated post (12/2021): I am changing my review from 2 stars to 4 starts. A blink customer service representative sent me a new back mount. It worked , and I was able to install it in 5 seconds. For those having issues putting it on the mount, I encourage you to reach out to customer service. Removed 1 star because I believe the system should still be easier. I love the product so far.Original Post: I love blink. I have multiple blink cameras around my home. I was very excited for this doorbell when it came out. I purchased it for Black Friday. I definitely agree with everyone on amazon and on Reddit with the emotional and physical trauma this gave me trying to mount it on the given mount. It was the worst mount to ever exist. Idk who gave the green light on this or who designed it. It will take u forever to mount. I eventually gave up because it’s been 3 hours. I’m sure I’m not that dumb to not be able to mount it.I ended up getting a doorbell boa to attach it to my door. Ended up working better. Picture is very clear and night vision is similar to the other blink cameras.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2021

Review Title: Updated...ok doorbell but doesnt work as it should
Review Text: Update: I was contacted by a blink support team member who was very helpful.  Not sure what they did but the doorbell now records to the local storage of the sync module without having a blink subscription.Doorbell was easy to install.  The doorbell records video to the cloud just fine but will not record video to the USB storage of the blink sync module 2.  If you don't want cloud storage then don't buy this doorbell because it doesn't record to the sync module as it should.  Tech support first said batteries were no good but when tested both batteries were at the proper 1.5v.  Called tech support again and was told to wait until the free trial of the cloud storage expires to see if it starts recording to the USB (will update review when trial expires).  All other blink cameras installed record to USB but this doorbell will not.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2021

Review Title: Hardware is good but needs better software
Review Text: The camera is good. It installed and set up pretty easily. I added it to my existing Blink system. It is able to notify me using my many Echo devices when someone rings my door bell which is good. I have several Echo Shows and I think it should pop up a live feed (or at least a picture) automatically when someone rings the bell. Instead I get a message that someone is ringing my door bell. Even better since it is 2021 would be to recognize the person and tell me "Joe Smith is ringing your door bell"!The picture quality of the camera is pretty good. Unlike the other Blink cameras it's more of a fish eye view to capture the whole area.One thing I thought was a bit strange during the installation. Even though I'm using the power from the door bell wires, I still had to put the batteries in to set up the power part and the part that actually rings the physical door bell.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2021

Review Text: The motion detection feature is the major problem here. It lags and often does not detect pedestrian movement, but seems to pick up vehicles well, which I don't want.  When and if a person is detected during daylight hours, the video captures them walking away for a fraction of a second. With vehicles, I am constantly getting notifications even though I have the camera set to exclude movement coming from the street. That function is definitely not working as it captures every car travelling down the block. The quality of the video is good during daylight hours or when an area is lit during darkness. Night vision is pretty much worthless as it might show you a shadow or shape of whatever is passing by. If Amazon can figure out the lag and motion detection issues, this has the potential to be a decent system at an inexpensive price.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2022

Review Title: Short battery life if there is a lot of activity
Review Text: Pro's: The Camera is good, very clear, easy to installCon's: The motion detection is very sensitive.  Short lithium battery life (my first set lasted a month).  If you don't pay for a monthly service  you will only get notifications when someone triggers the motion detection or presses the doorbell.  It doesn't store a history of video without the service. The subscription costs around $3.00 for basic service or $10.00 for pro service.  It is not capable of writing to a SD card... so you should opt for a service.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2022

Review Text: Its about time!  Finally catching up withRing. Installation was simple, my 7 year old can do it. Clarity is great and so is the detection. I would recommend this for anyone.My only complaint is this-you cannot turn on notifications for just the doorbell IF you have an existing camera setup thru Blink. My notifications are always off and I check it frequently. I would get many notifications in a day if I left it on. The purpose of the doorbell is obvious but why not figure out how to separate this from the rest of the cameras with a current system.  I believe the only way is to have a separate modem for Blink. Please fix this!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2021

Review Text: Dislike:Most say the mounting is difficult, I find it incredibly easy and even easier to remove. I can pop it on and off easily which means it could get stolen.The camera angle is bad. I used to just use an outdoor camera mounted above my door, which sees everything including faces, where packages are left, etc, and is out of reach from thieves. This doorbell camera doesn’t see the ground in front of the door, you just get waist up and lots of sky. Basically - blind spots everywhere. I’m guessing this is typical of any doorbell camera so less of a knock in blink and just a realization these things are a waste of money without serious mounting modifications.It’s a fairly large doorbell, and if you need a wedge or modification to mount it, it protrudes out a lot.Doesn’t seem very weather resistant. Lots of gaps, doesn’t sit flush or tight. Not a problem for me since I have a large covering but for some this could pose an issue.Like:You can connect it to your doorbell, which worked out well enough.Easy to set up and mount, took all of 15 min.Price… for just the doorbell it’s less than half most other options, so I won’t feel too bad when it aggravates me enough that I ditch it.Summary I’ll use it for a while and see how it goes but a security camera above the door plus a regular doorbell is a much better set up.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2021

Review Text: I was expecting the battery to die out already but it's still going strong. Bought this because the other products require physical wiring for power and battery sounded very ncie if it really can last long. Install was very easy and it's been capturing motion in the areas I need it to. It's been running since November and been capturing videos into the Sync module 2. The only thing I do have a problem with and reason to remove a star is when videos are sent to the sync module, there are no thumbnails like it does for cloud storage. It would be very easy to have the sync module create thumbnails even in a delayed manner for the videos since it's connected to wire for power and don't have to worry about battery usage. As an Amazon company, you should be more customer focus and not try to limit features to have people buy the cloud plan.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2022

Review Text: Works great BUT the only 2 gripe I have1: Is the "limit the Field of view" doesn't work to help you limit what the camera picks up when you have the "Motion camera" Enabled, I know that is a BETA feature but I have used it on the stand alone camera's for a VERY long time and would be nice to have working. With out this feature working the camera picks up vehicles going up and down the road or even Horses across the road about 60' away and will really eat up the Batteries quickly.2: To have a real inside doorbell sound inside without having a wired Doorbell you need to buy the "CHIME" I think or have your phones volume turned up and with you but if your not home and others are they just hear the Alexa say your message, My Alexa merely tells me someone is at the front door and doesn't really ring.B Mills
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2021

Review Text: Really great quality of video, runs off AA batteries so truly wireless but most definitely has its faults. Biggest complaint is any kind of settings change requires you to immediately go ring the doorbell for settings to take affect. This is ineffective if you were away from the location I need to increase your sensitivity levels or other settings. Please know that you will have to purchase a month plan through the Blink company or you will not be able to view any of the security footage once your trial period runs out. Absolutely great Quality a video and links with the other blink cameras so I suppose this is worth it for me. Doorbell cameras are definitely Not at all what I thought they were going to be for sure.

Review Title: Finally.  It’s here and it works.
Review Text: I’ve been waiting at least 4 years for this Blink doorbell product.  I initially installed Blink cameras around my home, but had to add a Ring doorbell for the front door entry area.  I don’t know why it took Blink so long to develop the doorbell.Anyways, it’s finally here and it works fine!  I no longer have to rely on a two-vendor solution. ( It was a hassle having to maintain a Blink and Ring solution.)The doorbell integrates seamlessly with the rest of the Blink products.  It was very easy to add and install.  As others have mentioned, the only challenge was slipping back on the top cover (needs to be pressed on and slid down).The video quality is great and the ring is loud.  I have no complaints.  It’s no different from the rest of my Blink cameras, and can be just as easily monitored on my iPhone and computers.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2021

Review Text: Ok, so I finally got time to install my Blink Door bell.  Installation was pretty straight forward, you should play with installing the doorbell onto the mount a little before actually installing it, they make it tight and hard for a reason.  After installing it with the flat mount I decided I would be better served using the included wedge mount.  One problem, there are no screws included to mount the flat mount to the wedge mount, only screws for the plastic anchors to mount the unit to the wall.  I will contact customer service and no doubt they will take care of me as Amazon always has.I am still playing with and learning settings, but initially the audio has an echo/reverb/repeat something fierce, I am guessing this can be dealt with in setting, I just need to play with them enough to figure it out.I went with the wired set up to connect to my existing doorbell.  Only issue that bothers me at this moment is I need to kill the chime on the Blink door bell so it does not ring along with the inside chime.  Its a personal preference, but I have never rang a door bell that you couldn't hear from the door, no reason to hear two different chimes at once it is kind of annoying.Now I just installed this thing, so this is an initial review, and I am still figuring out features in the app.  I will give additional reviews the longer I have it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2021

Review Text: I have multiple blink cameras so I decided to get the doorbell when it came out. I had gotten my daughter a Ring camera and it was fairly easy to install. Right out of the box you can see how cheaply made the camera is. Includes nothing to assist with the install. Ring came with everything you needed from the blocks to the drill bit to install in brick. Any accessories you need must be ordered separately. It did come with screws to use in wood. Also if you thing you are doing away with batteries by hard wiring it, wrong!!! The wiring only powers the bell not the camera. Ring come with 2 rechargeable batteries so you can swap them out. I pre ordered the Blink in October, got it in November didn't really look at it till now...so out of my return window. Plus they already lowered the price 15.00 dollars from what I paid.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2021

Review Title: I wish I bought something else.
Review Text: You would think that a doorbell of all things would come with a wireless chime, or there would be at least an easy aftermarket accessory. I don't have a wired bell, and the only way I can get a response inside, which is hit or miss, is to set up an a Alexa skill. You'd think that since this in an Amazon device, they'd have a way to view the camera on a FireTV device. You can't really use this bell without a monitoring station, and unless you add a flash drive, the only way you can save your cam info is do sign up for a monthly service.This fails as a doorbell, is cumbersome to set up, and doesn't truly integrate the way I'd expect from Amazon. Pity as I own 4 fire tv sticks, the Amazon DVR, two Tablets and Eero. If you just need a doorbell to ring, forget this and pickup a nice looking wireless bell with an inside chime.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2022

Review Title: Easy to install, great quality of video.
Review Text: First time user for video doorbells with zero experience with home security systems. This was very easy to install and set up. Great quality of video and pictures. Only issue I had was that I wasn't getting notifications from the app and support wasn't helpful, kept trying to get me to return the device even tho I kept telling them that the bell/camera works fine, it was the app that wasn't sending push notifications. Eventually I figured out to just clear out the cache from the app and that did the trick. I did not get a Sync as this is the only Blink device I have but I may invest in another Blink camera with Sync for my back entrance/porch area. I'm still in the trial period for the subscription service and I'll probably subscribe once that's over since it's so cheap ($30/yr for Basic). IMO this is a great intro to video doorbells and basic home security, especially for the price point.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2021

Review Text: Finally Blink produced a doorbell. When I got the notification I went ahead and pre-ordered. If you invested into the cameras already the doorbell is a no brainer. Once you scan the qr code everything syncs to your account. Name the camera, pick its location.... smooth setup. It can either be battery powered or hard wired to an existing doorbell. We preferred the battery option so we'd get the optimal placement for it. This being our first video doorbell I have nothing to compare it to. Honestly never thought of purchasing one until this was offered. We have no issues. Only thing I'd ask is would it be possible in a update to add a few new chimes. Our previous battery powered doorbell and receiver speaker's bells were more harmonious vs blink's sounding winey. Maybe it's in the settings... If so I'll update this post.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2021

Review Title: Great start but not as advertised
Review Text: I have been a long term Blink customer (prior to Amazon ownership) and overall I've been happy with the family of products. Affordable, does the job, and no additional services required. I've long awaited the door bell. Installation was relatively straightforward; just follow the online installation instructions. The one MAJOR disappointment I have is the fact that the unit DOES NOT work with IFTTT. (I challenge anyone to show me how to get the camera from the doorbell to show up in the motion detect trigger within the free IFTTT app.) Blink tech support was no help. They said "it should work" but made not recommendations beyond what I had already done (e.g. remove the blink activation from IFTTT, sign out, etc, etc). This was a huge disappointment because I was going to leverage IFTTT on the camera trigger to activate my IFTTT enabled "door bell chime". Based on the fact that the product doesn't work with IFTTT I gave it two stars; fix this problem and I'd adjust the review to 4 stars.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2021

Review Text: They are ok, accept for my wife trying to use them.  She is technologically impaired.  Sorry honey.  Anyway, yeah, they are just ok.  I get the notification that someone is at the front door, and by the time the video loads, the person has come and gone.  I've only had one person use the door bell.  That worked okay too. I'm going to have to fine tune the aiming of the doorbell camera, as I cannot see the face of the person whom is at the door.  I have three additional cameras, and  yet to install the third one.  One of the cameras I have outside, I placed in a poor spot...right above the dryer vent! Duh!  It has picked up the neighbors pets that roam the neighborhood, but it also has been fogged up by rain, snow and of course, dryer steam.  One other camera is in the house, and my wife reports that when I speak into my phone, to that camera, my voice is broken up.  I thought maybe I was talking too loud.  I have more testing to do.

Review Text: I returned all of the Blink doorbell things.  I had it all hooked up and set to go after three attempts. Found the back of the doorbell broken, just the back. Asked for a replacement which is not done. Asked to replace JUST the doorbell. Couldn’t do that either. Since my doorbell and Sync 2 module were purchased as a set, I had to return both. The doorbell was already mounted as were 1-2 cameras. We had to remove them all. The cameras are worthless without the doorbell and the sync 2 module. It was all very frustrating. To top this all off, I bought the doorbell and sync set during Black Friday sales at a really good price. If I were to replace the set, I would have to pay the difference, an additional $35. Oh, but I was generously offered a $10 refund. I’ll wait until Cyber Days to maybe purchase these again.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2022

Review Title: Works really well - quite happy with it after almost 1 month
Review Text: This was a very affordable door bell and I am impressed with how well it works.  There is one thing I have noticed that could use a bit of improvement and that would be the coverage is a bit less than I would like on one side.  I don't know why since it's aimed straight ahead but it definitely favors on side over the other.  But that's fine if they get in the sight closer up it sees that and sends a notification.  The speaking part works very well and notifications can be picked up when away from home.  Now whether that means it reaches my phone or it's feeding off of my ipad and then sending to my phone I can't tell you.  But it's nice to know what's going on while away.  I haven't hooked it up to my amazon devices yet, we shall see if I want or feel the need to do that, but right now this works just fine.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2021

Review Title: Too good to be true... Please! read the review other then "5 stars" before buying.
Review Text: This is my review, it may sound biased or even hatred to it but I purchase this Blink doorbell with Sync Module 2 on sale on Nov 29, 2021, for $65 + $15 USB flash drive. I won't recommend buying at full price unless you are the type of person who is the monthly subscription user and by all means. It is a great device with a subscription.Without the subscription, it kinda sucks... I live in an apartment complex and needed some kind of camera to record the delivery of my packages. Since packages get stolen is very common in my area or any apartments in general. This is my opinion but I also hate subscription fees... There are way too many subscriptions now these days but the Blink doorbell was a cheaper option vs the rest of the doorbells on the market.The truth is that once your free 1-month trial period is over. The doorbell turns into a security camera...  The only function it has left is to record the motion detection onto the flash drive connecting to Sync Module 2. The ability for me to view my video footage without paying extra, it sold me into buying it. My biggest complaint is that it ONLY record motion detection footage without subscriptions! You are no longer able to record ANY footage from someone walking up to you're door and pressing the physical button. My second complaint is that it uses an expensive battery and has no ability to use a rechargeable battery?? C'mon now it's 2022..This doorbell gets 3 stars and that me being generous... Because in one whole month, I have to unplug and replug the "Sync Module 2" too many times. It randomly stops recording footage into the flash drive even though I get a notification of "Motion detected at your front door"? What other feature is left if this doesn't even work properly for a non-subscription user? Amazon please work on your Sync Module 2... It need some kind of feature like button on the app for a "reset". I'm not home all the time to keep unplug and replug for it to start recording onto the flash drive again.Oh, I guess the only thing I don't have a complaint about and that works great is "Alexa integration".
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2022

Review Text: A great alternative to Ring and other more polished and expensive products out there. Pretty simple setup.A few things to keep in mind:1. Setup the sync module first and then the camera. (Also have USB Flash Drive Ready for storage)2. Also setup your your ZONE so that way, the camera doesn't record all the time and kill your battery prematurely.3. Enable Alexa integration to allow notification charm on echo devices besides your phones.A couple of features and enhancements to make it better:• SD or Micro SD instead of USB Flash drive will save some space.• Builtin Charm on the Sync Module will definitely help those who have family members that may not have access to the app or may not want to link to Alexa and echo devices. Since the sync module requires direct power anyways adding in a charm makes it simple for most users.Not sure how battery will hold up. Will update once I have more detail on this.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2021

Review Title: Compatibility issues with some WiFi routers
Review Text: I had tons of issues with the Blink Doorbell which were only solved after I moved all my Blink devices to a different WiFi router.Using my previous router (which was working with all of my other wireless devices), half of the video clips were missing from the Blink app, errors occurred during configuration & when saving settings, the Blink app usually failed to take a snapshot or bring up live video, the Doorbell locked up and required batteries to be removed to reset it, clip backup failures intermittently occurred from the cloud to the Sync Module 2's USB drive, etc.  These issues went away with a new WiFi router.Now the biggest annoyance is that, with Motion Detection enabled, I get notifications on my phone every time a car goes down the street.  But at least now there's a video clip recorded.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2021

Review Text: Needs the absolute best wifi on planet earth to even work.Does NOT have a door bell chime inside the house you will need your phone with you at all times.Loading the live view is impossible. I included a shortened video it went on longer.This product works when it wants toIt’s only been 3 hours with it and I hate it. I am returning it.I don’t like the quality of the picture or sound. Review Text: A great video doorbell for the price. It may not be or have the high-quality video and advanced features as some of the other competitors in the market but it does the job well.  Plus, I decided to get the blink doorbell since my home has many blink cameras (indoor and outdoor).  The price seems right but it did not include a corner or wedge mount -- that will cost you an additional 13 dollars or 8 if you get it on sale. Given that the corner or wedge are essential parts for doorbells that are to the side of the door, I thought this was an oversight by blink to include it since for pennies for the dollar they could have included these parts. The video quality is good during the day it has a bit of trouble dealing with the front when the sun is out. The night video is ok (grainy but it works).
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2021

Review Title: It is fine except for the mounting process
Review Text: I agree with the other reviewers who struggled with the mount.  The camera and microphone work great and it was very easy to connect it to my existing Blink account and sync module--works well on my phone and my Alexa Show. The ONLY problem is the mount---I watched the video, followed the directions and tried my best to get it to work with my vinyl siding--no problem connecting the back piece to the siding but I couldn't get the camera/doorbell part to connect to the backpiece.  The only way I could finally use it was to connect the back piece to the unit before mounting, and then use heavy duty double sided mounting tape to connect it to my outer glass door frame. It works, but heaven knows if I'll be able to take it apart when I need to replace the batteries!  Maybe they'll have the problem fixed by the time I need to service it, and I can just get a new one!  Fortunately the price was reasonable.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2021

Review Text: I got this for my husband for Christmas and we installed it to the existing doorbell wiring. When we press the button to test it, there is a humming sound that continues for some time. Did research and found out that our 40 plus year old door bell did not have enough voltage to make the video door bell work properly. We need to upgrade the transformer for the existing door chimes. Long story short, I have no idea where the old one is and don't want to crawl around in my attic or in the crawl space of my home. Found a website that addressed this very issue. Did you know there is such a thing as a plug in transformer? I did not either, but for around $20 I can upgrade the transformer and not have to crawl around in my home in search of the hidden transformer. Blink needs to have this as an option for this model video doorbell.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2021

Review Title: Come on Amazon You can do so much better!
Review Text: First, I tried Ring. After two non-working units and countless fruitless and frustrating hours I gave up. For some reason I decided to try Blink. When will I learn?Pros:*Easy Installation (You do need to drill holes)*Monthly service is reasonableCons:*The two year battery died after 40 days.*The doorbell doesn’t ring on Alexa so it only notifies people with blink installed on their devices. Not great when you have a house sitter or company over.*You can’t change the field of view like you could on the Ring so my device is picking up the road when armed and constantly going off.*There tends to be a lag when trying to view motion or doorbell activity even with excellent wifi.Overall, Amazon missed the mark again.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2022

Review Text: Spent more then two week, countless support calls, talked to at least 6 different tech supports, 2 replacement unites to finally to get the doorbell to connect to the network.Both time the units were determined to have firmware issue where it does not join the system together with the sync module. However it would connect separately without a sync module.Also, according to tech support, since I have over 30 wireless devices connect to my router, the door bell won't connect. I have multiple cameras, smart-home devices all works just fine with my route and never got blamed for having too many devices.Some other problems with the camera, it appears that can only work at one task at a time, when motion detected, can't view live, don't get door bell button press notifications.Also take a long time to view a recently recorded clip, will see a motion notification but take a long time before the recording can be viewed, and this is with the sync module. Only if it is recording to the cloud, with the subscription, than the clip is viewable almost instantly after recording.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2022

Review Title: STAY AWAY!  BACK PLATE ISSUES - POOR DESIGN
Review Text: I’ll try to be brief but all those complaints of people saying the doorbell won’t click to the back plate are true!  To Blinks credit, their customer is great and they have acknowledged this poorly designed doorbell. They are sending me a replacement so I’ll have to wait and see but wow. It’s as if a child with no design experience drew something up and the engineering team decided to go with it. If you’re lucky enough to get the unit to stick to the backplate, you still have to worry to not break it should you ever need to replace the batteries or remove the unit from the wall. The clips are so flimsy and the overall cheap quality of the doorbell is such a let down considering their camera system is top notch - which is why I got this doorbell. They definitely dropped the ball on this one
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2021

Review Text: Communicating through the door bell is useless. There is at least a 5 second delay between what happens on the porch and what you see or hear on your phone. Picks up sound well enough, but the speaker sounds like a garbled mess. Tech support acts like it's the internet that's the problem, but no other devices in our house have any issues with the network. Motion detection works well and notifies for every movement, but only some videos actually upload.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2021

Review Text: We bought this as a cheaper alternative to a ring doorbell. Which I’ve also owned and returned. The motion sensing on this is terrible. You either get every single motion detection. Or none. It got to the point where I had to shut off the notifications because I was tired of seeing cars drive by my house. Also have had this for 2 months and have already changed the batteries 4 times. Which isn’t cheap or easy. Now after this last battery change it has dropped the network and will not reconnect. Which is great considering I just had to sign up for a yearly plan. I say had because after the trial period it will no longer save recordings without a subscription basically making it totally useless.  The basic plan is what I bought  $30 for the year. Which i actually thought was reasonable. But now the camera is just a prop to repel any bad apples from messing with my house. It won’t connect or record anything.  Definitely wouldn’t recommend this.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2022

Review Title: Not like other Blink devices, and not for you if you are used to Ring devices
Review Text: LIVE MODE:I’m sure this doorbell works for some people, but if you’re looking to check what happens around from time to time, beware that this device does not have a “live video” option. This is odd considering Blink’s devices are mainly used for live video surveillance and motion detection. So you’ll have to wait until someone presses the doorbell button (if you don’t get their membership) to detect movement. You could set up the armed mode, but then you’ll be dealing with unwanted notifications if your door bell aims a busy street.SET UP:Set up wasn't hard, and I used command strips to test the device before mounting, but I can see what others refer to when they say it’s hard to mount. The plastic part that you use to drill the device to the wall doesn’t line up well with the device’s prongs to attach, so I had to force it in fearing it would crack and break.In the end I’m returning this because I rather pay a little more for a device I’ll definitely use, won’t have to just settle for, and have to wait til the company releases basic features that other devices already have.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2021

Review Text: This has been a week long journey to get the Blink Doorbell to work.  The phone support the first two calls was not very helpful.  They wouldn't listen to how I was stating the problem and sent me a new backplate that really was not the issue.  Both times they said to call an electrican, but I knew that wasn't the issue.  I called the third time and connected to technical support.  They were very helpful and lead me through the app instructions for a wired doorbell.  There was a step that I had to indicate in the app that my voltage (low voltage) was within the range acceptable for the doorbell.  Once that was done, we continued through the app instructions and the doorbell now works fine.  Do follow the directions in the app, especially if doing a wired doorbell.  A big thank you to the Blink Tech Dept.!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2021

Review Text: I was hesitant to purchase this based on some reviews about mounting problems. I replace the ring doorbell with the blink doorbell since I have blink cameras. I had absolutely no problems mounting it. Took about 5 minutes and it's working well. I will update further after the 30 days free trial.*Update* all cameras and sync module blinking green, won't read wifi. All my other devices are working fine.  Have a strong wifi.. Don't even bother to contact customer service, they will just blame it on your wifi even though cameras were all working fine for weeks.*Update 2* After working all day trying to reset all devices it suddenly started working. I don't know if blink servers were down on their end. They should probably notify us if that was the case. I will give this one more chance before I pay for subscription plan.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2021

Review Title: Live view extremely hit or miss
Review Text: My husband and I got a blink camera system because we wanted external security cameras, but we live in a rental, so wired in was not an option. That being said, the battery powered security options are very limited. Blink seemed like the perfect solution.It will do for now, but for anyone with the capability to wire in their system, I would not recommend blink. More often than not we get error messages saying “live view failed” when we attempt to look through the cameras, and I have yet been able to successfully look through the doorbell. It does pick up motion and the clips are clear (for all the cameras) but this has been very frustrating for us.Additionally, I have been unable to set up the “zones” for the doorbell because it will not allow me to update the thumbnail to check the zones, because live view is unresponsive. So overall, I wouldn’t recommend these cameras, but it will suffice until we are somewhere that we can wire in.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2021

Review Text: Be AWARE,Good little front doorbell camera. Motion sensor is great. I had the battery installed to power the camera and it’s wired to my chime. After about a month usage, it would say low battery. I thought by wiring to the home chime, the doorbell will draw power from the transformer. After doing some reading online, I was wrong. Blink doorbell will only be power by 2x  AA batteries. The wired connection is only for hooking up to your home chime. Blink doorbell CANNOT BE POWER WITH WIRED CONNECTION. Please be aware of this. Why required 16-24v wired connection and not power the doorbell? Worse designed flaw. I would give it 5 stars if the camera can actually be powered by wired connection.Updating my review from 3 to 4 stars.1/01/2022Was recently contacted by Amazon blink specialist about an issue I had with the blink doorbell camera. Their support was spot on and was able to help clarified some of the issue I had.1.verified that the blink doorbell camera CAN NOT be powered by wired connection. 2 AA battery is required.2. They are sending me a sync module to help make the doorbell battery last longer. Hopefully this will make my battery last more than a month.3. Description and pictures doesn’t clearly state that wired connection will not power the camera. The support team sent my concern up to the marketing team.4.I bumped the review to 4 stars because of their support team. Their fast action and responds
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2021

Review Text: Recently (few months ago) started looking to replace my old smart doorbell and found a good deal for Blink doorbell. I already had Blink cameras so didnt had to buy additional sync module. By the way if you dont already have Blink sync module, you will have to buy it at additional cost.Overall, the camera has been working good. Video quality is good , night vision can be inmproved. Alexa integration is done well, and I have automated the doorbell to telecast to my echo show when the door bell is pressed. Sound quality can be improved as I had some trouble. All in all a good buy, I will recomend if you already have a Blink sync module or other Blink cameras. If you are not tied into the Blink ecosystem, buying the sync module adds up and dosent keep this door bell price effective.In addition, I like that one can opt out of the monthly subscription and store all the videos locally on the Blink sync module. Thats a big cost saving.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2022

Review Title: The doorbell is complete garbage. Very cheap and the back cover is horrible .
Review Text: Don’t waste your money. I have a whole system of blink cameras and the Doorbell is cheaply put together. The back cover will break and fall off before you get a chance to hang it. And if you can hang it it will certainly fall down with the slightest touch.

Review Title: You get what you pay for
Review Text: Worked well for the one free month of subscription - live view came up fairly quick and saved video access was fast.But after that even basic live view stopped loading. For weeks it would either not work or take forever to upload live view. Of course, same internet connection, same product settings & everything else. Then last week it started loading but today, not in the mood! And dont forget, all this “nothing” after pairing it with a $35 hub.Yes it rings the original home chime but needs battery to function. Slick marketing! Made me think connection to existing wiring also powered this doorbell. Now the battery life is literally only handfull weeks if you arm the system for motion recognition.Overall cheap product gives you cheap functions! I will likely replace with higher quality doorbell so that at the very least it shows me front door on the app. Otherwise your conventional electric doorbell is best!!Sorry Amazon… its one of your most disappointing products!—Amazon fan
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2022

Review Title: Used in a well lighted secure apt building
Review Text: I just bought one and will mount it on my door inside an amazon vice grip door mount. I will hot glue the front face to the mount it will sit in, plus use the packing to keep it in place as well.Just an FYI the back plate doesnt always snap onto the back plate. i had to call to get a replacement. But it still works with batteries without the back plate being attached. The back plate is mainly used for mounting and holding batteries in place. The batteries really dont need back plate. Only for wall mounting purposes.Just a warning the device left like its outside can be easily dismounted or takened apart from its base. If someone wanted to take it they could. There is no locking method to secure front plate to the back plate mount on the wall.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2022

Review Title: Great Addition to Existing Blink System
Review Text: I have been supplementing my wired security camera system with Blink XT2 cameras in locations where running wires to the necessary location would have been inconvenient. Been working well for past year or so. This doorbell addition now allows me now to view the faces and not only the tops of the heads of individuals coming up my stairway where a Blink camera is positioned higher out of arms reach.Works much better than anticipated in terms of recognition of motion and recording of images. Note that camera doesn't do well pointed into sunlight as images tend to get washed out if you've got a bright backlight behind the subject but overall cannot complain about this product. Have not gotten any false motion triggers unlike with the other Blink cameras.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2021

Review Title: Slow response time when not using the cloud but the Sync Module 2. Not very useful.
Review Text: I'm using it to replace an existing doorbell with 24Vac power supply. The installation is quite streight forward, and the wedge mount is very good for those situation where you need to put the camera with a certain angle. After the installing the hardware, following the step by step App instruction is not a problem, but if you have a Sync Module 2, it may be tricky to notice that both system must be under the same group (The interface/instructions could be improved). The real issue is the response time, if you have a cloud subscription the App will show images and video pretty fast, if you only plan to use the Sync Module 2 , sometime it takes more than 20-30 seconds to show a live image, meaning it's too late to see somebody at the front door.Is it meant to be like that to promote the cloud subscription?During my tests I also noticed that the motion detection is often sending a notification with a picture showing nobody, meaning I had the time to walk at the front door and away without been captured by the camera.The 2 way audio quality is very good.So far it is not meeting my expectations.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2022

Review Title: Cheap junk with known bugs- DO NOT BUY THIS
Review Text: I have spent too many hours on the phone and in chat with support only to learn that there is a known bug that notifications do not work with Android phones (S21). What a crock. Unless I stare at my phone 24/7 I will never know someone is at the door. Even when all of the apps are installed and connected it takes way too long to connect to be useful. You want to answer the doorbell in real time, not wait for it to synch up every time.  Even the motion detection is not useful because the filter grid does not work. I bought an Echo just to act as a wireless chime because Blink does not make one. It is basically useless. Spend more money and get a working product. Blink, don't release junk before it is tested. Duh. How terribly disappointing. Amazon should know better.

Review Text: ***UPDATE: Blink contacted me after posting this review. They’ve done an excellent job resolving the issue. They determined the doorbell I received was defective & they sent a replacement. Replacement has been working well for almost 2 weeks now. I’ve updated the rating based on the great service and getting a replacement. ***I bought this to replace my Ring that stopped working after many years. Product looks pretty but functionality is lacking tremendously. My feedback:1) Needs AA batteries even when wired. Batteries barely last a week.2) Video quality is poor unless you set IR sensitivity to medium or high. However, this drains your AA batteries significantly.4) door bell chime does not work once battery drains5) with battery draining this fast, if you are away from home for more than a few days, you can be assured you won’t have video recording (sync module needs to be purchased separately, fyi).

Review Title: The ABSOLUTE worse setup instructions ever created. Awful tech support.
Review Text: I was very hopeful in buying this "smart" doorbell. Tried to set it up and had no luck getting it to work. Just had a flashing blue light on the doorbell button but nothing else. The instructions are almost non-existent. I called tech support and after going through several automated steps, I was put on hold for the next available agent. After about 5 minutes, an automated response comes back to tell me they would have to call me back. Alright. This could wait until morning.  Well guess what? Morning came and went, as did the afternoon, as did the evening and no phone call. I finally got it to pair with the sync module only to discover that the lag time in the live view is pitiful. By the time you open the app and look to see who rang the bell, they are gone. The next day, I returned it for a refund. But wait! There's more. Five days later, tech support finally calls me. I chuckled and told them it was too late. I had returned the item. So to sum it up, if you think you might be one of the lucky ones that gets it to work out of the box, relying not on the lame setup instructions that comes in the box but on a few YouTube videos... I wish you luck. But if you think their tech support will. be there for you when you need them, THEY WON'T!

Review Text: hard wire fix…… leave batteries in during setup. Take out when done.If you are using a hard wired unit use a meter to determine volts.Backstory:I hooked everything up as it should be but the setup app was not recognizing the door bell as there wasn't power to proceed( with doorbell wires hooked up and no batteries) I did this 3 times. Followed their directions to a “T”. Still didnt work got stuck in the app.Finally I put batteries in AND hooked up hard wires followed all steps within app. Bam. Doorbell box chimed. App said it was running off external power.I was able to remove batteries and not ever worry about it again.The physical mount plate i had no issue with. Less pressure seemed to not break it.

Review Text: I have several Simplisafe products, at a much steeper price, than the Blink Doorbell. I Love this doorbell. We put it on our back door, where most people come in and it has worked beautifully. It rings on my cellphone and on the Alexa in our home. We also, have 6 outdoor cameras from Blink and they also work beautifully. I truly can't find anything I do not like this doorbell. We have been contacted by the Blink Customer Service Dept. before when one of our outdoor cameras was not working properly. They sent us a new camera. An absolutely amazing company that offers great products and great service. I highly recommend this doorbell. We connected ours through our wired system. We have recommended to several folks who have visited us and they have also purchased.
