Review Text: I rarely write reviews but this product is just amazing for the price. It’s half the price of the Ring and works like a charm too for half a price (we had Ring when we were renting). The night vision is good not perfect but I don’t know with the complaints. Then you can turn on(or off) motion detection if nobody’s home and you want it to act like surveillance cam. Complaints about the motion is being detected every time a car passes or person passes on the road are probably not tweaking the their active/inactive zones.2-way mic/speaker is good but not perfect. If you press “talk/mic icon” and there’s a lot of background noise near you, the audio you’ll be receiving on your end is not that clear but it works very well.The ecosystem or app response is nice. Doesn’t lag or hang up (unless you have a bad internet of course!).I’ll recommends this to everyone. I actually told some of my friends and families already about this wince it’s quite knew that they only know Ring and Eufy.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2021

Review Text: I really do not want to degrade the product, therefore, I will say it was a poor investment for me.I purchased the Doorbell and two Outdoor Cameras, and here are my concerns.1.  By the time the camera senses the motion and start recording, the subject has "Come and Gone".  The closest I have seen someone approaching my house (front) is their back entering the porch area.  The Amazon delivery people are so fast, I get a glimsp when they ring the doorbell and the front camera does not pick them up "Coming or Going". The second camera is on the Patio (see #2).2.  On the few (very few) ocassions that I have been able to see a subject (all three cameras) I was not able to identify who they were because they were blacked out due to back light.I went online to the support site and it indicated the delay on recording wass due to weak wify signal, so I attempted to measure signal strength with two phones and a laptop at each camera location. (my neighbors had to think I was crazy on a ladder with a laptop)  The signal strength was good on each of this devicees. I removed the cameras and checked signal strengthon each staanding in front of the router.  I switch to the ATT modem and each time the camera indicate weak signal (2 bars).  I cannot say definitively that it is the camera but I am suspect.  BTW, is there anyway to switch wifi connections without deleting the camera?  The sync module seems to be fine, but it is sitting next to the router.I missed the return deadline due to illness but I am asking them to replace the camera, maybe, I will get lucky.  I will update this post if I do!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2022

Review Text: UPDATE:  I still love this system. I have 2 doorbells as well as 2 outside cameras. But the one thing I don’t like is the lag. It doesn’t start recording fast enough and sometimes you miss whatever triggered it.  I’m hoping the developers will work on that.  I wish I could give 4 1/2 stars. Review Title: Did not detect a human walking in front of it
Review Text: For over ten days, it seemed every movement successfully tripped the motion sensor. Cat, moped, human, puppy, deliveries, me stepping onto the porch to feed kittie; the sensor seemed pretty sensitive. Then, about three days ago, apartment management made it onto the porch to leave a flyer and the motion detection only caught the individual as they left. Retained a bit less confidence in the system but at least it caught SOMETHING. Then, earlier today, quite randomly, I glanced out  the window to see someone walking on the sidewalk in front of our door--the same sidewalk upon which small animals have trotted and set off the camera--and NOTHING. It was kind of unbelievable after having a tumbleweed set off the system from well beyond the sidewalk. Nuts.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2022

Review Text: It's nice to integrate into just one app, but the entire system has to be armed in order to have the doorbell cam detect motion or capture clips. It will still capture if the doorbell rings, but I miss it functioning like a camera and just showing motion detection. The 'arm' schedule is very difficult to set up in the app - it's all or nothing - so it's a lot of manually turning the camera on. I'm on the fence and may return or sell, and go back to my Nest.Update: I got a second sync module and am now able to arm only the blink camera and leave the rest of my cameras unarmed. Much improved. The nest cam was still a little quicker to show a preview with the doorbell press but overall I've updated to 4 stars. Blink was much easier to install and connect.

Review Title: Tech support was excellent with an issue
Review Text: We love this doorbell. We had an issue with installation, the doorbell wouldn’t communicate with the Sync Module correctly. We tried troubleshooting ourselves & had no luck so we contacted tech support through the RouteThishelps app as recommended in the troubleshooting steps. I recommend downloading the app If you have connectivity issues. Tech support was able to give us a solution that worked on the first try.The video quality is great. We have better granularity on defining the monitoring zone than we did with a Ring doorbell. The doorbell is sleek & matches the exterior making it almost invisible from the sidewalk. We love that.The doorbell doesn’t work great on a 5G network. I hope they fix that soon. Otherwise, great device.

Review Title: Blink Video Doorbell Review - DEC 2021 - Video Capture Response time is way too long!
Review Text: Decided to try the Blink and was not too disappointed. Read some of the reviews about issues like the base plate not being easy to install and WIFI connections. First off my existing doorbell transformer supply power is 11VAC which is below the required 16VAC minimum required. Works just fine on 11VAC. 2nd, the base plate seemed to not want to snap into place when mounted flush against the door jamb. I ended up using two small pieces of 1/4" plastic tubing cut to about an 1/8" as a stand off. Once the base plate was just off the surface it seemed to snap into place very easy. Overall the installation was a breeze with the only pain being with the Alexa integration. My only issue is with video capture response time as you could drag the couch out of my house before the capture starts .  Still haven't been able to get Alexa to make any announcements. I'm sure it's just something I missed in the Alexa App settings.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2021

Review Text: Blink had substantial delays with releasing a powered doorbell cam.That said, the product they finally released has met or exceeded my expectations.As usual, the Blink camera tech works very well. The wide field of view covers a lot of area while still looking as normal as possible. They made that wide view doorbell cam tradeoff there "just right."Build quality, ease of installation and integration with the existing app are also well-done. Options on how the doorbell functions (how it integrates with an existing doorbell or works in a non-doorbell location) are also excellent.This has proven to be a well-designed, well-built doorbell cam that performs very well. I'm very satisfied with how the final product has turned out.

Review Text: I replaced a nest doorbell that had quit working with this doorbell.  I’m relatively comfortable installing.  I’ve installed several nest thermostats and a nest doorbell with no issues.  This is difficult to install.  The screw spacing on the back bracket does not line up with the nest doorbell (which lined up exactly with my previous doorbell).  You’ll potentially need a drill to create new holes for this doorbell in order to install.  This was an annoying inconvenience.  Once the bracket is wired in (optional) and screwed in place, clipping the doorbell onto the bracket is very difficult.  You need to connect the doorbell to the bracket (completely install it) before you can flip the breaker to see if it works.  Mine did not so I had to take the whole thing apart to reinstall.  Frustrating but now I’m experienced at clipping the doorbell onto the bracket which was difficult.Once installed, I expected the interface to work more seamlessly with Alexa since it’s an Amazon product. It was no different than nest…. in fact, it was more steps/more complex.If I had it to do over again, I would purchase the nest over this device.  The sync module with local storage is what made me choose this over the nest and while that is a nice feature, it’s not worth the hassle of the setup and interface of this device.I

Review Text: Install was not too bad. But tech support walked me through getting it linked with the hub for local storage. everything seemed to be working great. I do not use alexa, so a bit disappointing you cant use google home.Update. I keep getting a backup failed alert on my phone every day. Emailed tech support and they do not know what that means. Their company is sending me the alerts for crying out loud.Well if you like bad servers, buggy software and inept tech support this is the doorbell for you. Every issue you have there response is to delete every thing and start over. Only to find out it a server issue on their end and you wasted a bunch of time. Then when the issue comes back, Guess what. They tell you to delete everything and start over again.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2021

Review Text: Clunky setup and hard to follow.  Without the cloud subscription this product is useless.  I emphasize this because disk space is very cheap and for Amazon not to allow the consumer to leverage local storage is being greedy.  You can purchase a 256gb usb stick for 30 bucks which could hold a year or more of video. I went with Eufy camera awesome product.  So for this I give this product one star
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2021

Review Title: Does not store Video Locally horrible customer service. *Update*
Review Text: I dont do reviews... but this is especially horrible. I should have spent the extra for a ring. I have dumped a lot of time trying to get this to work. Its been really frustrating. I typically build my own solutions but this time I just wanted an out of the box doorbell setup. This was far from that....I bought the doorbell sync 2 and 3 cameras. The cameras all work fine for local storage after I canceled the annoying 30day premium trial. The doorbell does not. I contacted support multiple times and all they did was blame my wifi... but how is it my wifi when it syncs fine to the cloud and all of the other cameras work? I even brought the doorbell in right next to the sync and wifi with still no go. response times from supports are 2-5 days and its a different person emailing you back every time.  I would only recommend this to someone I dislike immensely.**Update**Adding a star as I figured out the idd steps you need to take. Hopefully someone finds these helpful.To store video on sync 2:1. Aquire proper USB storage2. Format USB storage as exFAT3. Install USB storage4. Make sure you have added all of your cameras to your system.5. Cancel Subscription (every time you add a camera you will get a 30day subscription)6. Make sure all cameras are named the way you want.7. Remove sync2 from your system.8. Reset sync2 via the reset button (small hole next to usb)9. Add sync2 back to your system.If you rename a canera you must repeat steps 6-9If you add a new camera you must repeat steps 4-9Hope this is helpful to someone.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2022

Review Text: I was very excited for this to be released.  I pre-ordered and have now had it around 3 weeks (almost 4).  I've adjusted the settings numerous times, but can't get the combination that works for me.  Every passing car (especially at night/early morning) sets it off (the street is about 50 feet from the door).  If I lower  the sensitivity so that it doesn't pick up the cars, it then doesn't detect someone 2 feet from the door in broad daylight.  I have 6 Blink outdoor cameras that I adore and never have problems with.  If I had known all of the issues trying to get this one right, I would have skipped it.  I'll keep adjusting it and if I ever get a combination that works, I'll re-rate it, but right now it's not looking too likely.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2021

Review Text: If you have any issues with this item contact Blink customer service. They’re very accommodating at reaching any resolution for any issues you may have with the device. I had an issue with the back plate clip and I needed a replacement part. They handled the issue quickly and sent out a replacement immediately. I absolutely love the device and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for additional security in their home. This device is much more affordable than competing brands and offers all the same features. I also purchased a subscription after utilizing a free 30 day trial and am very happy with my Blink doorbell. In addition, the subscription is super affordable, and if you choose this product I have every confidence that you will not be disappointed. 10/10 would recommend 5 Stars.  ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2022

Review Text: The doorbell works fine and sounds pretty. If you have multiple Amazon echo devices I would suggest to make the notifications sound only on one or as few as possible to avoid the difference in response time from each device creating an echo all throughout your house (no pun intended). I'm not sure if it's an issue on my end but I am unable to view a live feed from either the blink app or the echo app. The echo app, the Amazon one, is supposed to allow me to view a live feed but the loading button just keeps going in circles so I'm assuming it has something to do with my connection but I don't want to dismiss it right away as that. But that is still no excuse for the blink app lacking a live feed feature. I don't think it's out of the realm of merit to be able to see a live feed through the blink doorbell camera without having anybody press the doorbell. So in conclusion it's a nice looking doorbell and it'll send you notifications to your phone where you can see the person at your front step, about 2 to 3 seconds lag time, but I wish I can pull up a live feed on my mobile device at will without anybody having to ring the doorbell. It's definitely better designed than the ring doorbell in terms of aesthetics. I'll update my review of needed. For now that's all.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2022

Review Title: Does not work with Echo Gen 4
Review Text: Not really sure what rating to give the Blink doorbell because other than not being compatible with my Echo Generation 4 it would get a 5* rating.  It connects with most of the older Echo's such as the Echo Dot's but not the newer Echo Gen 4.  Not believing that could be the case I contacted Blink customer service with the question "is the Echo Gen 4 supported?"  They instead referred me to the supported list which lists the Echo Gen 1 and Gen 2 but did not mention my Gen 4.  To complicate things the list included support for the Echo Studio Gen 2 and Gen 3 but not the Gen 1 which to my understanding is the only one that exists.  Customer service was polite but unhelpful.  Just a yes or no and I would have been satisfied.  Searching reviews I found a few who said they were unable to pair with the Echo Gen 4.  I have not seen 1 review where the Echo Gen 4 was successfully paired.  I have an older Echo Dot that I replaced with the Echo Gen 4 and the Dot connected perfectly.I'll gladly change my rating if I can pair my Echo Gen 4 to the Blink doorbell but I don't understand why customer service won't say whether they are compatible.  If they are not compatible that should be stated so customers can make the best decision on whether to buy the Blink doorbell.  I'll even buy an Echo Studio if necessary but based on their own supported list it would not work.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2022

Review Text: I have two outdoor Blink cameras that have worked well, but I cannot say the same for this doorbell. It's very slow to connect and often requires a couple of attempts before it will connect. This makes seeing who is at the door difficult. The daytime image is good, but the night image is poor. This may be due to where it is mounted as my front door is recessed several inches and immediately to the doorbells left is the end of a brick. It appears the Infrared light is reflected off the brick bright enough to wash out the image limiting it's usefulness.  As I had to drill holes in my aluminum door trim to mount the doorbell I'm not inclined to find another mounting location as the holes in the trim would be difficult to cover and hide. For my use it's only practical as a doorbell.(Additional) after submitting my original review I read quite a few of other reviews. The doorbell is difficult to mount and took several attempts, but it's not impossible. I wasn't aware there was a corner mount that would allow turning the doorbell until seeing it mentioned in other reviews. It as well as a wedge should be included in the package and I have to agree that it's price is high for a piece of plastic. Since half my view is of a nearby brick I'll most likely order one and hope it solves part of the problem. I also agree the photos used are misleading as the button is not lighted, which probably explains why most people tend to just knock on the door.Additional info: The day after I posted my review I was contacted by Blink support who offered to send me the angle mount free of charge. I accepted and received it several days later. I was pleased to see it was white because many people commented that it only came in black. The key to unlock the doorbell is not the easiest to use, but after removing it the mount did not take long to install. The mount definitely corrected the field of view and no longer is half my view blocked by a nearby brick. The mount also improved the night vision to where it is useable. Unrelated to the mount is still the problem that it usually takes several attempts to connect to live view and people do not seem to notice the doorbell button as it is the same color as the rest of the camera and most knock on the door. Having the button lit as shown in the pictures would be a great improvement.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2021

Review Title: Great product, but takes a little effort to install
Review Text: Now that it’s installed, it works great.  Syncs with hub easily and has good video/photos.  Here’s the downside…unless you have an existing doorbell on a flat surface with screws holes in exactly the same place as the blink doorbell, you will have some work to do.  Here’s my story.  I have siding on my house with cinder block behind it.  So, I didn’t want to drill new holes into the cinder block…plus, doing so would have made the screws that came with the doorbell too short.  So, I decided to use the existing screw holes…unfortunately they didn’t line up with the blink doorbell holes.  So, my solution was to drill a new hole through the plastic mount for the doorbell, which worked.  Then came the mounting.  Because my wall isn’t flat, I had to mount it carefully.  Too tight and the mount bends and the doorbell won’t go on.  Too loose and it’s not secure.  I found the sweet spot with some tinkering and all is good now.  While all of this may sound like a negative, I am happy with the product.  I would buy it again.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2021

Review Title: Could use a screw on either side of plate
Review Text: I like it and it seems good quality overall. The mounting of the doorbell to the plate is a real pain, but once I figured it out, it wasn't to bad. I wish there were 4 mounting screws instead of 2. There should be screws on either side of the plate along with the top and bottom. I mounted it and it doesn't sit totally flat against the door trim. The trim is flat. Still, it seems sturdy enough without to much wobble. I turned off the motion detection since I have a Blink camera that covers my porch and don't need traffic setting it off, even though I turned down the sensitivity.I don't think its a bad camera, I think the mount plate could have been beefier or had a screw on either side to really secure it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2021

Review Title: Not ready for prime time… but they are working on it
Review Text: UpdatedI will give customer service credit for proactively reaching out. They did address the issue of limited features when I didn’t have a sync module.  That bumps this up a couple of stars. I look forward to the redesign of the mount.  When I see that addressed I will update this again.  I do wish these were taken care of before launching, but as long as they get corrected in a timely fashion it heads in a positive direction.Hopefully more to come!Hey Amazon, get your act together.  This product is a dud.  I wanted to like it, but it doesn't set up as easily or function as nicely as the other Blink products.I have a sync module set up on my existing system, but not at the same location as this unit and it simply wouldn't let me set it up on that existing system.  I had to set up a new system without a sync module just for this one camera.And without the sync Module the functionality is inadequate.  Not simply reduced functionality, but completely inadequate.The motion detection unreliable and the build is cheap.  I'm sorry, but the way the unit attaches to the mounting plate is downright pathetic.  It is worse than some no-name-cheap-knockoff design kind of product.  The fragile little plastic teeth that this mounts to are literally thinner than a penny and the actual engagement is about 1mm.  The plastic tab that locks it delicate as well.  Even when I got it to all mounted it feels like it is about to pop off.If this was my first experience with a Blink product I would be done with them for life.  As it is I am starting to have doubts about their other products.I was looking forward to this product because I could add a video doorbell to the existing Blink system I have.  I am not paying for both Blink and Ring services.  However, this product is just too clunky and cheap too really be a worthwhile add on.  I wish you had made it as seamless and as sturdy as the other products in the lineup.I know this is supposed to be the more affordable alternative to Ring, but that is not a reason to excuse shoddy/lazy design.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2021

Review Text: Love the camera and it's features! Easy to add To my Blink system. The only problem is it is totally useless. It is impossible to mount this to the bracket. Review Text: I have used the blink cameras for security and enjoy the added peace of mind for security.  I was excited to find that the blink doorbell was affordable and had HD, could be hard-wired.  The drawback is unlike the blink cameras you need to subscribe to Amazon's service to cloud storage for the doorbell.  If you don't you need to have USB storage on the hub. Review Text: Edited.. Update :With the addition of the sync module and reset of the doorbell. This is now working great. Worth the money but definitely purchase the sync module as well.This doorbell is a piece of crap! Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2022

Review Title: Wanted to like it, ended up returning it
Review Text: I really tried to like this device, after all it was pretty budget friendly and my expectations weren't too high given the price point. So I was patient with the fact that trying to get to live view via the notification of motion detection rarely worked and never was fast enough to actually seewhat was happening at that moment. I also was patient with the motion detection which was rarely consistent, sometime picking up motion that wasn't there or not detecting motion that was very blatantly apparent. The last straw that broke my patience was when the unit suddenly went offline. I spent about an hour trying to troubleshoot the issue; deleting the doorbell, trying in vain to get it reconnected. After trying to get support, I stumbled upon the information that there was a service disruption. It would have been nice to know prior to me spending all this time trying to troubleshoot something that was out of my control.So I sent an email, because apparently live support isn't something that's available or if it is it's buried somewhere in their support pages. 24 hours turnaround of no information and getting no support seems a bit counter to having a device which is supposed to help with security and monitoring. So that was it for me.No matter how budget friendly, it's just not worth having a product that does such a terrible job at what it's supposed to do and also has terrible customer support for all of the many issues you're sure to run into. So bye Blink, I'm returning you and canceling my subscription (which you need if you want to capture recordings, which you will because you'll never be able to see what's happening live).
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2022

Review Text: Product arrived broken.  Was a pre-oder so quite disappointed.  Online tech help has no idea what the product is.  Back door not attached on arrival.  Inserted batteries and door will not snap in place.  Customer service asked me if I used the right size batteries.  THEY CAME WITH THE DOORBELL!  Took batteries out and door still will not snap on place.  I have numerous Blink cameras but will not get to see how or if this product works.  Sadly disappointed but I will just get a Ring camera instead.

Review Title: Camera works great software and Alexa integration OK
Review Text: I have owned Blink cameras since their inception. I have been impressed with their durability and their ability to upgrade their firmware and innovate as wireless WIFI cameras have come of age.. The door bell camera works very well as a motion camera and works well with the smart phone app. But it's function in Alexa has been disappointing. There appears to be no "live view on notification" from the doorbell or from the Blink XT cameras (latest generation camera) or at least I have not been able to figure out how to make it work).  RING doorbell cameras do have this function. It does show a live view when I ask Alexa to show one but by the time it loads Blink and shows the live view the event is over (my WIFI is running 500/500 so it's not a slow WIFI).I do have faith that Blink will keep innovating and upgrading the function of their equipment as in the past. This is a new rollout and some glitches should be expected.

Review Text: I had a ring doorbell that had to be charged every 2 weeks which was annoying and it took like 8 hours to charge. My actual doorbell doesn’t face out to the street so having this little battery powered one is perfect and I know The battery will last for months. The only con is that it took me 15 minutes to get the front of the doorbell to click into the base. It’s very difficult and just takes patience,So I’m not looking forward to when the battery needs to be changed. Other than that it works great. You can’t beat a little extra joke security for the price.

Review Text: It kind of works. If things get better with a Firmware Update, I will update this review.I get constant errors. I attached a few. The camera goes offline a few times a day, but some how comes back. If you keep it Armed it still kind of does it's job and records motion if detected, just doesnt send you a notification. It's not my WiFi going in and out, because my VPN isnt ever affected. Also tried moving the Sync Module on the other side of the wall where the Doorbell is mounted, with no changes.Loading Live View almost never works the first time. You usually have to click it a few times to get it up. Then by then the motion is gone.I havent figured out what motion it will detect and which it wont. Maybe a 3 sensitivity is too low. I have since turned it up, to see if anything changes. I walked the entire view range of the camera and it never set it off. If this doesnt improve it will probably get sent back, because there is no point then.I liked that you could set this up with the On Site Sync Module to store clips. Review Title: This is NOT ready for prime time
Review Text: Our Ring doorbell broke, probably due to multiple power surges from road work outside. It fried the Ring so I thought we'd try this. The ads make it seem like it is just as good....it is NOT. The Alexa "integration" just isn't flawless. Trying to rename it "front door" just hasn't worked despite doing everything in the instructions. The biggest issue is it won't use the power going to the doorbell and we have to use batteries, which means it won't alert us when there is activity outside. Our house is only about 20 years old but apparently the Blink is unable to use this power that any other doorbell can use.Ripping it out and will give to a friend to see if they have better luck.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2021

Review Title: The app is the reason it’s only 3 stars
Review Text: I only have the camera door bell running on batteries and no sync module so I can only use “Event response mode”…the cheapest setup I could get. Event Response Mode means that I can’t watch a livestream without a subscription (which is only 3 bucks a month if you only use 1 camera).  I can only access a livestream if I get a notification that someone is there and I press the notification within 60 seconds. Otherwise I just have to look at the recorded video of the event. I’m completely fine with that…as long as it actually works.However most of the time I am pressing the motion notification right away and I’m just greeted with a spinning wheel trying to load the live feed. When that doesn’t work, I close the app and re-open it,  still under 60 seconds, but I can’t view anything live anymore. So most of the time…the live feed feature is useless. Again, I don’t mind that it’s limited to 60 seconds to access it…but it should work consistently as advertised. I think this is why the blink app also has around a 3 star review. The hardware works just fine…I just wish the app was more consistent. But hey…for 50 bucks it’s still a decent product for a cheapskate like myself who has never owned any surveillance products before. :)
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2022

Review Title: Will not record to your sync module

Review Title: Easy to install and very effective
Review Text: We bought a second home and I already had Pink in my primary residence.  We wanted to be able to monitor things at the houses when away and the doorbell worked at the new house as the door faces the driveway and street.  It took less than ten minutes to remove the old bell, reuse the two wires and install the doorbell.  The Sync2 system was easy to plug in a spare bedroom and connect to the home wifi.  As the back door faces the yard, has a doorbell and possible bad-guy entry point we have ordered a second one for the back as well.  Blink is a reliable system that notifies us, makes a recording and allows for two-way talk from anywhere.  This is a very good system for homeowners.  Recommended.

Review Title: Batteries die quickly and no way to adjust motion detection
Review Text: There is no good way to adjust the motion detection.  It either picks up every single car that drives down my VERY busy street and the people on the sidewalk and the people on my porch OR it only picks up cars driving down my very busy street.  I have changed every single setting and if I adjusted the settings to low sensitivity it picked up the cars but not the fed ex guy standing on my porch dropping off a package but it did pick up his truck driving away.  So I adjust to high sensitivity and I get every car that drives by, person walking, delivery person, and the Sun rising and setting and just generally shining causes it to go off.  It’s cheaper than the ring doorbell but you get what you pay for.  The batteries don’t even last 24 hours.  I had to buy a charger and rechargeable batteries… it maybe lasts 16 hours… I wouldn’t waste my money on this.  Just spend the extra money and buy a ring doorbell

Review Text: I was hesitant to install once I got as it seemed the ring was going to be on my cell phone which I do not keep nearby.  When I paired with Alexa and found she would announce Motion Detected at Door or if Doorbell was pushed, I decided to keep it and install.  Very easy to get Alexa to connect and she announces to all devices in my home so I can be in a back area of my home and still know someone is at the door.Installation was somewhat difficult for me (66-year lady), but not too bad once I found the appropriate tools.  I actually installed on my door as I have double doors and off to the side would not work.Very happy I kept it! Review Title: Great product, but there’s a but
Review Text: This is a great product to keep your blink system all together. I’m glad that Amazon finally came out with the doorbell. The only downside right now is how the doorbell connects to the mount. It’s not very secure. They have a clip that comes with it, which is supposed to unlock and allow the doorbell to slide up and off the mount. Sadly, it doesn’t make a difference whether you have that key or not. Review Title: Camera is ok, doorbell is highly intermittent
Review Text: There are several reviews that probably will already warn you about the bait and switch tactics regarding the blink systems and their subscription programs.  I won't get into all of that on this review but you should definitely look into it if you haven't read that before.  The cameras seem to work okay, although they tend to freeze up whenever you want to actually see anything live. But that's okay it usually sorts itself out in a minute or so.  But that's not okay for a doorbell. So far I've had this for maybe 3 weeks and in that time have watched several people ring the doorbell on camera footage that was captured, where no doorbell chime actually had gone through to my phone.  Additionally if you are on the phone and someone comes to the door you're out of luck.  A better option would be to just install a dedicated camera and then have a separate doorbell.  I've had two package slips left on my door this week because the doorbell didn't ring or because the software didn't notify me in time and by the time I made it downstairs I got the orange slip.  Do not rely on this product.  If you're okay with the subscription and swapping out batteries and having software lag for live view, the cameras themselves are still decent at about a four star, but the doorbell function is a 2, leaving this with 3 stars.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2022

Review Text: The batteries were dead in a week. The motion detection sensitivity setting doesn’t work, nor do activity zones, primarily at night. Every every car that goes by sets it off even on the lowest sensitivity level (see photo).  The live view integration with Alexa works when it wants. There’s a $30 a year cloud subscription cost for 1 doorbell or $10 month for unlimited blink devices without a sync module. But just set it to doorbell press only, any change to settings requires a doorbell press or 24 hours to take effect. That’s probably the worst of it all is that you have to actually go outside and push the doorbell every time you make a change the settings. You get what you pay for, maybe less in this case.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2021

Review Title: Nice addition to the Blink family
Review Text: So far I've been pretty happy with this doorbell.  We had a Ring doorbell and I was always very frustrated with how long it took the doorbell to react to motion.  This Blink doorbell seems to react much faster.  The video quality is great.  I wish the camera had a slightly wider field of view up and down.  Mounting it to where my old doorbell was mounted, it cuts off the heads of (tall) people as they leave my door. I also have several Blink cameras, so being able to consolidate all my camera devices into one app has been nice.  Setup was simple enough.  There were a lot of complaints about getting the back panel to attach to the doorbell, and I can see how that would be an issue, it does not feel terribly sturdy while attaching it, but I was able to get it to attach and it feels study enough now.  I am not going to give a full 5 stars due to limitations in the software related to being able to add other users to my account, I have to share my account and credentials with anyone who I want to have access to the cameras.  In this case it is my wife and older kids, but I can imagine many use cases where this would be an issue and I think it's a simple thing to fix, but Blink refuses to do anything about it.  In reading the reviews, this has been an issue for multiple years now, plenty of time to make it happen.  Functionally, though, this device does what it needs to do so far...I'll update this review if that ever changes.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2021

Review Text: I really like the doorbell,  but there is one thing that I don't like.  The blue led light ring around the button doesn't stay lit up at all times.  I believe it should so people can see where to push in the dark

Review Title: Only picks up motion 20% of the time
Review Text: Pros: easy set up, clear pictureCons; doesn’t record motion without the addition Blink Sync  (even with a paid subscription it’s on power save with out it and only woken when rung). After purchasing extra sync part (same price as the doorbell) and purchasing the subscription plan it still doesn’t pick up people walking in front. Or will start recording as they are walking away after knocking. Randomly the video stops recoding after 10 seconds even after triple checking that settings are set to 30 seconds. Caught on blink Car pulls up man jumps out run to my door blink stops recording when man is 5 feet from my door. No clue what else happened after that. Overall would not recommend

Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2022

Review Text: Comes with really short screws to attach it. I bought the stand alone doorbell (without a sold separately special mount) I tried the screws included and they didn’t securely fasten the doorbell to our house. I found some long galvanized deck screws with a flat top and used those instead. I attached it to our plastic coated metal door frame around our storm door. There was no previous wiring for a doorbell where I fastened it. It is attached great now and isnt going anywhere! I will say snapping the doorbell onto the mounting plate was a little challenging. You had to get the right angle to get it on the plastic hooks on the doorbell. Once slid on you have to pull down on it with a little force. Don’t push straight towards the house, pull down. Other than the screws, this works and functions incredibly. Love that I can add it to my security system with my outdoor and indoor cameras and Alexa as well.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2021

Review Text: The battery life is less than a week once we turned the sensor down so that it barely picks up anyone on the porch itself. If we set it to pick up motion to the porch it only lasts a couple days. We have 2 other Blink cameras to cover the back yard and our cars and the batteries have not run out in 2 months. I don't know if I got a dud or it is the normal use of this product. We are going to have to wire it in order to feel like it is giving us decent coverage. When it is working it is clear and very good, but the battery issue is irritating. We had an instance where someone stole a package off our porch. Guess what? Yes, the battery had died that morning and we had no view of the thief.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2021

Review Text: I have a very happy owner of the Blink Video Camera system.  I wanted to have my doorbell (Ring) replaced with Blink so everything is under one umbrella.  What a mistake!First: Blink does NOT have a wireless door chime.  if you live in a house, or apartment you can NOT year the bell ring ANYWHERE in your residence.  I had to get an electrician to run NEW hard wiring for blink to connect to a door chime.  After all this, the door chime was short and can barley be heard throughout the house.  I tried 2 different other door chimes, expensive ones, they were the same result.The tech support at Blink can not help with any of this.  They can ONLY show you how to use their system but have NO knowledge of getting it to work hardware wise.ADVICE: Get Ring Door bell, not blink.  Its a inferior cheap system that only good for what i have no idea.  Can believe their camera system is so amazing and their doorbell system is so BAD.  ONLY reason i opted to switch to Blink was to save the monthly $3 fee for the recording since i was a link owner from eelier yeas.  Going back to RING and gladly pay the $3 a month for a product that works.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2022

Review Text: I wasn’t sure if this doorbell that I’ve  literally been waiting for years to be available would meet my expectations but, IT DID !  I have the 1st generation blink module and the doorbell works perfectly with it. I’m able to see, hear and speak to visitors without any issues. When the system is disarmed, the doorbell acts like a typical doorbell, press the button, phone/tablet rings, get up and answer the door or see and speak to your visitor through the blink app. When the system is armed however, the doorbell isn’t just a doorbell, it’s also a very good camera that records all the activity around my front door !  Just like the outdoor cameras that record my backyard, the indoor cameras that record my pets during the day, the doorbell camera adds another layer of security for my home.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2021

Review Text: My friend paid $100+ for her ring camera and im glad I decided to check around before getting the one she has.This is a good one!!My husband had some trouble installing it but it but after like 20 minutes, he got it.It’s battery powered.The only thing that sucks is that if you have it on motion detection, it’ll alarm you even when a car is driving by. Which is like 20x’s per hour.But eh, you never know when an accident will happen and someone may need camera proof.The best purchase!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2022

Review Text: The best thing about this is you can set it up so there are no cloud storage charges. Otherwise, reaction time is slow, often times, by the time I'm notified there is (was) someone at the front door, they've left or are headed back to their car. The app is just ok. Biggest fault is there is no way to delete video clips en-mass, instead it's one at a time, swipe, press delete, wait. Swipe, press delete, wait. Repeat that for 15 or 20 clips of wasps, random cars, or people walking their dogs. Yes, you can reduce sensitivity, but them what's the point if there is someone there and you're not notified at all. Summary - better than nothing, but far from what it could be.

Review Title: Affordable doorbell camera, echos can act as chime
Review Text: Adding a doorbell wire and such is always a challenge.  That's why I like that this takes batteries.  A feature that isn't really advertised, you can sync the doorbell into your echo with the "blink smarthome" skill and set it to notify on your echo/fire devices.  The video quality is good and for me, it was an easy install.  I knock down one star because the echo integration isn't perfect (the video doesn't immediately show when it's rung. But, perhaps that's because I have a first gen show)

Review Text: The doorbell was easy to set up using the blink app and easy to install.  I did not have any of the issues other reviewers mentioned. Review Text: This camera has a very wide angle view. Wired installation was straightforward. There's a seperate optional bracket which I did not use. I can hear the chime for the bell everywhere in the house. Also, the daily camera feed looks like time lapse photography when there is no motion in front of the camera. You'll see the sunrise, movement of the sun across your front yard, sunset, and the night. That daily view is breathtaking.I recommend you purchase the control unit so you can store your video on a USB stick and add upto 9 cameras. I'm still in the free trial of Amazon's monitoring program so I don't know how the doorbell works without that service.

Review Title: Poor construction quality, bad battery life
Review Text: Installed the doorbell a little less than two months ago.  Pretty disappointed in that I've already had to change the battery; my settings were not too absurd for a doorbell camera.  Upon doing so, I learned there is a special plastic key to open the bottom, but it's not really needed; the retaining clip just needs to get pushed in (with a normal key) and you can remove the cover.  Beware, though!  You WILL break one of the 6 pegs that holds the ring doorbell securely to its frame.  Now it is unsecure on the cradle it sits within, and I have had it less than two months and this was my first experience changing the battery.  I would not repurchase this product.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2021

Review Title: Love that this can be wireless!
Review Text: First opening for the Blink Doorbell, I am happy that this can be wireless since I live at an apartment complex. The picture with this camera is great, and very clear! It has the ability to be watching for motion outside the door (which of course will drain batteries faster). The app is easy to use, though I can't find an access to view the outside camera live without someone physically at my door. Set-up is super easy, and you definitely can't beat the price compared to a Ring camera. Although, there is a subscription; it doesn't effect the camera functionality, it is mainly for storing the captures of video from the camera itself (like cloud storage). Which I purchased because it was $30 for a year.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2021

Review Title: Just okay. Great for the price however. Installation is definitely tricky on stucco.
Review Text: I do have the same complaint as the others, the back is very flimsy and when you tighten the two screws it bends over the uneven surface making it impossible to place the doorbell and lock it into place. I had to chisel out some stucco to make it as flat as possible for installation while loosening the screws. Also, wiring in the doorbell does nothing but add the original chime in your home. It does not power the unit!!! Which in their verbiage they claim to use battery OR hardwired, which is certainly not the case. Even with all of those issues it's not a bad doorbell for the price! Definitely on par with all the other cameras and features Blink has to offer.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2022

Review Title: Can’t interact with person at door, setting options poor - disappointed
Review Text: The reaction time has a delay from when it starts to what can be seen. It seemed to work well until I connected it to my Alexa account, hoping it would automatically show the door, when motion was detected. THIS DOES NOT HAPPEN.  What the Alexa Show does is announce you have motion. By the time u ask Alexa to “show doorbell” the visitor is gone. This system is honestly useless unless you just want video of motion around your property. Even then it isn’t that great, as the outdoor camera has little response to anything over 14 feet away.  I purchased the doorbell, exterior camera, module 2 and a one year subscription. This system does not serve my purposes.The settings on the doorbell do not record over 30 seconds unless you hit continue (every 30 seconds), then it takes AT LEAST 10 seconds to reset before it will start recording again. This 10 seconds could be the 10 seconds you need if someone is up to no good. You are able to set the cameras to stop recording early if the motion stops, but this does not mean it keeps recording so long as there is motion.  It still will not exceed 30 seconds, without manual intervention. To say I’m disappointed is an understatement considering the outdoor camera was $99.If you just want to record people coming to your door then the price for the doorbell is fine but don’t forget the module.  If you purchase just the doorbell and a subscription, then hook it up directly to your phone, perhaps you will have the speed you need to directly interact. I suggest you do not connect the system to your Alexa account since there does not seem to be a way to disconnect. Just use the blink app and purchase a subscription. The more you add to this system the slower it will get, irregardless of your WiFi/internet speed.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2022

Review Title: Absolute trash. Alexa integration skill utter failure.
Review Text: Arrived and the back battery plate will not click in to place so, no way to actually close the battery compartment nor attach it to the actual wall.Alexa skill is one of the buggies I've EVER seen1 - person at gate can't hear my voice. Volume for speaker is at 10 and not muted2 - sometimes just ignores button press completely3 - video is like 5 seconds behind on my Show4 - a lot of times won't respond to "Alexa stop" and just carries on showing on your screenI don't live in US and no way am I going to pay for courier to return a $50 device.Absolutely trash, which IS EXACTLY where it is right now.

Review Text: I couldn't be happier with this purchase. Camera was very easy to install and works great. Motion detection works perfectly. Very few false positive alerts, almost none. Video quality is excellent and set up was extremely easy. From the time I opened the box until the time the camera was working on the app on my phone, was fewer than 10 minutes. I added an extra camera inside in the garage and setup for that was quick and painless as well. Five minutes at the most.I definitely recommend the Blink system.Can't wait to put some money aside and get a few extra outdoor cameras so I can monitor places that can't be seen from the front door.

Review Title: Can not hear the chime—-MADE RIGHT!!!!
Review Text: UPDATE!!!! After I submitted this review, I was contacted by email from a Blink representative, Haitham. He stated they would like to send me an Alexa unit so I would be able to connect with the doorbells. I received that unit today & set it all up. I am totally amazed, not only that they would be willing & offer to send me such a unit, but that they care so much about pleasing their customers. My Blink doorbell works like a champ now & I couldn’t be happier since I am now able to actually hear when someone rings it!!! NEVER have I ever received such amazing customer service! Bravo Blink!!!Pretty disappointed that there was no information that there was no way to hear the doorbell chime inside the home using wireless connection. I shouldn’t need to carry my phone constantly in case I get company. I have Google home, which the doorbell is not able to connect to. Even then, there’s no information that states I would be able to hear the chime through that either. Unfortunately I will have to return this product.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2021

Review Title: Updated - Could not install on wireless network
Review Text: Initially, I wrote about an issue with the new Blink Doorbell. As you will note, I have changed my review.I was immediately contacted by someone from the Blink Team Support who shared the doorbell should work with my setup. They sent me a new doorbell and sync module. The installation was flawless and it works great! It is what I expected my experience to be after using the Blink system for about 5 years.Thank you Blink Support Team!OLD REVIEWThis device requires a dedicated 2G network. This means you have to create a separate 2G WIFI network if you have a 5G router. Even if your network detects that it is a 2G device and connects it to the network as a 2G device. The doorbell will not work.My existing Blink cameras work fine with the current network. However, I would have to separate the network and move the existing control module and devices to the dedicated 2G network just to use the doorbell.Why would you introduce a new doorbell with this limitation?
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2021

Review Text: Just purchased this and only had it installed for a week. My front door has a covered porch, so not overly concerned or know how this will handle the weather. Had good instructions, easy to understand, and was easy to install and hook up to my existing Blink systerm. Did the wireless install. Purchased a wedge and didn't need it. I would suggest you get it and try it before you purchase any wedges, see what area you can cover without them.  Not sure about the night vision since I have motion activated lights, but the pictures and video are very clear.  I only tried it once without the lights on, and it seemed okay.  The option to respond with voice works well.  I do have this on the cloud, and was able to turn it on when I was away from home.  Don't know that would work if I was only using the thumb drive.  I would buy again.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2021

Review Title: I'm torn as to how i feel. Do Your Research.
Review Text: Electrician/handyman here.Do your research. There may be better out there.I purchased the Blink Doorbell in early Nov 2021.Initial setup and mounting was easy. I didn't have an existing doorbell, so I had to use the batteries. Picture was perfect. Night vision was really good.Problems: In the first week, it stopped working twice. Went "Offline". I had to remove the doorbell with the provided tool, which is a pain, then remove the batteries and then reinstall the batteries to reset it.It worked after doing so each time, but if I was away from home, I would have no security!Now I can't even get the thing to work at all. I removed the batteries, pressed the reset button until the red light was flashing, and even deleted it from my account and then readded it.Finally got it back online a few days later.I'm torn on this product. I had issues with one of the interior cams too. When I was about to give up, it started working again.Note: After the initial recording time, it will not record again for 10 seconds. This cannot be changed in the settings. I wish it could! I think thats why they say the batteries can last up to two years. Well, a lot can happen in those 10 seconds. It's like having a blind spot.I'm glad I still have my first security camera system to cover these times.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2021

Review Title: Barely a step above a Blink Camera
Review Text: I often do not arm my blink camera and was wanting this device to be able to be armed independently of my camera so I wouldn't be forced to watch videos of my wasps all day.  Unfortunately, this integrates into the existing system, but is completely at the mercy of the other systems and thus this is an additional camera on the door.  Yay, I guess?  I would much rather have a separate arming system for the doorbell to allow some more control.  I guess we are all just stupid lemmings and we do what Amazon wills us to now.I am not regretting my loyalty to the Blink system, being grandfathered into the free monitoring group is not worth it.

Review Text: I have both Blink & Ring doorbells.This Blink doorbell sources its power from batteries ONLY regardless whether you installed it wired or wireless! Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2021

Review Text: I was previously using an Arlo wireless. The Arlo worked really well but it was too large and I really didn’t prefer the white. When I saw the Blink and I saw it was black and smaller then the Arlo - I was all in! The Blink was an easy set-up with all of my current Blink cams and Sync modules. The attachment of the doorbell to the mounting base was way more difficult then it needed to be. The doorbell works fantastic, but what is up with the ring? All of the advertising shows the doorbell with a blue ring. The Arlo had a ring that illuminated when motion was detected. I was expecting the same from the Blink. Disappointing. I’m hoping this is resolved with a software update.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2021

Review Title: Works well with my other Blink products.
Review Text: Works well with the other Blink products that I purchased in the last year. I have been waiting for the Blink doorbell product and was pleased when it arrived. The challenge will be in changing batteries when the time comes as the fit to the plate is extremely tight. This replaces a unit that had been installed by a major security firm and has proven to be much more reliable. I have made contact with all the units from off the premises and though this unit starts a bit slower, it still connects well. The speed is likely do more to placement in regard to the wifi than anything else. And it was MUCH less expensive than the vendors unit.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2021

Review Title: No illuminated LED ring, huge bandwidth consumer
Review Text: I purchased  the Blink doorbell with the impression that it would function similarly to other smart doorbells. It does not and in fact is very dumb. Why does the LED ring light not stay lit so it can be found at nighttime by visitors? All of your advertisements show the blue LED ring illuminated (false advertising). It is also consuming huge amounts of bandwidth which must be the sync module2 that Blink insisted that everyone would need. Your Blink products must share the household Wi-Fi and not hog it. We all are doing a lot with our household Wi-Fi from streaming media, TV, Netflix, and music to working from home and attending school online. Why would you release a product that could not share Wi-Fi access without consuming so much bandwidth that nothing else can run alongside it? I would like a refund of my money! What a disastrous experience this has been. Was this tested before rollout? It sure doesn’t seem like it. Do not purchase!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2021

Review Title: Another good idea that really doesn't work
Review Text: Once again, super easy to install, has great night vision but by the time a message is sent to your phone, the person is probably gone. Also, if it is hooked up to your existing doorbell the bell rings with a light touch so that the person doesn't actually initiate the internal doorbell. If you are watching TV, oh, say on Amazon Prime, and you don't have your phone nearby you won't see anything. It is a shame they can't link it to your Amazon account on your laptop or TV. That would prove to be more useful. But, still, the slowness of the process makes it useless as a preventer of crime. Maybe it will be good to identify the person who actually robbed you.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2021

Review Title: I'm not dumb but this makes me think I am..
Review Text: It took me awhile to finally get the doorbell to connect to my existing blink system, after un-installing and re-installing, it finally works with my Alexa. The mount is another story, even after reading all the reviews and watching the videos, it still was not fun to put on, but we did get it. This should have been far easier than it was, nothing but a headache. But it works, the camera has great quality.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2021

Review Title: Was ready to send it back..
Review Text: I got the system and could not get it to work. Tried all night and even called customer support, got put on hold for like 10 minutes and was told to leave a message and someone would call back, but no one ever did. My technical son came over and tried to connect to set up the system and still couldn't get it to work.Found out our wifi extender was creating the problem. Once we unplugged that, set up was very quick and easy. Like 10 minutes everything was set up and working easy.The app is easy to use, and you can set zones so you don't record everything.  With 3 dogs running around outside, I do get a lot of alerts, but I expect that. The talk feature is handy but can be glitchy at times.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2022

Review Title: If you’re trying to decide between this and the ring…
Review Text: Besides battery life which is excellent, it is inferior to my ring doorbell in every way. The camera quality is lacking even with the sync module and being connected to the same network. No matter which settings I alter, the app will not detect motion and alert me, I only get alerted for button presses. The mounting system from the doorbell to the mount is not strong and a burglar would be able to disable this camera quickly and easily. The night vision sensor is weak by default, does not reach the distances of the ring doorbell. So far not happy with these products. I had better results with other Chinese brand cameras and ring.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2022

Review Text: This has got to be the worst design for a mounting plate in the history of mounting plates!  The pictures and graphics included with the package, and the animation embedded in the app for setup lead one to believe they merely need to “place the top of the doorbell at a slight angle and flush with the top of the mounting plate, so the mounting hooks align, then gently push down until it clicks”.  This may be correct.  HOWEVER, the tolerances are so tight that  you have to align everything with excruciating exactness.  It took innumerable tries and I wasn’t successful until about TWENTY MINUTES into my effort!!! When I need to change the batteries, I will likely throw the whole damned thing away, rather than deal with that nonsense again.Now, as for the rest of the unit, I like it.  Works well.  Good picture.  Easily integrates with my Blink system.  User friendly setup instructions.  Were it not for the aforementioned turd of a mounting plate, 5 stars.  I hope the engineers will come up with a better design before my batteries die.  Looking forward to the Gen2 doorbell if they do.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2021

Review Text: I have 3 blink cameras and now the doorbell. The doorbell is fantastic. Set up in 5 minutes. Used my old sync module. I didn't find any mounting problem... Read.. but most of all understand... the directions before writing negative reviews. I needed to lessen sensitivity in settings to 3 and used the advanced settings in my zones to block out what I wanted but not too much. GREAT economical doorbell.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2021

Review Title: Great doorbell for the price! Wish angle mount came with the unit.
Review Text: I had already had a skybell at my door and was able to easily replace in a total of about 15 minutes.Took about 30s to set up my existing Blink app with the device.  Replaced the door angle  mount with the Blink mount. Truly wish this was provided with the units, cost me a little extra.  Hardwired my doorbell wires to the blink bell.  And it does take some effort to ensure you mount the bell on the mount properly - recommend looking at the configuration the back of the bell before simply attempting to slide (as it wont stay on).  I would have gave it 5 stars if the mounting went smoothly.  Was operational in under 20 min.  Dont see any reason to spend the money on RING or other expensive units, esp if you are already a BLINK user.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2021

Review Text: Compared to Ring, it just feels cheap. The mount is extremely frustrating and the wired terminals are flush with the mount, posing the possibility of a short if your door trim is aluminum. The video is decent, really good color. Overall, not the same quality as the other Blink cameras. I returned mine and put the 5 year old original Ring doorbell back on.Update: Blink sent me a replacement camera to re-evaluate. At this price point, it does it's job well, it is much cheaper than the Ring. I do like the video quality better than my original Ring. The Ring is more expensive but the device itself feels more solid. I also like the time lapse recording in the Ring app, Blink lacks this BUT, I pay $30/yr for the Ring video storage. One huge plus is having the doorbell as well as security cameras all in one app. I do still feel that the mount isn't very user friendly, you must slide it down onto the little post, then snap it in. It comes with a key that slides in to release it from the mount... I suspect this key will be lost immediately...
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2021

Review Text: The doorbell cameras are a nice addition to this lineup of smart cameras. Installation is pretty simple if you know how to use a drill and a screwdriver. They can be installed with or without connecting to a homes doorbell wiring; but the battery-operating-only mode does not facilitate live-viewing and being able to take quick snapshots to use for thumbnail images. The wired installation mode works just as well as the indoor cameras with addition of being able to integrate with compatible Alexa units to trigger custom “doorbell” sounds and alert you as to which doorbell is being rung. It can be wired directly to your existing door bell chime and trigger it with steps listed in the setup app for mechanical and digital chime boxes.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2021

Review Title: Be careful if you have a street nearby - updated 1 star
Review Text: 11/18 Update - Blink reached out to me and I will try to setup again and adjust it better to not pick up all the cars.Original ReviewThe street from my door is 42 feet away.Everything mounted great (to me the bracket was fine) Once turned on I got notifications for every car going by. I adjusted the motion area in the app to remove the street. Notifications continued. I used Advanced settings and adjusted further and notifications stopped in the daylight, but night with car lights they started again. I adjusted more to stop the car notifications and I thought I was set.The next day I had 3 deliveries and no notification. When I went out to get my packages I got the notification. Ugh.So I thought I would mount the angle bracket to tilt the camera a bit inwards. I mounted the bracket and when screwing the camera base to the bracket the screw head broke off rendering the bracket useless as a screw is now stuck in one of only 2 mounting holes. I was done.I really wanted this to work as everything else on my house is Blink, but this has to go back.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2021

Review Text: If mounting on brick you may need a shim to make the back plate sit flat.The seal is tight and you need a good flat surface but if you have that it is super easy to mount.Flexible tuning for existing doorbells, device allows adjustments to voltage and time needed to trigger doorbell and auto detects voltage and current for operation. Also can work wirelessly on batteries alone.Alexa integration is super easy with motion and bell alerts with selection of chimes to announce.If you have blink devices already this is a great addition. If you don’t this is a economical alternative to other choices.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2021

Review Text: The doorbell is pretty good overall. With some tweaking, motion detection works well. They need to add an additional chime unit (other than Alexa). Alexa integration needs to be spelled out better. I had to do some digging for information on something that turned out being fairly easy. Documentation could be revisited to clarify thing.I’d suggest this to a friend but definitely let them know the lessons learned from my experiences.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2021

Review Text: I was surprised at how easy this was to install and add to my existing blink system.  After struggling to install and keep running another brand of motion detection doorbell, I anticipated having the same trouble with this Blink.  But Blink was easy.  No need to add a dongle to the wiring inside.  Just scan the code on the back of the new button, using my Ipad, follow the instructions, and wire it up outside  The blink installation app tested the system, and had a fix for what might have gone wrong.  Picture is clear, wide angle, and the doorbell works as intended.  A note:  allow the app to set things up.  This takes longer than one might think.  Let it do its job.  I was getting antsy and about to start over, when all of a sudden, the app took control and everything worked.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2021

Review Text: I'm not very tech savy, but if you follow the directions , it dosen't take a Rocket Scientist to install this thing.  I recommend using some good 2-way tape from a hardware store if you are renting or leasing a resident.  My Blink works great.  Very good color photos, motion detection is great, and its user friendly.  You can adjust the sensitivity and controls from the app.  You need to spend time customizing it according to your taste and security.  I love that its wireless also so you don't have to worry about connecting to the doorbell but get some good long-lasting batteries.  The best part of this review, I paid $35 at Amazon for this device compared to almost $100 for my 1st device.  This device will connect to Alexa which is also awesome.  This is a steal, and you will thank me later.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2022

Review Title: Love my new blink doorbell and it looks great on my vinyl siding.
Review Text: Night vision is outstanding for the price. Other complained it was hard to install onto the backing. I didn’t have any issues installing it but it maybe because I bought a hard plastic vinyl siding mount for it from doorbellmounts.com so that gave me a good solid surface to push against to lock it in place. I think it looks and works fantastic. I gave tech support 5 stars because I called them to ask a question and they were very helpful.

Review Text: I order this for my mom she's a senor citizen, and I had issues since day 1 , Unfortunately this is not for everyone the picture froze, not sending me the pictures on time too long for me to get the picture to see who it was ,, to much trouble and waist of time.
