Review Text: Setup was easy (Ring is easier because of the lack of a sync drive), getting the thing installed was much more difficult than the Ring Doorbell setup. Engineering design could be better. The camera also does not appear to have the same HQ capacity as Ring Camera in daylight or nighttime.The subscription is also more expensive than Ring. Blink Cameras are much cheaper than Ring. I prefer the Blink app however.I suggest going to Ring Cameras versus Blink for setup and installation ease. Ring cameras may cost more upfront and for replacement, but the subscription is less costly and Ring has better quality cameras.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2022

Review Text: I've been refusing to buy a video doorbell because (1) I already have a Blink outdoor camera pointing at my front door (and a good old doorbell), (2) the video doorbells I've considered in the past cost too much for what I'm willing to pay, and (3) I didn't want to bother with complicated installations.When this became available on sale ($35), I jumped at the opportunity.  Installation was as easy as drilling two holes, screwing two screws, and placing the doorbell onto the frame.  I didn't have the installation challenges others have posted about (you should go read those).  I already have a Blink system in place so adding this to that was straightforward, plus I don't have to pay extra for video recordings.Picture quality is great for what this item is intended.Motion sensitivity is at least a good 15-20 yards.  Cars passing by on the neighborhood street triggered the motion sensor and notifications to my phone, so I turned the motion sensor off which should also help with battery life (and I still have my front door Blink camera to capture video when motion triggers it).The best part of this for me is the Alexa doorbell routine, which includes different chimes, from the basics to the seasonal ones.  Someone presses the doorbell, Sleigh Bells chime plays, and Alexa tells me someone is at the front door.  Also, I didn't experience a delay between the doorbell press and the Alexa routine notification (I recently upgraded to a WiFi 6 system, so I'm sure that helped).
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2021

Review Text: For the price vs features this is a no brainier, The integration into Alexa is most welcome. I bought 2 replacing what I had. Separate chimes and notification of which door is activated is just what the wife wanted.  Little slower to respond to movement compared to the outdoor cameras but they are fine for what we need. The only disappointment in the Blink line so far is the lack of live view in Alexa. I am told it is because Blink has its own live view. Curious that the Doorbells work in Alexa but not theXT2 outdoor cameras. Would have thought the live view protocol would be the same for both cameras and doorbells.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2022

Review Text: I have other Blink products that work pretty good, but the doorbell camera would not work at all.Sync module worked and camera linked up but would not taken a picture or acknowledge that the button was pushed. I had a Ring doorbell before and it wasn't very good so I took it out and thought this would be a good replacement, not so. I deleted it from the app and reinstalled it and it still would not work, and support line was backed up so I was not the only one having trouble with them lol. If you are looking for a good video doorbell, keep looking cause this is not the one. This one is going back to Amazon
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2021

Review Title: Two way audio is nice, but frustrating unlocking design and wired connection needs to be simplified.
Review Text: I liked being able to talk to someone at my door from my phone.However, I followed the directions for wired connection but it would not ring my inside chime. I measured the voltage and it was within the 16-24Vac range. I was still able to ring my inside chime using my original switch connected to the blink electrical contacts.I was happy with how quickly I could contact and connect with tech support even at 10pm on a Saturday night. They suggested that I 1) try taking the batteries out, 2) try removing the sync module from the app and remove the doorbell as well and then add them again.The more I thought about this the more I didn't like how complicated this is to ring my door bell inside. I don't want my inside chime depending on software, batteries, or wifi. If someone rings the door bell, I want the doorbell to ring inside no matter what (as long as there is power to the home). Simple as that.The biggest frustration I had was with the removal tool design. It took several minutes for me to use the tool to pop the blink doorbell off the wired mount. After that it was just as difficult to reattach it since the plastic part that is supposed to provide the locking mechanism was pushed all the way in and needed to be bent out again.Much room for improvement. It's doubtful they will have a future design that simplifies the internal chime ringing, but if they do I may consider trying this again. As it is, I'm planning to return mine.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2021

Review Text: Works great overall. However, if you already have a Blink system, you have to put it on an existing system in the app, ie patio or door. If you don't and put it on a new System in the App, it won't work in full capacity, and features will be missing. There will be a warning on the thumbnail. Night vision is good, it looks better than the Outdoor Cam. Hopefully there will be future updates that fix this issue. I have it mounted on a https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B099F7P2XX/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o03_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1,on my apartment door. I cut out the sponge on the bottom so the mic isn't muted.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2021

Review Title: Can't beat it for the price.
Review Text: I replaced my ring doorbell camera with this. The main reason was because of ring wanting 30 dollars per year to save the videos. I've been using Blink cameras for awhile now. So I don't have to pay to save the videos like ring. Setup up is easy. Just scan a qr code thru the app. Installing it was fairly easy too. Just 2 wires from my doorbell and 2 screws. It does take a few tries to get it lock on. But once it on it's not going anywhere. My only complaint is if I get a notification of motion and I click on it, it sends me to a live view. The other cameras send me to the video it took. But other than that it's well worth the money.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2022

Review Title: A decent video doorbell for a fair price.
Review Text: This doorbell was very easy to install and easy to download the Blink software on the APP Store on my iPhone XR.  I had to fabricate a block to lift the doorbell off of the brickmold (which surrounds the door) so that width-wise, the doorbell would clear my narrow one inch space between the siding J-channel and my storm/screen door frame flange.  That may not be a problem on most homes with wider trim boards around the door, but on mine it is.Another thing that needed patience to solve was poking around on your Blink software to get it to ring on my phone plus my hardwired in-house existing doorbell.  The software is nice and offers many options, but for a old-school guy like me, well...it took a few minutes.  The install was easy and went quickly overall.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2021

Review Text: What a complete piece of garbage.  It will tell you "detected motion" or "someone is at the doorbell" but then says "system busy" for up to FIVE MINUTES after.  So there's no live view, no way to see wtf is at the door or talk with them.  If I'm not at home and it gives me a motion detection can you imagine having to wait MINUTES to see the video?  Whatever/whoever it is is GONE by then.  It's even wired to my doorbell power so it's supposed to be 'faster' in waking and retrieval.  Again, total garbage, I don't know if Ring or other brands do better but I'll never buy anything BLINK again as long as I live.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2022

Review Text: Bought this because someone was stealing packages in the building I was living in. When I notified building manager I was getting it she told me I couldn’t because it violated people’s privacy. I was a bit bummed but when I received it and set it up I found out it have a privacy setting. That may not be the right thing to call it but it only allows me when set up to see my doorway based on where I have it mounted. When she found out I had installed it she came to talk to me and I already had it set up so I just turned on my phone and showed her that I can only see my door. She said cool and let me keep it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2022

Review Title: doorbell cannot be installed - cannot be screwed onto corner mount
Review Text: The holes for the screws in the corner mount to fix the doorbell to the corner plate are not threaded and the screws just spin in the holes. All 3 units I bought on Black Friday have the same problems. Good thing  I checked before I gifted them to the parents and in-laws at Christmas.Amazon gives you a special security key to remove the doorbell to replace batteries...but a screwdriver works even better, and every doorbell thief carries one in his pocket. And if the doorbell thief forgot his screwdriver, all he has to do is grab the doorbell and twist. The few hooks, each a millimeter or two wide will snap right off.Consider these doorbells un-mountable gifts for the Amazon package thieves.Video and sound work well with Echo Show 5, nothing but hiss, crackle and feedback on Blink app on Android.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2021

Review Text: First off this is not as clear as my normal outdoor blink cameras. It is useless at night. I see only dark.  It is very slow to load the live video to talk to someone and it lags when talking. No ability to adjust the camera unless you spend even more to get the wedge pieces sold separately.  The only good thing about it is it works with my Alexa to tell me motion or button has set it off. The old cameras don’t communicate to my Alexa devices like that.  For the price it’s a cute little add on but I was planning to move my outdoor camera at my front door elsewhere but it’s just not good enough to use as a stand alone camera for safety.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2022

Review Text: (12/11/21 edit)  customer service reached out to me and offered to help me with my camera. After a few emails they determined the camera was defective and sent me a replacement. They were extremely helpful and nice.  I was very happy with my experience and won't hesitate to reach out to them if I ever have another issue.  My new camera seems to be working properly now. 👍🏼I like this until it started not working. I had it one day, and the next day I tried to use live view and it wouldn't open the camera. It was off line for about 5 hours.  Then today 12/2/21, I had to leave town.  I didn't work for 4 hours. It didn't pick up motion when someone took packages that we're delivered.  I'm so disappointed with this doorbell and I feel like I wasted my money. I wish I could return it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2021

Review Text: I'm a 170lb, 6' man and I cannot exert enough force on this thing to get it to clip into the mounting plate. I'm practically hanging my entire body on it, and that's not an exaggeration. How did this make it past testing?!?
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2021

Review Text: I installed these in December 2021. I put one on my front door and one on my back door. The one on my front door, I have had to change the batteries twice already(It is February 2022-its been less than 3 months). You have to have a subscription to be able to view the videos/images after the fact, which isn't a huge deal. The app is super slow so it's almost impossible to answer the door from you phone or say anything because it takes minutes to load. It hooks up to the Alexa but you cannot use the alexa show to view the video when someone is at the door, which in my opinion it should do automatically or should at least be a setting. Also, the doorbells are named by their serial number and no matter what avenue you take to rename them, when the doorbell is rung, it will ring the chosen style on the alexa, but it will then say "There is someone at the VM215358132DS1535" which is SUPER annoying. Overall, not super impressed but for the most part, gets the job done.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2022

Review Title: Works good for the most part
Review Text: The doorbell camera works good as a doorbell.  I wired it into my existing doorbell.  There is only two problems with the motion detection.  The Zones for motion detection do not work very good.  It continues to detect movement outside of the zones you pick.  The second problem is if  you want to have the motion detection on the doorbell camera enabled all the time, you can't schedule motion detection on any of the other cameras you have on your system. It would be much for functional if the software was updated so you could schedule motion detection on each camera independent of any other camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2021

Review Text: So we have 2 of these and they are easy to get installed and running. But I have a couple of issues. 1. They cannot be powered by your current doorbell wiring despite the implications that you can run it with or without the batteries. It CANNOT be powered by the transformer. 2. Not being powered by the transformer means you have NO lighted button on the doorbell. It is completely dark at night so that’s an issue. Lighted doorbells are not new tech. Good luck with guests finding or using your doorbell at night. Super stupid this has not been incorporated into this item. Very good picture but the lack of a lighted button is very disappointing.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2022

Review Title: It wasn’t as hard as others state to install
Review Text: I purchased the doorbell less hub as I already have to blink outdoor cameras and one indoor camera.Setup was a breeze. I installed the base to the existing doorbell wiring to a mechanical doorbell. Installed the batteries, went to the blink app and followed the instructions and within 5 min I had a completely functional doorbell. To top this off it’s far cheaper to purchase the doorbell as a stand alone unit if you already have cameras set up.It’s been nearly two weeks now and I get alerts, it’s never had an issue and works great!I highly recommend this doorbell.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2021

Review Text: I really wanted to like this video doorbell. I was looking for something to provide security for the front of my house with good motion detection and picture. However, after several weeks of use, it does not meet my expectations.Pros:-great price-the video quality is pretty clear-notifications come pretty quickly after a triggering event, when it actually worksCons:-the app is not very good. When there's a triggering event, it takes you to live view, rather than showing the recording it just made. You then have to manually go to that recording.-as many reviews have stated, this is not the easiest to install. The first problem I encountered was that it did not seem to have all the necessary installation equipment. I wanted to mount it with the included wedge, but the screws provided did not seem to be the correct size. First, the long screws that are supposed to go into the wall were not the correct size as they only partially went in. Further, the smaller screws (which are supposed to help with installing the back plate to the wedge) would not tighten. Ultimately, I could not install the wedge and just went with the back plate, using some spare screws that I already had. Not a good start. When it came to installing the doorbell to the back plate it was a struggle to get it on. You have to press down very hard until it is properly secure. Given the flimsy plastic, I can see this breaking. Luckily, though, that didn't happen to me.-the motion detection is horrible.  This feature was hit or miss, at best, and is a deal breaker. It would often pick up activity outside the designated activity zone (like cars going by) and completely miss activity within the designated zone. For example, on one day, it missed each of the following triggering activities: two package deliveries, me walking up my walkway, walking up my front stairs, me standing in front of the door for several seconds to unlock it (mind you, this is directly in front of the video doorbell), me entering the house, me walking away from the house, and my neighbor coming up my stairs to ring my doorbell.  I adjusted the sensitivity level, but nothing helped. Frankly, the motion detection on this device is complete garbage.If you only want to see who is actually ringing your doorbell, then purchase this doorbell. However, if you want to use any other feature, buy something else. I am going to return this item and go with something else. Very disappointed in this product.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2022

Review Text: I ordered this to add security to my home. I have tried everything I can think of aside from using super glue to get the back to stay on this so I can mount it, nothing works. I have tried to attach to my vinyl siding and it will not, which is what I'm thinking is the problem with the back. I ordered this one because it was supposed to be an easy installation, it def is not. If someone with an engineering degree can't get this to work, what are us average, everyday people supposed to do? I will be ordering RING from now on. Very disappointed.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2022

Review Text: Never had one of the $200 doorbells and jumped at a $50 alternative.  It does what it is supposed to but doesnt excel in any one area.  Standard picture quality is average but when best quality is chosen, it loses connectivity.  The mounting system is a little flimsy.  Took half an hour to connect it to the back plate.  I can see those little tabs breaking off and then you are done.  For $50, all those issues go away.  I get a door bell that does everything you would want, looks good and has a great degree of flexibility.  The fact that it uses my existing Blink cameras  iPhone software is a plus.  Would buy again.  Found out that putting a little grease on the tabs allowed them to slide and lock a little easier.  Other than the mount, its a solid, good looking product.  Can't imagine what more a $200 doorbell could offer.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2021

Review Title: It's a great little camera that picks up everything, the problem is it picks up everything.
Review Text: There are some features that I really really like about this camera, such as physical battery operation so I don't have to wait several hours for it to charge and that I can use it with my other blink outdoor cameras/subscription plan. The major problem is you can't set zones on this camera so it picks up every car driving down the street. Previously I had a ring doorbell cam where you could have zone settings for motion, as well as it would detect a person versus a movement of a vehicle. I feel like now I'm constantly jumping to every single sound of my phone just to watch a car drive down the road.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2021

Review Text: I purchased this over others due to it saying it can store clips locally without a subscription. Everything was fine until the free cloud saves expired and then it would no longer save clips locally to my USB. It had been doing so fine until the subscription ran out and then magically, my network was having "issues". I'm an IT professional and following their testing to the hilt and proved it was not a local issue. They just have very poorly implemented software.Their support team responses are geared to "it's you not us" from the outset.If you're looking for this device purely on the ability to save locally, prepare to be disappointed.

Review Text: Horrible product..the camera will not mount to the back. I spent half the day trying to mount the camera finally gave up and decided to return this for something eles

Review Text: This is about my 5th try at using a video doorbell.  Blink is the only one that has worked reasonably well so far.  There is still an annoying lag, even with a top end router, but that must be the norm.  Communication is good and it rings the chime as well as my phone.  Resolution is average, probably wouldn't stand up in a murder investigation or trial, but I recognize my mail lady and my wife who steps onto the front porch 15 times daily.  Can't complain after so many other failed doorbell cams.  I think it works with Alexa, but she and the Blink are still 1 or 2 notches above my pay grade.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2021

Review Text: I ordered the Blink doorbell on sale. For some reason delivery was significantly delayed and when it finally arrived the trouble started. The doorbell worked fine, but wouldn't click on the backplate. After hours on the phone with I don't know how many people of customer service they agreed it was a hardware issue and I was sent a new backplate. This one was of far better quality than the first flimsy one (sale item??) BUT it doesn't fit the doorbell. The plate is too small and too thick. And it doesn't click on, not that that would have made a difference because there are gaps on the top and the bottom.So after weeks of issues I am sending it back, holes in my siding, and still no doorbell.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2022

Review Title: Great Product, Excited to have it in the blink group
Review Text: Easy install, especially compared to Ring, the slim design is nice that I could share a previous screw hole and only had to make a 1 new one.  Instructions were pretty clear until I got the doorbell sound part. I didn't know a test/finalization was the next step and tried to manually test but the software wasn't active yet to trigger the chimes.  As a result, I took it all apart of tried again...then found the next step test/finalization.The night vision is just ok, I have a light to help but it's just like the cameras and the lone weak spot.Otherwise, I'm satisfied and happy.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2021

Review Text: Likes - Clear picture and audio.  Sensor works well and the image is very clear.  Schedules can be set up with On/Off times as well as blocking out certain areas of the view you don't want to catch movement.  I noticed very little delay in communication both in video and audio.Dislikes - Doesn't run independent from the other cameras.  They are either all on or off.  To avoid this, I would suggest purchasing an additional Sync Module.  Screws sent with the mount aren't made for wood.  The threads are too small and the screw heads stripped immediately even after drilling into the wood.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2021

Review Text: After one month, the Blink sync module quit connecting. Removing/reinstalling, rebooting router, etc, etc. did nothing. Replacement worked fine and still working 3 months later... BUT now the doorbell quit working.  Removing/reinstalling, rebooting, etc. etc. no luck. I do see it fine in the router, and the unit setup worked again fine. Thus on both cases, I'm suspecting not HW issue, but problem at Blink cloud, since even BASIC (free) accounts appear to require it.  And unfortunately, it appears their cloud is opaque. No web access and iOS/Android app just sends you to create a ticket.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2021

Review Title: Support is Terrible until contacted by Alex Weiss
Review Text: 3/1/2022 I'm changing my below review to a 5 star. After I wrote the review below Alex Weiss from customer support contacted me and sent a new doorbell unit. It connected up with no trouble and is working as it should. Doorbell unit is working great with the rest of my Blink camera's Thanks again Alex. (Original review) I purchased a Blink doorbell unit to add to my Blink outdoor camera set of 5. Could not get doorbell unit to connect. After not being able to connect I checked the batteries that came with it and they were dead. OK no big deal it happens, so I replace the batteries and still have to play with it awhile to connect. Finally connect for like a day then not working again. Checked if batteries were good again and finally got it connected for a short time then off again. Contacted support for replacement and they had me turn on an access button on the Blink APP so they could see the unit, which I wasn't really comfortable about. Next day they what me to download another APP to run a signal scan and give them the info.  I'm not comfortable giving all this internet access out. I told them I have one of the Blink outdoor cameras 3 feet away from the doorbell camera and it works fine so signal in the area is good. I don't think I would buy this again due to all the hassle to get a defective unit replaced.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2022

Review Text: The blink door bell is ok, the only other type of video doorbell I have to compare it to is the ring doorbell.It doesn't give you a live preview for motion detections from your notification bar on your phone the way the ring doorbell does. With blink you have to open the app to view the video from the notification.The other big draw back is there's a decent delay of a few seconds from when the motion is detected to when you get the notification on your phone. With my ring doorbell there's almost no delay.Over all, not a bad alternative for the price. If you don't mind spending a little more then I'd suggest looking at other options.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2021

Review Title: Best Door bell i have used.
Review Text: What i like about it! It works as advertised. I have used and tested the ring pro wired door bell. Its was junk compared with Blink door bell. It never worked even though I rewire it changed the transformer. Ring door bell sent me another update one it was the same.  Blink door bell is the best one i have installed and texted. Works like it should. What i don't like about it is that you dont get an installation booket. On how to installed the wires or connect them. Also you may need a diode installed. In my case i need the diode installed my bell is a digital bell. Blink door bell works great for me.

Review Title: Only good those with existing wired chimes or Alexa
Review Text: I already own Blink cameras and thought this would be a great addition. The problem is that if you don't have an existing wired chime, the only way to know someone is at the door is through the app. Well what if you're not near your phone? Furthermore, I wanted to simply pair it with my Google Home Mini (or another device)  to play the chime but it doesn't integrate with anything else for that function. The only device it seems to allow that option with is an Alexa-enabled device. If none of these things would be an issue for you, go for it. If you're in my situation, don't bother.

Review Title: Mounting system. Can't be that hard?
Review Text: Product got delayed for weeks and finally arrived. Cool. Reading reviews, specifically on the mounting. I say " these stupid people... Can't be that hard and that dumb to have a hard time with mounting. geez..."  soooo... practiced a couple times unmounted to the wall, make sure u feel the slide and discreet click, before mounting it in my uneven wall. Now screwed, replacing old doorbell, went wired connection. First slide, broke 4 out of 6 hooks! Well what the Flying Nut F@$×%ks?!!? Is this??? Deep breath.. Returned same day. Will most likely buy it again next time. Wait for a better 3rd party mount. I have a 5 piece outdoor blink w echo setup. Have em less than 3 months. So far so good so this doorbell is probably same quality as other.

Review Title: Doesn’t Sync with Module. Customer Service is Awful.

I understand that some people aren’t tech savvy, and they may feel the need to take baby steps, but I’ve literally told them every step I’ve taken, which not only includes what they suggested (which I tried before contacting them), but every solution that every forum and every manual and every comment on every website I could find recommend. Review Text: Update..  will not keep attached to WiFi. I tried all the troubleshooting tips and nothing. Bought they sync module 2 and nothing. Review Title: Don’t want to pay a subscription fee for lower quality video and audio.
Review Text: I think the title says it all I don’t want to pay for a subscription service that’s more than my Ring doorbell. The ring doorbell is 25 a year vs 36 dollars and the Blink offers poor video and audio with an annoying noise in the background. I have 2 blink cameras with no subscription needed. Silly me for making a mistake thinking this would also work the same. Returning. Also it was a pain to install but I managed. Even if it were free I might have still returned it because of the annoying background noise that is not present on The Ring Doorbell. Review Text: The doorbell is just OK. Night vision is poor to average. Responsiveness to situations is poor to average. The aspect ratio is poor to average. Integration with the existing doorbell is fantastic. The price is great. It is a basic doorbell that works most of the time. The blink system itself (cameras etc.) is poor to average overall. Every day there is a problem of some sort. Customer support? I am not sure. They have never answered any of my questions. They are available 24/7 but no one answers the phone and the emails go somewhere in cyberspace. Would I purchase Blink again? NO
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2021

Review Title: Maybe I am doing something wrong
Review Text: I bought this in a "bundle" with the Echo Show 2 (I believe) and thought it would be awesome to be able to see who is at the door. Honestly, I was just excited to have a doorbell again since we rent and the doorbell has been broken the whole time we have been here AND we live on the 2nd floor.  Maybe I am doing something wrong, but I can't get the Echo Show to do anything other than tell me when motion is detected or tell me someone is at the door.  No matter what I say, Alexa says the blink camera doesn't support it.  Very misleading because the video I watched said you could answer the door from the Echo show using the blink doorbell camera.I would say, it works very well as a doorbell but not much more than a $14 electronic doorbell and chime set you can find here.  The camera is good quality but useless if you can't see who is at the door until after the clip has been recorded and you get a notification.  Also, any time I actually *has* let us do a live feed (on the phone app only), if I go to use the voice function and talk to the person at the door, it says camera has stopped and I lose the feed entirely.  Overall, I'm happy we have a doorbell again but disappointed that the features that sold me on the device don't actually work.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2022

Review Title: Would be great if it were consistent.
Review Text: The Good:Camera quality is good, I like the button and overall look of the product. Smaller than other doorbell cameras. Audio is clear. Works as a part of the rest of my Blink system and I already had a Sync Module so no need for a subscription plan. I like the customization options of the camera, the active and inactive areas, sensitivity, privacy areas, etc. If the camera worked as expected, it would receive 5 stars.The Bad:Constant connectivity issues. No matter how close the sync module and internet router are, it still spends way more time offline and unusable than it does online. I don’t understand this because I have Blink minis throughout my house, and never have  these issues. My doorbell camera spends about 15% off the time connected and working properly, and about 85% off the time offline and useless. May as well be a fancy doorbell button.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2021

Review Title: Its pretty good, but make sure to get the angle backing sold seperately
Review Text: I ordered it and installed it right where my normal door bell was and you cannot see the person walking up to your front door. So make sure to order the 15/30/45 angle set that sets up behind it to give it that angle so you can see who is actually walking up to your door. This makes it so its not just a surprise that DING DONG then you ask to see the camera and who it is which is delayed 5 seconds, lol. Blink is a little slow, but the best bang for your buck. I just ordered the angle adjusters 15/30/45 and you can stack 1-3 to angle it where exactly you want it placed at to view.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2022

Review Title: Buyer Beware if you're a grandfathered customer
Review Text: I've been a long time Blink user but couldn't be more disappointed with this purchase. When I added it to my account, it said that I needed to purchase a Blink Subscription despite having already being grandfathered into an old free plan.When I contacted Blink Support, they were very rude. I sent them the proof that they asked for showing that my account was created prior to the date when they changed the plan.Even though I sent them the proof, they acted like I was lying and continued to be rude and refused to let me speak with a supervisor.I've been a Blink advocate for a many years. Review Title: Setup wireless doesn't work with Alexa show - updated
Review Text: Amazon proactively reached out to me to resolve this issue. Apparently if you want to use echo show with your doorbell with a wireless setup, you need to purchase the sync module.  After getting that installed, the system works perfectly.  Hope this helps others with a similar setup!*** old review***  Been looking for a wireless (no existing wires by location) doorbell that would enable two way video communication via echo show.  Unfortunately Amazon doesn't tell you that this video doorbell does not have this capability to wirelessly work with echo show.  Called here help desk and after 45 minutes the agent finally told me that I would need to hire an electrician and run wires to make this work.  So had to send the unit back.  Hope this helps someone else.

Review Title: Good investment but needs some improvement

Review Title: Great product once you get it mounted!
Review Text: The first doorbell I received was not working. The replacement came quickly. The set up was easy, connection easy. The only problem I encountered was putting the doorbell onto the backplate after the backplate was attached to the door. Instructions said to lift push and it should pop on.....Nope! I had to push and push. Tried for about 20 minutes.  The bell slid off the backplate and I gouged my finger. There was a big hole in my finger and lots of blood. After cleaning and bandaging my finger I tried again and it went right on.....go figure. Perhaps I was pushing too hard and overdoing it. I don't know but I still don't know how to get it on easily and I am dreading trying to remove and replace it when I have to change the batteries. The doorbell camera has a wide range of view. Great pictures, great microphone. All things considered,, I wish I had gotten it sooner.!

Review Title: Stopped working after return window deadline (little over a month)

Very unfortunate considering supposed to be in Amazon products yet you have to still go through the Blink manufacturer to attempt to get a replacement. All in all very frustrating experience

Review Text: Glitchy. Worse of all is it requires a subscription to view recordings…. What’s the point of having the cameras if they don’t record?Doesn’t record on motion 3/4 of the time , I have readjusted and checked settings still hot or miss. Review Text: As a long time Blink customer I received an early offer for a Blink Video Doorbell.  It arrived last week on Halloween and I was able to configure it, as with all Blink products, in minutes since the app guided me through the set up.  I removed my old doorbell and wired it to my Blink doorbell and now I get notified by the original doorbell as well as my Echo devices and my phone.  It does not record every person that walks up to my door, as does Ring, but I simply wanted to use it to augment our rather quiet mechanical door chime that we could not always hear and it works fine for that.

Review Text: Below is my original review.  A Blink customer service rep reached out to me and we were able to address the problem.  I needed a Sync 2 module for it to function properly.  I have since installed the Sync 2 and now I can see who is at my door when the doorbell rings and I can talk to them.Original review—I purchased Blink in December and now whenever the doorbell is pushed, I can’t speak to the person at the door. I keep calling and leaving messages but no reply.  The only online help is FAQ which isn’t helpful if the standard answer doesn’t fit your specific situation.  Maybe if I purchased the video camera Blink system it would function but I would not recommend buying doorbell only

Review Text: Just received my blink doorbell today. Before purchasing I took sometime to read the reviews and what caught my attention was the poor reviews on how difficult it was to install the cover. I showed my husband and he basically said “they must not have a clue” need less to say he was right. He opened the box and went right for the cover. Review Text: The Blink Door Bell works well, except when integrated with Alexa. When I asked Alexa to "show me the back door," it takes around 20 seconds to display the video. Review Title: Nice if you pay for cloud subscription

Also after receiving any notification it takes several minutes to view live video.UPDATE: I've read where many people are experiencing the same local storage video recording issues after trial period has ended. Review Text: So after many failed attempts to link with Amazon I'm making a review. The app leaves much to be desired it's total trash. I have tried linking my account via laptop etc doesn't work.Motion activation may work... But with the exception of 1-2x it hasn't notified me if people are by the door. The doorbell function does work as intended, however I bought this to link with Amazon and alexa so it can notify me via my echo show /studio /dot devices around the house also.Next we have the subject of the subscription fee. It's per device, which means if you have the 5 cameras and the doorbell your paying a lot per month. Why the hell is it not an account based system that you set up an account pay 20$ a month and you can have unlimited devices? These things don't work without wifi so if the power goes out they are useless as a security system.My suggestion for people is buy a standalone camera setup with recorder. You can even set most up for remote login via your phone, several are internet connected and can notify you if there's motion. Sure some are more expensive but don't think for a minute this is cheap vs those. What those cost up front this will rack up in the long term with subscription fees. While you can use it without a subscription you use many of the features.

Review Text: The setup was pretty easy, similar to Blink cameras. Works fine with a couple issues. First off it doesn't come with a remote plug-in ringer, it only works with the app.  I was told but support that it will be available in the future. Review Text: Works great, but there is a sort of fish eye. Also a slight, noticeable delay from notification and when speaking to person at door. Review Title: Just another camera, not really a doorbell
Review Text: Pros:Easy to instal. Cheaper than other brands. Good day image. Does not need wire (but can be wired) Nice aesthetic. Sensitive trigger.Cons:Sound is too low for a non-wired connection. Night imaging is poor. I do not get a “ring” notification on my phone, so it gets mixed with my other three cameras. Swivel needs to be purchased separately. Review Text: I've had a Ring for the last year and now just 'upgraded' to the new Blink since I already had 4 other Blink cameras at my house.  The Ring video always failed and the battery did not last long but was rechargeable.  I wasn't impressed.  I don't know yet how long the Blink Doorbell batteries will last but I can tell you the quality, video, and everything is a perfect comparison to the Ring.  Because it's now a part of my Blink system, it's more convenient having all my security videos in one spot.Getting the doorbell to 'ring' through my echo devices has been difficult and still doesn't work so if someone rings the doorbell it only just gives me an alert on my phone and doesn't "ring" through my house.  I'm working on trying to fix that but be aware its a challenge.  The alexa app has yet to 'see' the doorbell.Also mounting it was awkward as the back plate is pretty small and doesn't "click" in easily especially if the surface isn't insanely flat.  I had to use the tiniest shims to get the thing to 'lock' in and even then it feels like it could fall off my front wall at any point.  A simple thick gasket on the back of the plate would have remedied this easily.  I can only imagine if you're trying to secure this to brick or other facia. Hence the 1 star off.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2021

Review Text: OK this seemed like a good purchase at face value, but we didn't know we pretty much needed the subscription plan on order to use the features or to decrease time of video initiation (Shorten the time between video activation when someone trips the motion sensor). The subscription plan is pretty cheap, but I could have gone with another brand if i would have been able to have access to that information to be able to make an informed decision based on finances.  When installing the doorbell the backing plate went on fine but the little hooks broke off when putting the actual doorbell on. If you have issues with internet it disconnects and you have no access without physically being there to reset the internet connection via your smart device. Overall I have not been happy with the product and have been thinking about just throwing it away since during the free trial period it worked for about 1 week. Most of that blame though falls on me because who finds out there doorbell doesn't work when they are home, and remembers to reconnect every time their internet fails? Which the internet is not the doorbells fault, just hard to keep up with when there are other continuous issues.  After installing the doorbell I didn't install the 3 cameras I got to go with it because of the issues.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2022

Review Title: Good value for price; easy to install
Review Text: Took about 15 minutes to install, replacing an existing doorbell with a mechanical chime.  I did use my own, longer wood screws to replace the measly ones provided in the package.  Drove 2 into the angled wall mount, then connected the 2 wires to the doorbell's back plate and screwed that to the mount.  Setup is through the app and took about 5 minutes.  What wasn't clear initially was the need for the batteries, regardless if you choose to wire it to your existing doorbell or not.  But keeping the batteries in is required :-)  It connected to my existing Blink system so no additional setup steps.  Halloween will be the big test as I anticipate lots of trick-or-treaters and will report back!  (The one feature I wish this had was the ability to silence the built-in electronic chime on the unit itself; it seems a little loud and probably unnecessary, as the mechanical chime in my house goes off when the doorbell is pushed and is plenty loud.)  Otherwise 5 starts all the way - can't beat $49 compared to the $175 ring.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2021

Review Title: Not Easy to Install & Missing Explanation of Wired Benefit
Review Text: I've worked high-tech all my life, Apple, HP, etc., but found this installation perplexing.  Blink should hire new staff, start over, and write new instructions.  I inadvertently drained my batteries during installation. Could have been avoided.  And no explanation is given how the "wired" connection integrates with the power/batteries. GOOGLE "do I need batteries" and you will get a mish-mash of unclear responses. Does wired prolong the battery life?  Who know???  Like most, I found the latching mechanism very difficult to use.  Needs a new design.  But it works.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2021

Review Text: Delivery was 2 days earlier!Easy installation, camera quality is the same as the other blink system cameras (which is great for us), camera came in perfect condition.There is so many bad reviews and I’m not sure why?? We had NO ISSUES. We followed the directions on the blink app to install.Our ring gave us so many problems and the quality of the picture when it rained was so blurry. The blink gave us a perfect picture quality. We couldn’t get our ring to match in the hard wire doorbell and the blink the hard wire was super easy!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2021

Review Text: As many others have said, actually mounting this to the back plate is nearly impossible. In my case I broke one of the clips on the back plate while trying to put enough force on it to snap it into place. Support sent me a new back plate and while it didn't break I also wasn't able to get the device to mount to the back plate. I figure I'll leave it as-is if/until someone steals it.For the price the device itself is pretty damn good. Video quality is really nice and motion detection is adequate. All things considered I'd go with something else though.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2021

Review Title: Love the doorbell as much as the cameras
Review Text: We've had blinks cameras for a few years now.  We've also had a Ring and a Wyze doorbell.  Installing/adding the blink doorbells to our current sync module was straightforward.  As usual, the flexibility in the app is great, quality of video is good.Only things I would change:  1) include a wedge by default, I cannot imagine too many cases where you wouldn't want one,  2) suggest the drill bit size to use for mounting the backplate, my initial guess was too small,  3) putting the doorbell onto the backplate seems to be touchy.  You clearly don't want it to come off too easily, but getting it to latch/hook into the small plastic piece on the bottom took some effort with both of our doorbells.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2021

Review Title: Not What it is Cracked Up to Be!!
Review Text: I build my own computers and set up my office's networks.  i followed directions precisely and nothing.  All the LED codes show perfect , but nothing.  After having this mess on my hands for several months,I hired an alarm tech to set up just the doorbell. After almost two hours, he was able to get it to work.  It stopped after 9 hours.  I spent several hours with  Blink "Help" he was very sweet, but did not know whet to do.It is almost impossible to mount without breaking it!Save yourself time and aggravation, buy something else!

Review Text: ProsA cheap alternative to Ring. I purchased the first wave of Blink cameras a few years ago so I don't have the subscription fees most people are complaining about its waved for me. I enjoy the easy accessibility of viewing my house while I'm at work on my phone. Cameras are pretty vivid and of good quality picture for the most part. They capture motion pretty well and allow you to set the zones you wish to record. The doorbell will notify you when someone rings the bell and it can be linked with an existing Echo Dot which is a nice feature.ConsThe cameras lack in real time live view. It's a few seconds delay in what you see and some times the video quality gets choppy. I have 400mbps internet through my ISP, I shouldn't be having a delay in connectivity. Also the back plate for these cameras are trash. Whoever designed this camera was a dick. Last but not least the 2 way talk doesn't work at all, it's certainly a defect.I can only give these cameras a 3/5 because they lack in certain areas.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2022

Review Text: When my Ring doorbell died recently (interestingly, my neighbor's did as well...), I started evaluating the options. I saw no better value for the money, and since I had several Blink cameras on my RV, I was completely comfortable with the functionality of the Blink system and app. Easy and trouble-free installation and I like having the video doorbell activity announced on my echo devices. Good job (once again) Amazon! The ONLY thing was I had a dickens of a time finding the special removal key that was taped to the back of one of the carton inserts!

Review Title: It works, but i miss my ring doorbell

Review Title: Integrates well with existing Blink system
Review Text: This video doorbell integrates well with the existing Blink system. Motion alerts work well and notifications from existing echo devices work well. What doesn't work well is the live view feature. Live view works maybe 8 out of 10 attempts. Sync module is placed not more that 20 feet away. This is indicative of all cameras in the Blink system, not only the doorbell. The video recording works well and it is very clear, just not the live feature. If the live view can be resolved, this will be a top notch system. Otherwise, it's makes the functionality just mediocre.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2021

Review Title: Narrow and not very well for mounting
Review Text: I was excited to see the Blink doorbell release as now I can have one eco system.  I was going to replace the Ring 2 doorbell with the new Blink doorbell.  First problem, this doorbell is so narrow, so I have to create two new holes on my siding and the screw holes for the Ring 2 doorbell won’t be covered.  It’s no one’s fault, but I was quite sad about it. I searched to see if they have a plate to cover the old holes. No luck. Secondly, it was unbelievable hard to mount.  I tried and eventually gave up.  I could mount Ring 1 and Ring 2 door bells without any problems. But, this Blink doorbell was not eat at all.  If I think about it, snapping on the Blink camera to the mount was pretty difficult also.  Maybe Blink should do a normal human mounting test.  Anyway, I think I wait a little to see if anyone can come up with the solution to the mounting problem.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2021

Review Title: For the price, this is the best doorbell you can buy
Review Text: is the image quality amazing? No. Is the IR super powerful? Also, no. So why do I still recommend it? This doorbell is doing a much better job at recognizing movement and notifying me as soon as someone rings the doorbell than the battery-powered Ring doorbell did. The camera resolution is good enough, same with the IR performance. Is it as good as the newer wired Ring or Nest doorbells? No, but you are also paying a fraction of the price for a pretty similar product. I've owned both Nest and Ring doorbells, their top-of-the-line products will outperform the Blink doorbell and have some cool features like face and delivery recognition. If you don't care about those things, save yourself the money, get the Blink.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2021

Review Text: I have been waiting for these to come out, and they finally did. I got two of them for my front and carport door. Super easy to install, just remember you're going to have to push extremely hard to get them to latch in. I have these hardwired in, so I don't have to worry about the battery going bad. There is only about a one and a half to two second delay from the time you push the doorbell till my phone rings. Very happy that it integrates with my current doorbell, and gives me just a little bit more peace of mind when I'm not home but my family is.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2021

Review Text: I got this for my house because we couldn’t hear when people would knock on the door. Now we know when someone is coming up to the door if they knock or not. We connected out door bell to Alexa and she makes an announcement in every room if there is movement a the door or if someone rings the doorbell. I did have to turn off the announcements for a while when we had work done on the house, because the guy was going in and out so much. The cool thing is that I could still have Alexa notify me when the doorbell rang, I just shut off the motion notifications. I love my doorbell so much I got one for my daughter, and she was so glad to have it because she could see when her friend came by to feed her cat while she was on vacation.

After a week or so the batteries were drained even with external power on.External power is misleading.... I was told the camera still uses the batteries. Review Text: Can confirm what many other reviewers have said. Camera was not worth the trouble in my case. I was hoping to use it to provide a better angle on  my front door to monitor package delivery.I already have a functioning Blink system and am familiar with the set up process. I spent (~3-4) hours trying to get this doorbell connected to my system, but ultimately failed. On multiple occasions it said that I was successful, but the doorbell would never actually show up in my camera list. More frequently it would simply stop blinking red and give me an error saying the camera could not be found.I did the power cycling of the router, the phone, the sync module, the camera, etc. I deleted and reinstalled the app. I deleted and reinstalled the entire Blink camera system. None of the proposed fixes worked. I noticed the provided batteries were expired and tried some that had been working for other cameras. I purchased new Li batteries and tried those. No luck.I then decided to see if it was worth my time to continue mucking about and tried to physically connect the camera to the baseplate. Even on a sacrificial wood plank, I couldn't get the camera to "click" into the base. Very glad I didn't drill any holes in my wall yet. There are plenty of people that are happy with the doorbell, but I think I received a lemon.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2022

Review Title: Works really well, tiny concern no motion activated LED on/off feature
Review Text: Product quality is decent, picture quality is equally good..night vision works as good as day vision. Prompt notifications. The live view takes a while to show up when the notification are send about the motion detected on the doorbell. Mounting the doorbell takes a little more effort as the two pieces of the doorbell need some extra effort to be put in place..it seemed like a damaged piece to me when i first tried to fix the doorbell but after spending a little more time with it i figured it just required a little more effort to fix it properly..its a plus for this doorbell as no1 can possibly remove the doorbell without a good fight or unless u have the removing tool that comes with the doorbell in hand..Motion detection works pretty well.The only concern i faced with the doorbell is that the motion-activated LED on/off feature is not available. The LED blinks only when the doorbell is pressed otherwise it won’t blink as in other doorbells. I confirmed from the blink customer care that this feature has been removed to increase battery life of the doorbell..This is a small concern and may not bother..it can be avoided completely for such a budget friendly doorbell..overall a good purchase!!!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2021

Review Text: This is our first try at a doorbell. It picks up any motion so we get a lot of alerts, which is ok, we would rather have it more sensitive then not. Picture quality is good but it only tapes 30 seconds, which isn’t long enough, and we don’t know how to make it tape longer. It also has a background noise whenever we use the live feature for the in door cameras … I gave it four stars because it was so easy for us to get it up and running you are worried about doing that download the app and everything seems to just connect together. But, I do not know how well all of this will work when our trial period runs out. Hopefully we can still use it some people have said they couldn’t! I will try to let y’all know!

Review Title: Good start, but needs to mature a bit
Review Text: On the whole, the new Blink Doorbell is a nice entry level video doorbell. It integrates nicely into your existing system, but does require a Sync Module 2, which comes with the standard package. The video quality is good, and it can integrate with your existing hard-wired doorbell, as long as it meets the voltage requirements.As an early adopter, I understand that some expected feature may not be there yet. One of the big ones that is missing is the Auto LiveView for Alexa Show devices. On other doorbells, when the button is pressed, the video will automatically display on selected show devices. That option is NOT there on this device, and I'm not sure if it's on the list of future enhancements. Granted, this device is very inexpensive compared to the Ring doorbells, and that might be one feature they won't put here to try and get you to upgrade. Because of this lacking feature, I will probably be returning it and going a different direction.If you don't need Auto LiveView on your Show devices, then I would say go ahead and give it a try.**UPDATE**On a positive note, Blink did reach out to and are working with me on my issues, so it appears their customer support is above average. Thanks you.On a less positive note, I did discover another small shortcoming. As of this writing, none of the Blink cameras, including the Blink Doorbell, are accessible from Alexa Routines. Yes, you can view the camera on a Show device, and you can have it announce when the doorbell is pressed on Echo devices, but you can not schedule the arming or disarming of the motion detection services through an Alexa routine. Again, I suspect this is in the works, but, like AutoLive View, is not yet available.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2021

Review Text: This doorbell is awesome! And the price is even sweeter.. I got it up and running in about 15 min, just synced it up with my module and hard wired it to the 2 wires from my old doorbell and snapped it in place and was up and running! The picture quality is very clear and it catches everything clearly and accurately.. I don't know why other people are struggling to hook this simple thing up lol, But it was a breeze, and I love the fact that I can control it in the same app right along with my outdoor camera's!  Top Notch in my book!

Review Text: Rivals it's competition in quality at a fraction of the cost without any subscription fees! What more can you ask for? Not only can I do this,  but I can also use Alexa to talk through the doorbell if someone unwanted came to the door.  The night vision kind of sucks,  but what night vision doesn't? Review Text: After reading a number of reviews, I made the plunge and bought the Doorbell cam and Sync Module II.Installation of the camera was pretty straight forward.  Used the template and drilled the two holes to mount the bracket, no problems.The only real problems is the set-up procedures.  Read the instructions thoroughly.  You have to get both the camera and the sync module set-up and recognized by the Blink App.  After that you have to link the Blink account with your Alexa App.  Go to skills in the Alexa app and search for the Blink Skill.  You should then be able to link up.  I can see the doorbell cam from any of my Echo show devices.  I like it.

Review Title: good for price, no visible light during evening hours

Review Text: Does what it’s supposed to. Good quality. Love that you can talk and hear. Can be sensitive in sunlight so you have to learn how to use these Blink cameras. When it’s dark, turn up sensitivity. When the sun is shining on the cameras, turn them down.Other than that, the only issue is that you cannot continuously record with the Blink app. I know it’s because these are battery operated, but that feature should be allowed. If the batteries die fast, then they die fast. It should be up to the owners if they want to keep buying batteries.Continuous recording and playback, would give you the ability to go back and see something you were not looking for. Let’s say you noticed something missing from your yard, or a neighbor had an issue and wants to see your footage as X time. You could do so. Right now, you don’t have that option if it wasn’t motion captured.

Review Title: Awesome Camera with a couple of flaws
Review Text: Blink’s new doorbell camera is a great option for homeowners who are looking for an inexpensive high quality product.  I have an original Blink sync module along with 10 blink wireless cameras providing surveillance for my home.  The 1080 HP resolution for video and still pics from my cameras are really good and the new door bell camera does not disappoint.  I actually had a RING doorbell camera that I replaced with the Blink due to the video quality of the RING being sub par.  Same 1080 HP resolution as the Blink but the first 3-5 seconds of the RING would always be distorted and hard to make out what you’re looking at.  No issue with the new Blink doorbell camera the quality of video and picture are excellent.  It’s easy to install the camera comes with a template and the hardware you need.  It’s powered by two AA Energizer Lithium batteries which can last a long time in non high traffic areas.  This leads me to the draw backs of what I thought Blink could improve on if they do come out with a second generation like they did with the XT2.First draw back  is that Blink states that the new  doorbell cam can operate wireless or wired which is true and that the wired option only allows for it to be connected to your homes door bell which is also true.  You will still need the 2 AA lithium batteries to provide power.  Hopefully they come out with a second generation and if they do they should make it so that it has its own onboard lithium battery and that wired means wired for power and to allow connection to your home’s doorbell.  Also the light around the button does not stay on at all times probably due to the fact that it would drain the batteries real quick.  That light is a major deterrent for the thieves when they see it they know that it’s saying yup we got a doorbell camera and a bunch of other cameras too which in most cases keep the thieves away.  That would be the only two things I would like to see improved on if they do indeed make a second generation.  As for me I’ll be returning my new Blink doorbell camera due to the two reasons I stated above it’s back to the RING for me, just for now.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2021

Review Text: I decided to add the doorbell to my existing blink system to try and free up a front door camera. I was very excited when the doorbell version became available. Review Title: Battery dies too fast and be aware that its NOT continuous recording and require Sync Module
Review Text: Set up and all is simple enough if you follow the steps. I have a problem with the night vision capability(very poor) where you would not be able to clearly identify faces 15 feet away during night. Also please be aware that the blink system(doorbell or outdoor cams) do not allow 24/7 continous recording.  The recording feature is motion activated or event-activated(doorbell or you personally checking the doorbell).To attain full capabilities of the doorbell, you're actually recommended to have a sync module, otherwise anytime you want to fix a setting, you have to wait 24 hours or until the door bell is pressed.The nice thing is that if you understand what you're buying, it does the trick as a doorbell and synced up to my echo dot after connecting through the Alexa skills.

Review Title: It works fine. A fairly good picture. Not the clearest picture, but easily recognizable.

Review Text: This video doorbell is easy to install and add to my Blink app. Once mounted, the app handled the addition to my Blink system with ease. Easier to install and setup than others I have installed. However, the motion detection feature only works when the system it is assigned to is armed. If disarmed, pushing the doorbell will initiate a notification and subsequent recording. Therefore, if a delivery driver drops off a box at the front door you will not get a notification if disarmed unless the doorbell is pushed.

Review Title: Does it's basic job but not much else.
Review Text: The doorbell was easy to install - the app provided clear instructions. Video is clear. However, there is room for improvement.1. The doorbell itself has a chime. This is a useless feature since it is physically located outside and would not be readily heard from the inside of a house.2. Integration into Alexa was easy, but features that I would expect are not available such as automatically turning on the video to see who pressed the doorbell.3. I hardwired the doorbell - easy job. But it takes 2 or more pushes to engage my existing indoor chime. This is a problem since visitors will not know that and think that nobody is home. I've reset everything and started from the top, but the problem remains.4. Battery is still needed for the doorbell to work even after hardwired to a power source. This defeats the purpose of the hardwire.Had I known these problems, I would have considered other doorbell brands that are also compatible wtih Alexa. The only advantage is the ability to save video (when activated by motion detection) and see who rang the bell.

Review Title: Great product, if you're not buying it for security.
Review Text: The blink line in general are good products with some of the better video I've seen and good motion detection. I've also used the two way communication very effectively with our UPS driver a few times. I would definitely recommend them. HOWEVER, there is one big flaw in my opinion that now has us looking at new cameras and is the reason for the low overall rating; it's the mobile app. While the app has many excellent features, it has a flaw that was not evident until after having the system for a while and they do not appear to be interested in fixing it. The notification alert and volume are NOT customizable at all. This means that any alert from a camera in the middle of the night sounds like any other alert be it email, text, etc. What this means is that over time, you will begin to ignore them if you even hear them at all at night. Maybe this wouldn't matter to you, but I and my spouse want to know when a camera is activated at the time it's activated, not the next day several hours later. A good example is my pager alert. My profession requires occasional 24/7 support for multiple facilities and the pager application on my phone alerts me in the tone and volume I choose and will override silent mode - It wakes me up no matter what. Blink does not.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2021

Review Title: Great value, but can’t compete with Ring.
Review Text: I have used Ring video doorbells for years.  I recently moved, and in my search for new doorbells, I found these.  At roughly half the price of a battery-powered Ring, these seemed like a no-brainer.The doorbells work well. They do everything they are supposed to do. They ring, they capture video, and they have 2 way communication.The biggest failure is the lack of a “People only” feature. The doorbell cannot discriminate between cars and people the way Ring does. This can (sort of) be remedied with activity zones, but it is far from a real solution.Be aware that arming/disarming the system is all-or nothing. You can choose to get a motion alert every time a bird flies by or no alerts whatsoever.As others have stated, the wall mount is atrocious, but at less than $50, sacrifices must be made. I am certain that I will be replacing these in the near future, not because of functionality, but because the doorbell may detach if the doorbell is pressed too hard in the wrong direction.The necessity of a sync module makes this an acceptable addition if you already use blink cameras, but kind of a pain if you don’t.All in all, I don’t regret buying these. I just won’t be buying them again.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2021

Review Title: I haven’t decided if I’m returning it or not.
Review Text: It’s a great idea and nice design, except for the part where it doesn’t ring inside the house at all. There’s no chime available to install In your house if you don’t already have one. You would have to have a chime hardwired for it to connect.The doorbell rings from the button unit… outside the house. So the person ringing hears it chime, but you don’t. You have to have your phones notifications on to get notified. Or you have to set up a routine on an Alexa to make it notify you that it’s ringing.I still might return this because I really need the doorbell to make a sound inside. I feel like this one wasn’t thought out thoroughly.

Review Text: When I picked the Blink Video Doorbell I read a lot of the reviews both good and bad. From the beginning I have been extremely disappointed with it's performance. While the camera quality is quite good (when it decides to record) the motion sensitivity is extremely lacking. My son-in-law brings 2 of my granddaughters 4 days a week which it never picks up. They walk up to the door, unlock the storm and then the door and enter. Nothing has ever been recorded. I go out the door to check my mail and come back in and I am never picked up. When the door bell is rung there is a delay with it alerting my phone, sometimes as long as 10 minutes, sometimes it never alerts my phone at all. When the door bell is rung it does not begin recording until the people have entered my door if I was expecting them and left the door unlocked. I have never been able to talk to the person at the door if it did by chance ring through to my phone quickly. I have had the doorbell connected for the trial period with repeated emails telling me the trial is about to expire. Why on earth would I want to subscribe for "only $3 a month if it never records anything? I am truly sorry I wasted the money on the  Blink Video Doorbell | Two-way audio, HD video, motion and chime app alerts.

Review Title: The Blink doorbell is good, but not great.
Review Text: I ordered the Blink video doorbell along with the outdoor camera. I have been using both for almost a week now.The biggest downside to this system is that you don't receive notifications right away, nor does it instantly start recording. I have noticed for both the doorbell AND outdoor camera that it takes up to 5 seconds before recording takes place or for a notification to be sent to your phone. While this isn't a huge issue, those 5 seconds could be crucial in the event of an home invasion or somebody walking up to your porch to steal your packages. For example, I could be walking up to the door to unlock it, but it isn't until the key is actually in the door that the camera will send a notification and starts recording. So, it lags behind a bit.The video quality during the day is good - a little blurry but still possible to make out faces. I have not had to use the night vision much, but you can still capture a face if a person is close enough to the camera. The audio quality is good - I have not noticed any static.Setting the system up was pretty easy. I did have to play around with the sensitivity, as there were multiple false detections made by the camera. The sensitivity comes set at 5, which is sensitive enough to detect leaves in the distance or somebody 15-20 feet away walking past your home. I turned it down in an attempt to save battery life.Overall, it adds a layer of protection to your home and it is a good doorbell camera for the price, but a drawback may be because of how long it takes to receive a notification when motion is detected.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2022

Review Title: Will not reconnect the base with the main unit!
Review Text: This doorbell seems to work fine except the final connection to the base on the wall.I would like to meet the person or persons responsible for the reconnection design of the base to the button unit.I have spent over two hours trying to connect the two with no luck at all.When you look at the two pieces there is no way these two sections will join and make a click noise.Security boles with embeded nuts in the base would be a better design. Would not buy this item until improvement.Returning immediately!

Contacting support was the ticket, which resolved my issue.Blink support was tremendous in my case. The support rep (Haitham) was very knowledgeable, personable and professional. I’m also going to sign up for the subscription plan, subscription plan offers more features for the Blink security products.One small issue.  When the doorbell is pressed, a notification is sent to your iPhone, the problem is, the notification volume is low. Even if your iPhone volume is set to the loudest setting.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2021

Review Text: I don't normally write reviews but others should be warned about this brand. I have a Blink doorbell, interior camera, sync 2 module and 2 exterior cameras. At first, during the free trial period, performance was OK, but not great. The interior camera might or might not trigger on video. One of the exterior cameras never worked correctly even though I moved the Sync 2 module closer to it and it showed good signal strength. There is a feature when you are subscribed where the camera takes a picture once per hour and creates a daily clip show of those images. However, there are no time stamps on the images so it's very difficult to determine what time of day is being shown. I contacted Blink support regarding this feature and did not get a satisfactory answer on whether they would accept this as a feature request or not.After the end of the trial subscription, the cameras started acting very intermittent. At this point, I can't get live view to operate on ANY of the cameras. The doorbell cam is the only one that will sometimes store motion detected video.The battery life is supposed to be 2 years on the external cameras. However, I've had to change the batteries after 4 months. The doorbell camera is supposed to be able to take power from the 22vac doorbell circuit but that has never worked correctly. It also doesn't trigger the doorbell when the button is pressed. The batteries in the doorbell camera have been replaced twice in 4 months now.All in all, the performance of this entire line of cameras is not satisfactory and I do not recommend these products.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2022

Review Title: Good door bell, but need to improve the back plate!
Review Text: Door bell working great and will get more options (e.g. like the wireless cam) when installed with the Syn 2! ... but Back plate needs to mount on a near "perfect" FLAT surface, or it is impossible to slide the doorbell on the back plate, because the back plate is somewhat flexible.  Since people will install this doorbell on the uneven surface, e.g. brick wall, etc...  To improve this product, they might need to make the BACK Plate thicker and stronger; so people can mount it on the uneven surface without problem, and make the doorbell outside cover a little deeper to cover the thicker back plate for security!!!

Review Title: Video quality superb, but usability very lacking
Review Text: The setup process and actual quality of the video and motion detection is top notch.Viewing the video is another story. The camera does not allow for event recording and live viewing to occur at the same time. This means when you receive a notification that someone is at your door, or motion has been detected in general, you can’t immediately switch to live view to see who is there. This would be fine if the app took it into account, but it doesn’t. It hangs indefinitely trying to connect. Then, when you back up and try again, the system is “busy”. By the time you actually can view live, it’s almost guaranteed that the person at the door is either gone or pressing the doorbell again, which restarts the cycle.Suffice to say, I won’t be recommending these in the future. I was disappointed to see that even though it can be hardwired, it still requires and runs off of batteries, and live viewing being essentially useless is the final straw.

Review Title: If you’re looking for surveillance, look elsewhere
Review Text: Purchased my blink camera set 1 year ago and it does not function as it should. Motion detection is poor, the system and app lags, and customer service is unhelpful. They constantly run you around in circles with changing sensitivity and repositioning. None of their suggestions work and they keep finding new excuses for the problem while avoiding calling it what it is… trash. Review Text: ATTENTION!this doorbell are ment for cloud service for profit! Review Title: Not useful if you live on a main road...
Review Text: I live on a main road and blocked out the areas on the camera where the street is so it would not go off every 3 seconds.  I did this under advanced setting with the help of Blink customer service.  After this did not work, even putting the entire camera under the privacy zone didn't work, they sent a replacement.  The replacement has the same exact issue, so I assume this is a flaw in the technology.  Maybe if you live on a less busy street and want it to go off for any/all motion this would be a good camera for you.  But otherwise the customer service reps had me running around in circles re-booting my modems and changing setting on my phone, when in reality the motion detection on this camera is sub-par.

Review Text: If you choose to use the local drive instead of a plan you will be disappointed! I ordered 3 outdoor cameras, doorbell, and sync module.
