Review Text: They need to take the person who designed the box this came in, ( probably the most incredible box I have ever seen on a relatively inexpensive product) and have them work on the back cover plate for this doorbell, getting it on is a total joke if your going the battery route ( not hard wired) this is going to be an issue as it gets older having to take it off to replace batteries. I got it on but it just doesn't click on nicely. The good news is, its working and I really only bought it to have it ring my phone when button pressed and it does that well so far. Review Text: I'm a long-time user of Blink Security Cameras so when I needed a doorbell, I decided to give the Blink Doorbell a try.  I've not been disappointed.  The Blink Doorbell is well made with a rubber or silicone gasket seal on the battery cover.  The doorbell comes with mounting hardware, and it is so easy to install.  I use it in wireless mode, but you can choose to connect it to existing doorbell wiring. I'm very pleased with both the day and night modes.  It's just so simple to install and use.

Review Text: I LOVE my other blink camera so I was excited when they released the doorbell version. It is very poorly designed. I am very pleased with this purchase!

Review Text: I have been hesitant to purchase cameras that were Cloud based and pulled the trigger with the release of the module 2.  I ordered the Doorbell with module and memory.  The packaging was very well put together and felt like quality.  Everything was well placed and the material felt good to the touch, first impression was really good.  The device itself was really good and very responsive.  I enjoyed the simple instructions and step by step the programing made everything run seamless.  The QR codes was brilliant and connected everything really well without problems.  One really good thing that I did not see in other positives about the product is the easy connection to the home's doorbell.  Super easy, not to bash on other brand, but my neighbor's installation of the RING was a nightmare and they had to get and fish new wire to have the house doorbell work with their device, which is why I was so hesitant to purchase a doorbell cam.  This was so easyThe bad: I was a little confused  as to what the "system" was when installing the app and it meant it was your ecosystem, nothing major.  I was a little disappointed with the mounting hardware, it was a little thin and screws that attach it to wall were a little small.  Also the lid lock is a little puny and feels like it going to come undone.  lastly, I had to play with the settings until I realized the settings needed to be adjusted to have the doorbell work with the doorbell cam.

Review Text: I have the Blink Doorbell and a wired mechanical house doorbell. All integrates together and works! One exception is that the Blink system causes the house door bell to randomly ring. All voltages are in the Blink requirements. I gave this a 3 because the tech support told me to stick the problem in my ear and go hire an expert in electronic door bell systems. I been working with electronics for many years and a more reasonable answer would be to install a filter or resister. So be aware you are on your on for any real help.

Review Text: I admit, one day after installing my Chime doorbell and I'm hooked. Review Text: I have to say I was very skeptical about buying these Blink cameras with sync module. Cameras that say they need 2.4 ghz wifi only have been very difficult  to setup on my Xfinity system that combines  both 2.4ghz and 5ghz coming from the router. With the sync module setup is so easy. Sync module connected to my router no problem  in about 30 seconds using the Blink app. Then using the app each additional camera setup and connection was a breeze. Love the ease of use of the blink app to adjust individually adjust settings  for each camera. Pictures and videos through app are very good. I use my cameras to monitor my front door, porch and garage when the garage door is open using my Echo show. Linking your Blink system to Alexa is also very easy using your Alexa app. I plan to purchase some indoor mini cameras  to add to my Blink system. I can't  say enough  how easy setup was with the sync module and Blink app. You also get 30 day free cloud storage. The sync module offers local storage  using a USB flash drive but I will not be utilizing it, opting for cloud  storage  instead. $10 a month for unlimited  cameras at one location.

Review Text: I’ve loved Blink for years! I have 6 cameras & now a doorbell and I’ve never had issues. My house is large and I didn’t need a wifi extended to connect all cameras. I love that the doorbell is sleek and attaches so well. It is hard to slide the face on, but just line them up and slide down hard and you’ll hear the noise.I highly recommend this system to everyone & have converted a few people already. We all love Blink! Definitely get this doorbell and get the camera system if you don’t have it.

Review Text: TLDR: If you anticipate any issues that will require customer support choose a different system!The doorbell and cameras work fine. Review Text: Runs fairly smooth with the "cloud plan" which has a trial run before there is a monthly cost. Once that's over and you decide to move to local storage, the interface becomes so unpleasant to use that you won't even open the app. With the cloud plan you can delete multiple videos that are stored at one time. With local storage you have to load one video at a time which seems like it takes way longer then it should and then you can delete that one video and move on to the next one. That ofcourse is if you dont get a repetitive "system is busy please wait" error. And you will get the error over and over and over again. Maybe I'm jumping to conclusions but it seems like they've made the local storage or free option so horrible so people opt into the monthly subscription. Save your money, look elsewhere. Oh there is a constant glare on my front door/ring camera if I have the front door light on at night that I somewhat fixed by buying a wedge piece that I had to buy separately.

Review Text: We have a blink camera inside and we’re happy with it so we gave this a shot. Install from start to finish took less than one hour. Motion detection works great and the doorbell chime is loud and can be paired with Alexa to notify you if you are not near your phone when the doorbell is rang. Review Text: While the doorbell seems to work as designed, apparently I can't share the notifications with another (wife's) phone without having her login to my Amazon account.  In doing so, she can control the settings, which is not the intent.  Further, if I wanted to share the notifications with a child, they would also login with my account, and also have control over the settings.It would be very useful if Amazon would program the Sync 2 to allow me to designate cell phones for notifications (so when the doorbell is activated, all phones would be notified if they had Notifications enabled for Blink), yet not allow them to make changes to the system.If this is already possible, it would be very good if Amazon made the methodology easy to find in the instructions for the system.

Review Text: I've had this Blink doorbell for a few weeks along with several of the mini's and outdoor cameras. After being a previous Ring doorbell user (until it broke during a move) and after some research, decided to give the Blink product line a try as it seems very similar in benefits, both owned by Amazon, and all Blink products are much cheaper. However, I am very underwhelmed and having some buyer's remorse after a two weeks with this doorbell. If I never had a Ring doorbell, I probably would think this device is pretty cool and works as I would expect a IoT device to work that costs what this does. However, the notifications, motion detection, and quickness of seeing who is at the front door in the app is FAR less impressive than with the Ring.  Since I'm pot committed with the cameras already purchased and mounted around my house, its doubtful I'll exchange the doorbell however, wish I didn't go the cheaper route and should have gone with the better product, Ring.

Review Title: For us, Blink runs circles around Ring in performance

Sometimes Ring took so long to notify us that the person at the door gave up and left.Do for us, Blink has been the much better choice for the doorbell. We also have a few Blink cameras and they are just as quick.

Review Text: So far I am very pleased with the Blink Doorbell system. I bought this for two doors and a Sync 2 module. The one on the front door faces a busy street so I have make distance and sensitivity adjustments to deal with street noise which have worked well for the most part.  I do still get a few false motion alerts from traffic especially at night when car headlights are on. Still a great safety and security feature and I am well pleased. Also have two Minis in doors for when away from the house.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2021

Review Text: The camera itself is not bad. Image quality is good, motion detection works fine.I have an old Ring camera that I'm using to compare my experience to, and what made my decision to return the Blink and stick to my old one were these, from low impact to higher impact on my decision:* Poor UI (low) - the Blink UI still looks like a sketchpad, unfinalized* Input lag (high) - the old Ring camera sounds my notification much earlier than Blink when it detects motion.* Lack of notification control (highest) - on IOS, the camera notifications sound the same as anything else, but it has to call my attention more than, say, WhatsApp. I can control this on Android using the system configuration, but not on iOS. Ring has a very specific chime for motion notification that's unmistakable.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2022

Review Text: No monthly fees, just video sent to your phone & USB storage device via the Sync module.  Can even hear & talk to anyone by the camera. Works well, can even block areas that trigger recordings ( cars on my street).  Only C/O is the time it takes to get a video on my phone . . . Seems a bit slow.  But you can trigger a current picture or video by just pushing a button!  And all the pictures and videos are stored on USB storage.  It was a good buy at a very good price!!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2021

Review Text: It says no where that you need to have a subscription for it to record. My other cameras use the sync module and the doorbell is also hooked up to the sync module so why do I need to purchase a subscription for my doorbell to record but not my cameras. Not happy about that at all. The doorbell is great though captures from very far away even the garbage truck going down the road from a far distance. Wish I didn’t need to pay a subscription to keep it recording though.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2021

Review Text: This was such a waste of money. The lag time is terrible, the night vision is sub par, the motion sensor masking rarely works and it's useless without paying for a monthly data plan . I returned this on January 19th and Amazon still hasn't given me my money back and it's March 10th. Now I'm out $60 and I don't even have the crappy doorbell to show for it. I will update my review if Amazon even returns my money. If they don't do it soon I'm going to contact my bank and have them reverse the charge.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2022

Review Title: Excellent but could use some changes
Review Text: It’s an excellent addition to the Blink system but if could have some tweaks to make it perfect. I have mine not hard wired into my previous bell system. First off, don’t use the cheap quality anchors that come with the it. Get better quality ones and your have less frustration. Secondly, it would be nice if you could turn off the bell ringing outside without changing the audio settings. Additionally sounds would be nice too. Finally, all in all I’m glad they came out with a doorbell.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2021

Review Title: Mounting the doorbell was a challenge, but overall, I'm very happy with the Ring Doorbell Camera
Review Text: The evening I received the doorbell camera, I eagerly opened the package and immediately tried to mount it outside my house. Granted, I was trying this for the first time in somewhat dimmer early evening light, but I could NOT get the doorbell to attach to the mounting plate. I tried for an hour before I gave up for the night. The next morning, I walked outside, and to my amazement, it went on like butter with my first try! The camera works great, but be prepared for a little frustration and be patient mounting the doorbell. Adding the new doorbell camera to my existing set up with 3 other cameras was a breeze. The doorbell camera works great.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2021

Review Text: I wanted to get all my cameras on one system so chose blink. The exterior cameras work great. But the doorbell came out so I tried it as well. Couple issues - set up is a nightmare. Especially when connected to echo show. Then there is no constant light. I thought the blue ring would constantly be on. I can’t even see my doorbell at night. Hopefully software update fixes this. Also wish it would automatically show the doorbell camera on when someone pushes the door bell. A lot of minor things that become annoyingUpdateCamera quality is trash tbh. A lot of small things that are annoying. You would think since Amazon owns blink they would use the lessons learned and apply them with blink. Looks like they missed the memo. I’m kind of pissed that it’s installed and isn’t good quality. Will probably just replace it
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2021

Review Text: Integrates seamlessly with my current Blink set up and works great with Alexa and the various Echo devices we have set up. My only complaint is that the attached wedge for mounting is not included with the doorbell. It's is a separate $7 purchase and only comes in black. Should be included and come in the color of the doorbell you purchase. Other than that, my two doorbells have been great so far. If you already have Blink cameras, and want a doorbell, this is purchase is a no-brainer.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2021

Review Title: Check your transformer voltage if you are going down the hard-wired route.
Review Text: From what I can tell, nowhere on the web adverts does it say this unit only works on 16v-24v lines if you're going to hardwire your bell to your old chimes. Only as soon as you open the box, then it hits you with this critical info.  And not all bell transformers are the same it turns out. Mine was 10v but a test showed it could pump out 12v, which, as it also turns out, appears to be enough to drive the bell, so all's well with the bell, but your mileage may vary.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2021

Review Text: The camera quality is ok for what you’re paying.  I needed to buy the separate angle mount as that was not included.  I also noticed that there were zero instructions included in the box.  Just a little piece of paper with no useful informationThe mounting process is for sure frustrating.  I got it, finally,  but I can see why so many people are having issues getting the camera mounted on the back plate.  It’s just bad design and feels flimsy as well.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2021

Review Text: I had bought a Blink Doorbell a few weeks ago from Amazon but we couldn't get it installed! I called for help but didn't get it so returned for refund. I ordered again and this one worked! I love it!! Sometimes I don't know when people are at my door because of TV sounds etc but hope this helps! It works great but my hubby goes in and out so much I have to keep it disarmed during the day if he's here but love the fact that I can check on things when I'm not home!!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2022

Review Text: *update March 1, 2022*Soon after posting this review, I was contacted by a Blink Customer Support rep who was incredibly helpful and sent me a new doorbell with a prepaid return slip for the old doorbell.  I got the new one in two days and so far it is working great.Bought this in October 2021.  Worked great until February 2022 when it suddenly disconnected from Wi-Fi network (which is about 8’ away.  After over an hour on the phone with technical support, their answer was that I needed to call my cable company and have my 5G system split into a 5G and 2G so that this could run in 2G (whatever that means). All of this even though I have a Blink camera system that works perfectly. I’ll go back to the Ring doorbell, which at least lasted a year.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2022

Review Text: The video quality is great.  I did the free trial for the cloud and was happy with how everything worked.  After my trial ended I added a usb stick to my module so that I can keep recording my motion recorded clips. It turns out that none of the clips play. It also takes a long time to even get the sorry unable to play message. I feel like this is done purposely to get you to buy and subscribe to the monthly cloud service.  I am very unhappy with this product and wish I went with a different brand of camera like LaView which stores up to 5 24hour days on internal storage without external drives.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2022

Review Text: Have had this a week.  I do not have motion detection enabled as we don't need that right now.  I had a little trouble with setup mainly around the wireless connections but it eventually sorted out after a few tries.  It has accurately captured deliveries and notified me, even when I was away from home.  Video quality seems good.  It's not easy to reattach the doorbell to the backing plate which is a major downside.  No major weather yet to test it's durability.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2021

Review Text: I have seen why the reviews on mounting could be difficult, but it’s not complicated. The seal on the back has to be depressed enough for the hooks on the catch plate to catch the backside of the camera. I could think of better ways to attach it, but this works just fine. The quality of the camera is better than our ring doorbell 1 and we’re happy with the change. We’re hoping the blink camera works better than our ring camera in extreme cold. If it works like our other blink systems, then we shouldn’t have a problem.Once everything is installed, open up the app and configure the door chime in settings,  your existing door chime from the old standard doorbell won’t work until you do.The night vision seems to be better quality than the original ring, and a much clearer picture. Our previous doorbell camera would be in night vision mode with our exterior  lights on, this blink doorbell is able to be in full color with the exterior lights!! The infrared is adjustable, and the motion detection is quick in darkness.It’s only been 48 hours, since I installed it, but so far we love it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2021

Review Text: I have bought a couple of cameras, a couple of sync modules, and a doorbell cam. One sync module and doorbell ( just received) are not recognized. The serial numbers won’t connect as legitimate. I am tired of screwing around with products that don’t work. I am guessing at this point I will return what I can and go with another brand. This one has multiple issues; with adding to my network, and being unrecognized. Two out of five components are worthless to me.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2021

Review Text: I purchased this thinking that since it's Amazon owned that it might be a better value than it's competitors. I was wrong. The unit is consistently malfunctioning and no amount of changing the settings or reinstalling it seems to help.The most egregious issue is the motion detection - the one thing that the motion detection consistently does is shut itself off for no reason. It's armed and motion detection is on, but it just stops detecting anything and you need to go into the settings and turn it off and then back on to get it to work again. Also, conversely, it constantly alerts to nothing there even on very low sensitivity.Going into the trash and going to purchase a Ring or other alternative.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2022

Review Text: The product itself is sufficient, Actually for the price it's even better Than that.  But this is a review on all of it, if I had known before I purchased it that I was going to have to enter my email address and get it verified and enter my phone number and get it verified I would not have ordered this I could live without. And to answer the question before it arises we're in arises yes they do use your email address and yes they do send you text messages!!

Review Text: A very good product. But (yeah, you knew it was coming), here are the shortfalls:1. The camera unit takes effort to slide-fit the base plate. This needs better design.2. Night-vision pales and glares the images. If you have a side wall, the glare makes faces unrecognizable.3. I expected the device to draw power from the wiring. Nope! That’s a bummer.Overall, I would definitely recommend this product to all my friends, highlighting these shortfalls so they aren’t surprised.

Not very useful.The hardwire doorbell system seems to work fine.

Review Text: I am a Blink fan, I have close to 20 cameras at multiple properties. but this thing....not so much a fan of. Review Text: I had read several reviews before attempting the install and was a bit apprehensive.  As others have said, it is difficult to get the two pieces connected.  Although I found it easier once the back plate was secured to the wall.  The video which is sent via email or on your blink app clearly shows step by step installation instructions...it was VERY easy.  I didn't use a drill, had I - it would have been even easier.  I attached the 2 wires so the bell still rings in the house as before.  The instructions stated it didn't matter which wire went to which post, which gave me peace of mind.The picture is clear & shows a wide range.  I considered using a wedge, but there's no need in my case.Total installation time was less than half an hour - start to finish - including video check & app connection.  The installation video was step by step and such clear instructions.

Review Title: Not as good as RING - here's why
Review Text: 1) No illumination at night whatsoever. The picture shows the "ring" illuminated, that only happens when someone rings the bell. Unlike Ring which is always illuminated. Crappy and misleading.2) Won't work without batteries installed.3) WEAK, WEAK mounting system, a real joke. As others stated, won't likely last too long. In comparison, the RING mount is very stout.The only upside I see now is cost, and if you have a grandfathered blink account, it should be free.Overall, they missed the mark substantially, and I hope they rectify these issues and reward those of us that went in on good faith only to be disappointed.

Review Text: Have several blink cameras around the house.I did the beta test on the doorbells. Was happy to see they made an all in one unit instead of using a remote camera. That’s a big win to  not have to worry about replacing batteries.Will probably add one to the back door too.

Review Text: Bought the doorbell cam around Black Friday. Installed it quick once it came in a week later and install was easy. Will recommend the wedge to turn the camera and a back adapter to fit on the siding. The camera already payed for itself and then some. On Christmas Eve I got an alert and we have multiple cameras outside that sometimes send a alert that is a tree branch moving or headlights but this was the door bell and for that to set off something was close. I found someone breaking into our car. We were able to call the police and they showed up and arrested him all without alerting the robber that he was seen. All the cameras did there job and got good images and video of the whole event that where saved and sent to the police. It’s cheap insurance to have one. Even just the door bell is a small amount to pay for peace of mind.

Review Text: I have several blink cameras.  I was excited to be able to add a  wireless doorbell to my existing system.  Adding the camera was easy.  Setting up zones and settings was easy.  The app is great.  The free cloud storage available to me is very useful however i wish it was larger.  My biggest complaint is the wall mount. Review Text: It's ok for the price you pay. Review Text: I’ve had nothing but issues with the doorbell from the start and I’m not sure that that’ll be last time. I ordered the doorbell, the sync module and two outside cameras. The sync module and the outside cameras were super easy to instal, took me just a few minutes. From the start the doorbell wasn’t syncing right. Went to install it wired on to my doorbell and after an hour of messing with it called costumer service, they told me it just wasn’t working so they’d send me another one. Review Title: Ok but not as quick as expected

Review Text: This seemed like a great camera. It offered all of the basic functions we were looking for without needing a subscription. Set up and installation was easy and it worked initially for a few hours. Then we stopped receiving notifications even though activity was being recorded. We logged out of the app, restarted our phones and even deleted and reinstalled the app as suggested. This fixed the problem…for a few hours. We tried resetting everything again, even deleted the camera and re-added it but still no notifications. We changed the batteries even though they were the brand new ones that came with the box and should not already be dead. Oddly, that resolved the problem, until the next day when the device suddenly went offline and took 5+ attempts to re-add it successfully. Review Text: I have used the regular Blink outdoor cameras for a couple of years and have been very happy. (which in their words should make the battery last longer)Update:After receiving a free sync module and then breaking the back plate when trying to change batteries. Was sent a new backplate, I think this one might have been improved because today I successfully changed it without the little tabs breaking off like before.So with the sync module and I think they may have made some updates to help with external power. This time the batteries have lasted a little over two months. Which not great but its acceptable. This time the doorbell said the batteries were low about a month in, and then lasted another month. Review Text: I use the doorbell's local storage capability with the Sync 2 controller by putting a jump drive on the sync 2. This allows me to store and see everyone approaching the door. The cost of the video door bell was much less than others out there and links into the sync controller used by my other Blink cameras inside my home. I can also set the Blink cameras so that they can be set individually to either detect motion or not. Once they detect motion, they record the activity in the area the camera is installed. I also like the fact that it takes 2 AA batteries and not some hard -to-find battery type. They say it works with Alexa but since I don't use Alexa, I can't speak to that capability. Overall, it's good value at a good price.

Review Text: Bought this a couple weeks ago and have since found 2 major problems. 1.) Everyone in the house need to share same username and password since there is only one account allowed. So if the doorbell is pressed i find out up to 1/2 hr later!  Same goes for all motion detection…. So if a package is delivered and I’m home it can be taken from my porch before i know it’s delivered.  That’s a PROBLEM and it negates the reason i bought this in the first place.  I will say that of they would fix these 2 issues i would recommend to a friend as the picture quality is decent and it is a relatively low cost. Review Title: No light at to easily see / find it at night
Review Text: Good doorbell, but three things to know.  1. There is no light that is continuously on, so at night, it is hard to see, even when hard wired.  The light only comes on after you push the button (but at that point, what use is that?).  RING and even my previous $2.50 doorbell button lit up (constantly). 2. If you have two Amazon accounts linked on Echo Show as household accounts, Alexa has to be on the correct account in order for the integration to work.  BLINK only works with one assigned Amazon account on your echo show.  3.  There is no way to time your Echo Show to stop the live video if you have set it up to come on whenever the doorbell rings.  So, if someone rings your doorbell and you are away from home, the video will stay live on your echo show (if you have set it up to come on) for 10 minutes or more before it goes off, draining your battery signicantly (batteries are not cheap).

So once subsciption is gone I could see what it does on "it's own". Which turns out to be almost nothing. Why is a sync-module needed if I can't save recordings on the thumb drive? This is like all of them: a subscription based thing, I'm NOT willing to buy the item and then pay for it's operation continously. It seems to be the modern day: Just a littlle (more) additional cost for bette(i.e.full) function - we're getting "nickeld and dimed to death"! I'm not palying this game, door bell is on it's way back...

Review Text: Quick delivery, Simple Install & Ease of Mind!This was my first purchase of a doorbell camera. I must say some comments made me hesitant but I gave it a chance. For those saying the cover doesn’t fit you must notice they have a hook in each corner of the back plate housing that goes in straight then you must push down into place this licking in place and sealing closed. Those saying it’s hard to setup, first make sure your aren’t using Wi-Fi when searching for device (your blink doesn’t come with your home network already cued into it). Thirdly and most importantly this doesn’t have a night light feature like ring (this Model) but uses infrared lighting,  adjust IR sensitivity or use suitable light source to supplement issues of “not visible at night” complaints. I would only say I’d prefer the night light setup for added visibility but like I said I use other lighting sources to illuminate where needed. My two cents take it for what it’s worth.Peace & Love Happy Holidays!!

Review Text: Wow, so very disappointed in this product.  We have had this installed for over a month.  I’ve received “motion” notifications between 12:15-12:20 once every two weeks.  There is nothing when I review the feed.  When someone actually comes to the door, we get nothing.  If someone rings the doorbell, nothing.  We’ve reset apps, phones, Echos, the doorbell itself.  Nothing seems to help.  I thought I was disappointed in our Ring doorbell because it would take 2 minutes to load a video, but at least it sensed motion or let us know if someone rang the doorbell.  We have a blink mini that worked just fine, but once we added the doorbell, the mini goes offline constantly.  I would not recommend anyone waste their money on this as it certainly does not perform like it is meant to.  Going to attempt to return this one and go back to Ring which is something I NEVER thought I would say.  So thankful we didn’t get additional outdoor cameras because I can’t imagine they are any better.  Get it together Blink

Review Title: can be a pain to install with modern routers
Review Text: this doorbell is a pain to install with modern dual band routers (2.4 + 5.0 GHz using the same SSID) since the doorbell will only register on a 2.4GHz network.  I tried phone, tablet, and tried registering at a long distance, none worked because I could not block or disable the 5GHz band.  I was also unable to disable the 5GHz band on my devices or my router.  Ultimately I had to setup a legacy 2.4 GHZ router with the same SSID to get the doorbell registered, then it worked fine on my current network.Doorbell lacks FTP service for local storage so you have to pay the subscription to get videos saved for later viewing.Motion sensor arm/disarm function is nice.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2021

Review Text: I guess I got what I paid for buying the cheapest door bell that would work with my existing Blink system.Cons: Picture quality is not acceptable, with different light situations.- My house has sun-shade most of the day in front side of house, so sun light is on my yard and shade is on the door area, so if someone standing front of camera all you see is shadow of that person. I tried to manually tilt the camera every which way but did not help a bit, it was lack of light on sunny bright day.-Night vision is not same as my other blink cameras, if setting is on high/medium you see bright light at your face, if its set to low then you can barely make out the person.-Can't view live stream when someone presses the button or motion, even setting the Alexa RoutinesPros: Cheap, easy setup, had problem with back plate but it slides on fine when you install it on the wall.

Review Text: While I think the doorbell itself is a good product, the Blink app makes it nearly useless.  Its strictly tied to any global schedule you have.  Since we have indoor blink cams too, and we don't want them to trigger on motion 24/7, we have a schedule.  Well the schedule is all cams or no cams.  Blink engineers were so short sighted here.  How they did not even consider the fact that indoor cams and outdoor cams should run on different schedules, is beyond me.  This is a normal basic function of security camera systems.I did speak with blink support about it, and their best suggestion was to create a second system in my account and put all outdoor cams in it.  And while I agree that will work, it's not ideal at all.  I put in for a feature request for the schedule to be device, device type, or device group controllable.  Who knows if they will follow through or not.  Regardless, this is a huge miss/oversight by Blink.  Hardware is great though, for the cost.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2021

Review Title: Too slow to respond to doorbell via app
Review Text: Pros: Reasonably clear instructions. Straight forward to mount on the wall with included angled doorbell mount. A snap to connect to existing doorbell wiring. Uneventful pairing with Sync Module 2.Cons: The key issue:- when the Blink doorbell is pressed, the video signal via the Blink App takes far too long to allow conversation with (or even a sight of) the person at the door - they have long gone. My doorbell and sync module are both within 10 feet of the router with no significant obstructions. The doorbell does not operate (at all) without the sync module 2 hub - additional cost. A USB memory dongle also has to be purchased if clips are to be saved locally - potentially an additional cost but not necessary with the paid cloud subscription service. The sync module 2 hub is a "wifi extender" - and when paired with the router it noticeably slowed the rest of my home wifi network.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2022

Review Title: Quick notification, but lags when trying to watch live video
Review Text: I was very close to buying a ring doorbell because i really needed a doorbell and wanted the extra perks of having the camera doorbell. The mounting was very easy and took maybe less than 10 minutes. The camera quality is great and the motion detection is also great, it actually notifies and detcts quicker than the outdoor cameras. The only complaint that i have is that when i get a notification for the doorbell, it takes me to the live video which doesnt always pop up if its still recording, or sometimes it fails to even open the live view. I have connected it to my alexa so i love that my alexa also pings when there is motion detected. Overall i really do enjoy it and for only $35 i think its beyond worth the money! Camera quality is pretty good and so it the night vision.

We have indoor cameras from Blink and wanted to expand our cameras through them sense they work amazing, best quality at this price range. We got the doorbell and love it. Now we are getting the outdoor. I wish that you could choose the image you want to save as the main thing so you known where it points at. I haven’t got anything Alexa so I haven’t tried that either so no clue on that part.

Review Title: Absolute Garbage Don't Waste Your Money
Review Text: Sync module quit working after about a week, will not reset, won't let me delete it from my application, will not let me access my cameras. Blink cameras do not pair with alexa so you can't view video on any other Amazon device. Customer support does not answer phone calls, so no support from Amazon on their worthless camera system. Avoid this system at all costs.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2022

Review Text: I spend no more than 30 minutes from start to finish and mounted to the front of the house connected to the doorbell chime. Once you are connected to the app and wifi the app has easy step by step instructions on how to set everything up and wire it to existing chime. The image on the camera is really nice during the day but a bit choppy when the night vision is on. You may also want to mess with the sensitivity of the motion detection otherwise it will pick up every passing car and the speak function is a little delayed but sound crystal clear from the person at the door perspective. Honestly a great cheap way to know what is happening at your front door
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2022

Review Title: The cheap mount destroys its potential
Review Text: This had the potential to be a good product.  However, the mounting system is awful and the tiny plastic clips on the mount plate can break easily.  (This is well-documented from many reviews at this point.).  If they modified the mount it could be great but with the cheap build and risk of it breaking every time its removed to change batteries, it’s not worth it in any way.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2022

Review Text: The prongs keeping it together broke while trying to change out the batteries. The batteries only lasted 2 months. Not 2 years like they try to tell you. The prongs broke when trying to get it off the wall to change the batteries out. Very disappointed. I paid $85 for the unit just for it to break while trying to get it off the wall! The tool to take it off the wall isn’t great.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2022

Review Text: Set up was easy and adding it to my other Blink products was also easy. I am impressed how I can see who is at my door and talk to them as well even when I'm not home.. The motion picks up a very wide and a long way. I can see across the street.  Another feature you can have your echo announce the door bell ring or add it to your existing chime. I love my Blink .
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2022

Review Title: Underwhelmed with Blink Video Doorbell and Blink app
Review Text: Live on a busy street and having an extremely difficult time getting the sensitivity set. Even using the zones (nice feature), it seems incremental changes result in either cars constantly setting the motion sensor off, or alternately, me being able to do cartwheels directly in front of the doorbell without triggering it.There is a substantial lag before the app is triggered for motion.Overall, not the worst purchase i've made and i will just stick with it for now.The price point is good, but i still expected more.a couple of notes: general set up was very easy. A lot of people make note of the mounting difficulty. it is difficult, but leaning my full weight into it (counterintuitively) instantly locked in the mount.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2021

Review Title: Buggy and won't record video UPDATED
Review Text: Put plainly: junk. Will not record video (on either sync1 or sync2 module). More often than not, it does not communicate with the server and cannot load live video or update. Stay far away. Sloppy work all around.UPDATE: Amazon reached out and corrected the issue with virtually no intervention on my part Things are running smoothly now. Excellent customer service and follow-up.

Review Text: I bought the Blink Doorbell more than a month ago and installed it yesterday. I waited a long time for this doorbell to complete my Blink camera system. Everything works great and I am very happy with the purchase. Blink makes it easy to install with easy step-by-step installation for both battery and hard-wired installations. The camera has superior motion detection. I can see vehicles passing by at a distance of about 50 feet. The night vision is also great and I can hear people talking from 100 or so feet away from the camera. It’s only been a day but, so far, I am 100% satisfied with this video doorbell along with my other Blink cameras which I have had for about 2 years now.

Review Text: Originally bought the Ring video doorbell for twice the price and it wouldn't even pick up the mailman coming up on our porch, didn't even pick up an Amazon delivery. Since it wasnt working right we decided to switch to Blink since we had their cameras. We had to also buy an echo dot to act as the doorbell in the house for the Blink doorbell so it roughly came out to the same price as the Ring and the chime but...THIS WORKS SO MUCH BETTER. The Blink catches the mailman and every delivery. I am beyond happy with it and linking it up to the echo dot was pretty easy. If your deciding between the Ring and The Blink doorbell....pick this one!

Review Text: We have other Blink cameras and bought the Blink doorbell to benefit from the cloud storage we already pay for. This doorbell is terrible. Review Title: Sync Module wouldn't work, and tech support unhelpful
Review Text: The Sync Module wouldn't connect to their servers no matter what I did. I went back and forth with Blink tech support for 2 weeks, and tried a replacement module, but nothing helped. The tech support wasn't helpful at all, continuously repeating the same advice ("turn it off and back on again") and I would have to wait a day between each response. Review Title: Great camera, great motion detection, HORRIBLE battery life
Review Text: I have quite a few Blink products (multiple Blink Minis and wireless indoor cameras). The Blink Doorbell is my first outdoor device. I have liked nearly everything about it: installation and setup were quick, clear and simple and the camera itself and motion detection are great. I would probably have given the product 5 stars except that I’ve only had it a few months and I’ve already had to change the batteries twice! Obviously, I’ve turned down the motion sensitivity, decreased the clip retrigger time, etc. to extend the life of the batteries, but it doesn’t seem to be helping. It’s really pretty annoying, as I consider this camera the most important of those in my home security system.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2022

Review Title: Can be easily stolen in a Blink
Review Text: This product has a locking mechanism that is poorly designed. The only think difficult is to slide it one the backing plate to slide engage the lock. Due to the dry nature of the rubber seal, one can easily lube the rubber ring with a light grease or even table butter to make move much easier. After it appeared locked in place, i used the provided wedge as a "key" to remove the doorbell for battery access. Having put very little pressure, the doorbell came right off. I thought that was too easy, so I reattached the doorbell, but this time i tried to lift it off without the key wedge. Guess what? It came right off without any tool needed. This product is not secure in any way, shape or form. Sad Amazon selling this kind of lame product line. Will be return before it gets stolen off my front door.

Review Title: If you get a lemon, be prepared to jump through hoops to simply return it for a replacement!
Review Text: Amazingly, when I got my replacement video door bell, for the first one I got that didn't work, it works exactly as advertised and it works with my home door bell system in the wired configuration.  However, to get to this level of satisfaction, I hope you don't get a lemon on the first go.  Do not call Amazon tech support!  They will waste your time helping you discover what you already know, the thing doesn't work.  But, they won't arrange for you to get a replacement.  Instead, they will insist you call Blink tech support to waste more time determining what you already know, the thing doesn't work.  And, then Blink tech support will arrange for a replacement, in my case, that works perfectly.  I suppose, all's well, that ends well!

I contacted customer service and they said it is going to be an rma i sent my address to them now all i hear is crickets. Review Title: Integrate nicely into an existing Blink system
Review Text: The installation and setup are relatively easy in my existing Blink system with a mechanical doorbell chime.  However, my mechanical doorbell needs about 5 sec to finish playing the tune.  The Blink doorbell does not have a built-in diode to allow the low voltage current to continue to flow thru to complete the chiming.  The App has adjustment for the strength of hitting the mechanical hammer, but not the duration of the chime.  So I could only get one tone hit of the doorbell, not a complete multi-tone tune.  Perhaps I need to find a way to install the proper diode in the wiring.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2022

Review Title: Can’t use all features without a subscription
Review Text: This could of been a great product, instead it is just a disappointing product that pigeonholes you into a monthly subscription if you want full functionality of the product you already paid for.  Without a subscription you can’t view recordings from your phone, you’ll have to use a sync module and a flash drive to store video, and it can only be viewed from another device.  I wish I realized this before I purchased the system

I think the product is useful, just not to its full potential in my situation.

I called support and mentioned that it was a common complaint and they were going to send me a new mount that supposedly made it easier. I received and did not find it any easier. I thought it was the exact same thing as the original. I ended up returning it. I would recommend this product only because it’s Amazon and you have easy returns if you have a problem like mine.

So now the doorbell is really only useful to tell us when there is someone ringing the doorbell, but it doesn’t tell us if someone comes up and looks in the window or steals a package from the porch.
