Review Title: Good Quality camera. Easy to set up
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2022

Review Text:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   Look I’ll make this super simple. This is a budget doorbell security camera. It doesn’t stay on 24 hrs a day, it only captures video when there is movement. The quality is pretty damn good for $35 bucks on Black Friday.Do not listen to all of these reviews saying install is impossible. It is hilariously easy. Slide down and push to lock it in place. It took me less than 45 seconds to drill it and put it on. I even have a video of when I took it off to have my five year old do it with simple direction.Video is crisp, very minimal delay (less than a second from initial movement, running on my xfinity WiFi) and set up with my echo 8 was easy.Unboxing this blink doorbell, sync module 2, 1 outdoor blink camera, the echo 8 then syncing and installing everything took less than a half hour.Cool little doorbell camera, looks nice, has a good chime on the doorbell itself and to my echoI would recommend this unit to anyone who wants basic security without breaking the bank
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2021

Review Title: Great alternative to Ring. Need better mounting system
Review Text: update: the official wedge mount is now $7.99I bought this because I already have 4 other Blink cameras and 2 sync modules. I'm grandfathered into the free cloud storage. So, it makes sense to pay $50 for this little doorbell.I removed my existing doorbell so I can wired it in but due to the placement of the previous doorbell, the angle is not ideal. Mounting it flat against my brick wall is cutting off a little side coverage. The $12.99 wedge accessory was a bit too much for me to pay so I printed my own wedge mount.Overall, it works well. Picture/Video quality is pretty good. Wiring it into my existing doorbell works and it also "rings" my doorbell on the inside.If you are interested, you can download the STL file on thingiverse. Look for: 5051584 (deleted).This is the thing file now. 5078934Search for "blink doorbell"
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2021

Review Text: I was unable to access Live View without the doorbell being pressed. I purchased the Sync Module and still had no Live View. I contacted Customer Service and here's a snapshot of the email response. This helped tremendously and now I can access Live View anytime I want! These instructions are not ANYWHERE online or in the packages themselves! I hope this helps so any others!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2021

Review Text: I was really excited about the blink doorbell, my house is covered by blink cameras and I thought this was the perfect opportunity to add the doorbell to my system. I had a ring doorbell  and currently have a Eufy, but I like the blink app and having all of my cameras in one solution. I really liked the price also. Unfortunately I had to return it to Best Buy where I bought it. My mounting location is vinyl siding and I just could not get the unit to mount to the backing. Now I have installed many video doorbells and this one was the only one I had a challenge with. In fact I had to reinstall my eufy as I just could not get the blink to lock into the backing. Even just holding it and trying to do it was a challenge. I looked to see if any vendors had created a mounting system I could use, but not as of yet. So I will wait until blink improves how the unit attaches to the face plate and then try again.An update. So blink support reached out to me after my review and sent me a replacement along with a video on installation and this one I was able to get installed. I really like blink and am glad I now have it integrated into my blink system. Great support.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2021

Review Text: I went against my better judgment and decided to get this because I wanted something cheap and easy to look at my out my backyard patio door. Long story short, but I have a random peacock that strolls me neighborhood backyards, and I feed it sometimes, so I like to see when he comes up for food and such right at my backyard door. The night vision on this is absolutely terrible for some reason. There is some sort of glare on the left side. Also, there is definite lag when it comes to viewing the motion. I guess you get what you pay for.Installation was slightly difficult, but I read someone else's review on tips on how to latch the camera onto the back piece. You place it on there, make sure the hook things on the backpiece aligns with the inserts on the camera piece, and then push it downwards really hard. Then it will sort of click into place. It won't budge after that.I'm returning the device. I want to be able to view it live when the motion detector pops up, but it lags about 6 seconds, and sometimes the motion is already gone by then.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2021

Review Text: This blink doorbell is advertised as “battery or wired”. Meaning it can operate from the battery, or it can operate from the wired connection to the doorbell transformer.False! This system always runs off battery, even when wired to a 16-24V transformer.I bought this specifically because I was tired of changing the batteries in my Blink camera. Turns out that now I’ll get to spend the same wasted time and money changing batteries on my doorbell…
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2022

Review Text: It's only been operating for 5 days but I prefer it over the Ring doorbell I replaced.  The Ring worked fine but I was tired of having to bounce between apps for my Blink cameras and the Ring doorbell.  At $35, I'm very impressed with the quality of the Blink doorbell (I already had 1st gen sync modules for the cameras so I didn't have to buy a 2nd gen sync module).  The front door is on the north side of the house and is covered by a portico.  The only drawback of the Blink doorbell is that when it is sunny outside the camera is overwhelmed by the bright background and the face of a visitor is too dark to be sure who it is until the person gets very close to the doorbell, blocking out most of the bright background.  The Ring was better in that situation.  At night, the Blink does a bit better than the Ring in showing the face.  All in all, a very good product.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2021

Review Text: I had a wireless doorbell before that had a receiver in the house that I could hear. This doorbell is great, but it will only send you a phone notification. It's pointless to have the doorbell ring outside of the house where you can't hear it. Blink needs to make a chime receiver for inside the house. They didn't think this one through for the people who live in apartments who don't have doorbells. You will need an echo connected in the house to hear the chime on other words. I should have waited on this one...
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2021

Review Text: Just received this smart doorbell shipping was extremely prompt as expected through Prime shipping. The product was very easy to mount next my front door and get up and running with the included instructions. My house does not have a powered front doorbell so the battery non-wired option worked great for me and made set up a breeze. It connected easily to my alexa show and the rest of my smart system. The app works very well so far and the video quality is very good for what I need it to be. I have already used the app to see when a perishable package I had been expecting arrived so I could time my lunch break to get right in the freezer. I'm excited to explore the rest of the features once I dive in and get to experience the rest of what this smart door bell can offer.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2021

Review Text: Just got this yesterday (10/25) after pre-ordering on my wife’s Prime Account, hoping it would ship and arrive on the 21st when it was first available, but anyhow, I digress. I’ve set it up temporarily with Velcro strips to see how it performs facing out our street which has low traffic during the day. It picks up a lot of movement as a Blink camera would before you adjust settings. Image quality is so/so in low light but during high sun the image quality is good. Main reasons for getting this new Blink product is to consolidate and move away from the other well known door bell company that I’m currently using but they want exorbitant fees for storage of clips per year. Also thefts have picked up in our neighborhood lately and these cameras are proving useful in identifying criminals as they roam and steal from our neighbors. I’ll keep you updated on the progress of the unit. I hope it works as good as the Blink Cameras.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2021

Review Title: UPDATED: BATTERY KILLER better than off-brand, has compatibility issues with Echo and live view
Review Text: Well... first, the batteries died in less than a week, but to be fair, I didn't buy it through Amazon. I bought it at Target, so who knows how long they sat there in the box. UPDATE: Then I put in another pair of EXPENSIVE Lithium Ion AA's, and they only lasted a week as well. I have all settings on default so I don't get it. They boast that the batteries could last "UP TO 2 YEARS"... and I am not even getting two darn weeks!I also bought a blink outdoor floodlight and 2 additional outdoor blink cameras. My suggestion is not to set up the doorbell before you set up the others. Unless you have a stand alone doorbell, then go for it. But the floodlight and additional cameras came with a sync module. And if you set up the doorbell first, and the sync module later, you have to delete the doorbell camera and go through the entire set up process again for it to sync. Wish I would have known that earlier. All in all though it was easy to get set up and working.I am still having issues with viewing any of the cameras live, through the blink app, the amazon mobile app, AND my Echo show. Amazon skills are just not up to par with the rest of the technology. I love that they are all wireless though. Being in an apartment, I can't be drilling holes all over the place and having power wires hanging around outside either. So for that I am happy they are easily installed.I am a little concerned about battery life, but we shall see! UPDATE: And so far I am seeing - this product is a battery hog. And it's NOT compatible with re-chargeables. so basically we're screwed if we dont hard wire it or have a way to hard wire it. For that I am not impressed. I would have gone with a RING instead.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2021

Review Title: Not sure why the negative reviews
Review Text: The instructions were clear regarding how to mount. The package came with a angle mount, so I screwed that in and attached the device as explained.The reason it is “difficult” to mount is to provide security for the device. Once latched, you need a tool to remove. It took me about 4 minutes to have this up and running.I am using this device with WiFi and the picture quality is good. The picture does however seem to become drowned by bright light, so hopefully an update will correct. Otherwise, this is a great device for the $$.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2021

Review Text: Where to begin.  For starters......this system is NOT a system.  It rang up as 3 separate orders and SHIPPED in 3 separate orders !  WTH ?!?  I got the doorbell first.  The installation was infuriating.  Tells you how to install the batteries and install it, and then after you get the stupid thing installed .....the app tells you that you have to scan the QR code in order to pair the device with the app.  Where's the QR code....??  On the BACK of the doorbell that you just installed on your front door !!  GGRRrrrrr.  Nothing was simple or intuitive or correct on the first try.  The app is terrible.  The Blink doorbell will only display live view if it is hard wired.  (Not clear in description).  The motion detection was terrible.  Didn't work most of the time.  Then the other packages finally arrived (about a week later).  The first thing you're supposed to do it connect the Sync module.  Again.....instructions on how to install batters and plug in.....only to find out that you have to take it apart again in order to scan the QR code.....on the back.  Sync module would not connect to the network.  It seemed like it almost would once.....then nothing.  Just spinning wheel of doom forever.  Tells you to press the reset button on the Sync module.  What reset button ???  Had to look that one up online.  (It's a tiny pin hole on the side next to the USB connector.  No tool included for that one.)  Tried over and over and it still wouldn't connect.  (Without the Sync module BTW ....you lose most of the features of this system)  I didn't even get to the cameras honestly.  I was so fed up by this point that I packed the entire system back up and requested a return and refund.  Complete waste of time.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2021

Review Title: Cheap and breaks way to easy!
Review Text: Save your money for a better product. This thing was nothing but crap. When ai installed the thing the little rubber seals on the back plate that keeps water out shredded to pieces. No big deal it is under a overhang and water is not going to get in it so I thought nothing of it. Then the free trial ends and you can not imagine how hard it is to find a way to subscribe so that you record videos and get notifications on your phone. The thing was useless for almost a week because their customer service never called me back as requested and it is darn near impossible to get them on the phone or to respond. Then after less than 2 months the batteries go dead. They advertise the battery life is 2 years! No way. So I go to replace the batteries using the tool they provide to open the thing. Mind you they give no instructions on how to open the thing and it was hard enough to get it mounted the first time. I was happy it was going to be a couple of years before having to touch it for 2 years. Well every one of the cheap plastic pegs that it mounts to on the back snapped right off. Had anyone just pulled a little on it the thing would have been gone in a quick second. I call them up and they refused to help me. They tell me take it back to where you bought it. What? You are technical support and should be able to get to replace it or refund me my money. So I am off to find a brand that is not owned by Amazon because their products are terrible.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2022

Review Text: I actually did not have any issues with the set up. however the video is very laggy there is a 5 to 10 second delay in the video and in any audio communication there is also many times where the live feed simply fails to show upOnly good thing is price
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2021

Review Title: The Blink Doorbell Mount is Horrible!  Update!
Review Text: Update!  I was impressed that Blink contacted me concerning the mount problem with their doorbell and actually sent me a replacement.  Unfortunately this doorbell has the same issues as the original.  Mounting the doorbell is very challenging and likely impossible for many people.  After watching the available video, yes there's a video, I was able to mount the doorbell to my home but it took many attempts and a lot of cursing!  On the flip side you'll have to detach the doorbell from the mount someday to change the battery.  Blink included a special tool for this but I've not been successful and I'm thinking that I'll end of breaking it.  So for now I have a working doorbell until the battery dies.I'm increasing my rating from one to two stars because once mounted, the Blink Doorbell does what it's supposed to do. Someone comes to my door and there's a notification on my phone.  Pressing the doorbell button provides a doorbell sound on my phone. I able to communicate back & forth with the person at my door from my phone.  I also like that the doorbell can activate my existing bell in my home. If you have a Blink system you may want to buy another sync module with the doorbell. That way you can have the doorbell always on without having to turn your cameras on.I do recommend waiting to buy the Blink Doorbell until the issue with the mount is resolved. I've been informed by Blink that it's going to addressed.  If they can resolve the mounting problem I see this being a four star product.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2021

Review Text: I wanted to try this system because you don't need a subscription for basic things like detecting when packages are delivered.  The video is stored in a USB drive.  The setup is very easy and was quick.  Video quality is very good.  There are several good options and settings as well.But now the bad... the user is supposed to be able to set activity zones so that the system doesn't alert you every time a car or person passes by.  I set the zone so that it's only on my porch, so I can be alerted when the mailman or other delivery comes in or someone rings the doorbell.  Unfortunately, no matter what I did, it still detected every single car that passed by even though the street is completely removed from the detection zone, so I end up with numerous notifications and videos.  Now the app does say this feature is in Beta, but there's no way to know if this will ever get fixed.  I am returning the system because I don't want so many notifications showing me every car that passes by.I also wanted to point out what many others have, and that’s the mounting plate.  It’s fairly difficult to mount the camera on the mounting plate… bad design.  And one more thing… I would urge potential users to not believe the advertised 2 year battery life.  Two years on two AA batteries just won’t happen.  Maybe the manufacturer tested this device under ideal laboratory conditions that would never be duplicated in actual use.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2022

Review Title: This camera is a pain in all areas. (I was given this set as a gift)
Review Text:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   Original review(around 11/16/21):So I’ve only had this for two weeks. It was a gift. Even with the low settings I’m already replacing the batteries. About a week in with the same settings it showed the batteries needed to be replaced. I replaced them with regular Duracell batteries to see if maybe there was a problem with the device or batteries. The Duracell lasted a few days before saying “replace”. I did realize after using the Duracell batteries that it needs to be Alkaline batteries. I then put the same energizer batteries back in and it was at 100% since that day(echo shows consumption). A week later they needed to be replaced.12/21/21 update: I was contacted by a Blink rep to try and figure out why I had to replace my batteries so soon(on 11/18). My camera IS always “armed” so it recorded “95,000 seconds as a total of motion detection and live view. The motion detection duration is about 95% of that 95,000 seconds”. My camera is on a slightly “busy” street, and I have a neighbor who’s a chain smoker and avid porch stander so the settings for sensitivity is low(4). But I was advised by the rep to set “privacy zones” which wouldn’t detect motion. In the videos you can see there’s NO motion(other than the small insects that fly near, which has never triggered the camera) and yet I’m still being alerted to movement. I’ve tried setting it to “end motion early” but it’ll literally end in the middle of someone passing or a car driving by. There has been times where I’ve refreshed the still photo and see a car behind me, but have no video of the car parking or leaving. I did remove a star because the problem still persists.12/26/21 update: as of today I have yet to receive a response to the several emails I’ve sent. As you can see in the video I have areas grayed out and I still received a notification for this “motion”. I’ve had to go back and forth on the settings because at a sensitivity of 3, I get NO notifications, but at 4 I get 400 notifications. I’ve also noticed if you set it to “end clip early if motion stops” someone can be walking past and the camera will pick up 3 seconds of it and end, even though they’re still walking in view of the camera. There can be someone standing right in front of the camera and I’ll get no notification. I also have notifications turned on on my phone(iPhone 11) and I’ll only see any notifications once I open the app. Not sure if that’s a blink issue or apple issue. Lastly, there are still times where the still is unable to refresh and I have to force close the app a couple times to get it to work.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2021

Review Title: Very poor instructions and buggy software
Review Text: I cannot rate Motion Detection, Night Vision, or Alexa Integration because I could not get my Blink Video Doorbell and Sync Module to work.There are very poor instructions. There's no overview, telling what does what and the sequence for creating your Blink network. Whoever developed the instructions should be fired. They're terrible (and only available online... too cheap to pay for printing?).So I went on YouTube and found help there. Unfortunately, while installing the physical doorbell seemed fairly straightforward, hooking the Sync Module up to my WiFi was anything but. After two frustrating hours, I finally gave up and boxed the whole mess up and sent it back to Amazon/Blink. Mind you, I have 1Gb WiFi throughout my home, with repeaters, so it wasn't a question of signal strength or bandwidth. I can run three laptops, a Sonos sound system, two smart TVs, several mobile devices, and more with no problem. FWIW, a couple of the YouTube reviewers were fairly critical of the Blink system, and the demos seemed to show a slow response to motion detection.Like so many websites these days, when you go to https://blinkforhome.com they try to sell you stuff, so you have to hunt for support. When you get there, they let you know they are super busy but go ahead and scroll through the FAQs and pray someone can answer your questions. Seriously?The system was a gift, so I will now shop for a video doorbell system that's highly rated and reasonably easy to install. Even if the replacement is double the price of the Blink, it will be well worth it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2022

Review Title: Terrible Product, Terrible Customer Service, Terrible Company. Don't Waste Your Time & Money.
Review Text: I had issues getting it to connect from the start, but finally got it to connect. It worked fine for a couple weeks before it started acting up again. Wouldn't activate by motion when people came to the door. If the doorbell was pressed, it would act to wake it up & then it might connect. Even when connected, using Alexa as a chime speaker was nearly useless as the delay was HUGE.The Sync module was the worst. I got it along with 2 cameras and it worked for 24 hours before IT had issues. It couldn't be seen on the network by the app, so I attempted to reset it. It didn't work. I spent A MONTH with tech support, only to get nowhere. They REFUSED to offer a sync module replacement to see if there was a hardware problem. I was patient, polite, understanding. I'm an IT guy by trade, but they kept feeding me pretty terrible suggestions & wanted me to use RouteThis Helps. That app is poorly reviewed and they couldn't tell me exactly what they wanted from the logs to help fix the issue, especially as they claimed fixing anything on my network specifically "was outside their scope". I said I'll just send everything back, thanks, and they basically said "OK".WOW. Perhaps the single worst beginning to end experience with a product I've ever had. It boggles the mind.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2021

Review Title: Local storage and good motion detection
Review Text: Pros:1. This device uses your homes existing doorbell chime instead of a wonky plug in chime like some other companies.2. The motion detection is very easily tunable3. This device can be added to a network of other cameras using the sync 2 module, and those cameras are also affordable and work as well as this doorbell cam does4. This device is both battery powered and wired capable, so you don't have to bother with deciding which one you need, because it does both.Cons:1. The doorbell is slow to load the feed when you first try to do a live view2. The recorded video will be interrupted if you try to view the feed after getting a motion detected notification with current firmware.3. The mount is a little floppy, I wish this item came with 4 screws instead of just the 2.Overall:This camera is great by itself, but it really shines when combined with the other camera options available through blink as an integrated system with the sync 2 module. Local storage is upgradable to a whopping 256gb USB stick which is fantastic. This is a great value for what you get.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2021

Review Title: Poor Quality and horrible without subscription
Review Text: I bought this during Black Friday and really enjoy it initial. I enjoyed it because it had a nice picture quality during the day (however during the rise and set of the sun the picture coloring got wonky) , the free month trial of the blink subscription plan was nice - it marked the date and time of clips, it showed you a preview picture of what was captured, and if you had viewed the clip yet or not. However, I got the combo pack to save on the subscription price so I could save the videos locally and not pay a subscription. Ha should have known better - the videos almost never played from the model sync, no date or time on the clips, the quality was horrible, no preview picture, and sometime you’d click on a clip just to notice it was playing another clip all together. Not to mention the night quality (in a very well lit parking area) was horrible. They promote good battery life if you keep everything (length of clip, IR brightness and motion window) to a bare minimum.  This camera works really well with the subscription plan but without it storing your videos locally is horrible, the play back feature is the worst, night vision is super bad, battery life is bad, and it’s not worth the money.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2022

Review Title: Mounting sucks. Support says motion detection only works side to side.
Review Text: Trying to mount this is a pita. I'm using the corner mount and either all of the little plastic tabs aren't locking in or mine is defective. It will just pull right off the mount with a light pull. I don't know how the ring or the g one mounts. maybe they all work like this? I'm afraid this might be stolen.I had to set the sensitivity to 4 in order for it to stop detecting headlights bouncing off my porch and setting off the motion detector. It was still detecting people walking to my door just fine.Then this morning around 6:30 USPS dropped off a big amazon box to me on my porch. It didn't even see them. :(I'm gonna play with the mounting and try to get it more secure / in a better position and see if that helps.Also setting it up was kinda finicky.  I had to delete from the app and reset the sync module and the camera after I tried adding it and it added but nothing would work.Also who ever was in charge of the setup tutorial in the app needs a few stars taken off them. It's not as clear as it should be. Sometimes you don't even know what to do next and have to guess.Also also, If you do the hard wire option and your chime isn't working, Make sure you actually did the installation hardwire option. If you don't select that option it doesn't send anything to the chime. It lets you pick your chime analog / digital and you can test out the sound. That part was pretty neat.Update:Remounted without the angle bracket. Changed sensitivity back to the default of 5. Reset my activity zones. Now it doesn't detect motion unless someone is about 3-4 feet from it.Just got off the phone with support. They said it only detects side to side movement and I should remount with the corner bracket.I'm gonna try changing the sensitivity to 6 and see if it makes a difference. If I have to change to the corner bracket, I'll probably just return it or give up and leave it where it is.You can see my zones setup in the photo with the ring pointed straight ahead. I feel like this is a pretty typical installation.Not sure if ring would work better or not.Update:Battery lasted a few days over a month I think. I thought they said 2 years?This thing was already a pain to mount. I don't want to be changing the batteries every month too.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2021

Review Text: I read lots of reviews and I got mine at Christmas from my daughter. My son in law installed it took about 10 minutes total. I'm not sure why others are having issues as far as the one it don't work with 5G well mine does so maybe it's their internet provider or something else? So far I like mine. If this jinx's it I'll be back to report. I see on here those who had the common sense to contact Blink CS and as for wireless vs not wireless all I can tell you is what an I.T told me. There is nothing totally wireless even your cell phone depends on an electric source to recharge. ( Yes a car battery is considered an electrical source!) I think the problem most are having are as with myself this is not for the novice. That's why my son in law set it up for me ? I find as I age it's the simple things that become difficult. So my review for now is I love my Blink ! I can see and hear whose at my door very good when you are alone. Also gives you time to prepare in case it's someone trying to break in. They get a real bang out of it in my house ! 😁
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2022

Review Title: You get what you pay for
Review Text: This is a terrible video doorbell.  I own several rental properties and have video doorbells at each one.  In other words, I am fairly familiar with the other ones on the market.  I decided to try the Blink when the one I wanted was out of stock and it’s a total disappointment.  First of all, the picture quality is terrible.  Secondly the app is extremely show so when you finally do see the camera, it’s too late.  Also it has a super annoying feature where if you are viewing the surveillance live, it makes you press “Continue” every 15 seconds in order to keep watching.  I am returning it and honestly would not pay $1 for the Blink because it defeats the purpose of even having a video doorbell due to its terrible picture quality and it’s slow speed.  It amazes me that this product could have such positive reviews.  It’s interesting how the products make by Amazon-owned companies seem to always have stellar reviews.  Amazon has changed in so many ways over the past three years that it doesn’t even seem like the same company anymore.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2022

Review Title: Long time coming but not right yet
Review Text: Been waiting to add-on the Blink doorbell cam for years. After already having the Blink system with 5 ourdoor cameras  I figured the new doorbell cam would be a slam-dunk. Sadly, I'm  very disappointed.  While the camera sync'd to the system easy enough it was the mounting  being totally flawed. I've read other reviews noting flat surface necessity so using the corner mount should render this point moot. I even tried to get the backplate to hold without even mounting it, no go  The issue is the flimsy back plate, slide-tabs, gasket and bottom locking clip. WHAT A STUPID DEDIGN!  It would have been much better to use larger internal slide-tabs and a small locking set screw on the bottom. As for the gasket, it sticks and needs lubricated in order to slide the two pieces together. All-in-all this is huge design flaw, if possible wait for Rev.2...I wish I had.  I  don't know why Blink didn't use Ring's doorbell housing and just swap out the guts. That would've been much smarter. It shouldn't be that hard to design a simple/secure mounting. BTW: Blink customer sevice is sending me a new backplate but I  doubt if it will make much difference.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2021

Review Text: The Blink doorbell is a nice addition to their other cameras. The look and feel of the camera is pretty good. They designed it to be a quick and easy install. At first, sliding the camera onto the base can be challenging, but if you follow the gif example on how to attach it and firmly slide it down, you’ll find that the camera is securely attached. I only put 4 stars because the night vision needs a little work.Liked: Look & feel, chimes on camera & chime box (w/o wiring to chime box), daytime picture, motion, and priceDisliked: nighttime picture
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2021

Review Title: Updated original review…go with a more established doorbell
Review Text: Old review at bottom. Update: Blink service ran a diagnostic in the doorbell and reported a hardware issue. They sent me another one. So, the first one would detect motion…all the time! When I thought I had it tuned in, it started going off all the time again. But, it would also not detect something right in front of it quite a bit. The video to audio lag was ridiculous. So, maybe this new one would be different. Nope, doesn’t detect any motion. I have done all the trouble shooting and nothing. Getting to support through the app is a hassle too. It want to take you to a you type, we predict thing. If you select “contact support” again, it just takes back through the whole type your question here. So, they reached out to me after the first issues (both through support and a rep who saw my review) so kudos to that. However, it’s not a reliable doorbell. Poor backplate design, poor battery life, a difficult to navigate app that doesn’t seem to match to online help directions, lack luster and unreliable motion detection, terrible lag (and weird digital noises), videos are supposed to be 10s long but only went for 2-3 (settings for cut early were disabled). I wish I had jus spent the extra money for a doorbell that’s been around a bit longer.Previous review: Well, batteries last about three months them dead. I have gotten it adjusted to just go off when people approach so hopefully it would last longer. Ok, so now I change the batteries. Use the key and go to slide and all but one tab snapped off. So where up here are the backplates because I’m sure this will happen quite a bit.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2022

Review Text: I’ve had this for a little over a month now and I love it. The install isn’t the easiest. I kept having issues getting the back plate to lay flat because of the wiring barely having room to fit in the small cut out. It was a pain to lock the doorbell onto the back plate but after trying a few times I finally figured it out. I love that it works with my existing chime. The video quality is great too! I also like that it’s basically like my other blink cameras with those same features like live view, recording motion, blocking areas like bushes so it doesn’t give false alarms, and you don’t have to have a monthly subscription. The only thing I wish I could change is the sound the actual doorbell makes when it’s pressed. Hopefully that’ll come in the future.  But overall I love the product and would definitely buy it again, especially for the quality for the price!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2021

Review Text: So, this thing is great... when it works.First major problem, it eats batteries like crazy.  First set that came with the doorbell lasted 2-3 weeks.  Every set of Energized lithiums that I buy now (multiple packs, same as supplied with doorbell) last 4-5 DAYS.Second major problem, when the batteries are dead, even with the hardwired doorbell, THE DOORBELL DOESN'T RING.  It's a switch, that shouldn't need batteries to power the camera in the first place, and sure as heck shouldn't need batteries to close the connection to ring the doorbell that is POWERED FROM THE HOUSE.The only saving grace for this thing is the notifications and two-way audio.  As soon as I can find a Reolink or other similar device that records to Synology and I can setup app notifications for my wife, this thing is going in the trash.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2022

Review Text:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   I have been with Blink for a long time, I have four minis, two outdoor XTs, and I am grandfathered in to the free monthly cloud storage, etc…I have been reading some of the reviews, and a lot of people have returned this because of the difficulty mounting the back plate. I will admit it wasn’t super easy, but it wasn’t difficult either.Other than that, the sync module was a little difficult to set up. I tried to set it up with my phone and no matter what I did I kept getting an error message that the password was incorrect. I ended up using my wife’s phone (we both have the same phone, on the same version of iOS, logged into the same account) and it worked the first time. Go figure. I don’t use a VPN or anything either.Other than that, installation was very easy. I wired it to my homes existing doorbell power and it rings my chime box just fine. I didn’t notice the motion detection isn’t nearly as good as it is on the outdoor XT camera, which I left up at the front door as well. My XT camera will notify me of motion, and there will be someone standing at my front door, but for some reason the doorbell does not pick up the motion. I do like the wide angle lens.You can also set up custom doorbell notifications for Alexa devices which is pretty neat
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2021

Review Text: I ordered this doorbell to integrate with my existing blink cameras. Bought it intending to run the doorbell off a cable assuming you could like you can with the cameras. Unfortunately thats not the case it requires batteries at all time. My front door being about 10 feet from a busy street the batteries last about 3 days before dying. My only option was to turn the sensitivity down so low that it was useless as a camera unless pressed. After about a week it, the doorbell completely failed. Tried an entire pack of batteries and couldn't get it to work. Contacted blinks excellent support and said their was a hardware issue and they would send me a new one and I sent the old one back. Installed the new one and a month later it had the same issue. Maybe I just have really bad luck, but the doorbell isn't worth the time or money. The outdoor cameras have their flaws but they actually work.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2022

Review Title: Would not work with Nutone KB-10 & 12V transformer
Review Text: Not a fan. Received as a Xmas gift. The description seemed to check the boxes for me. I wanted to replace the existing wired doorbell and use with existing chime (Nutone KB-10.) The existing chime/doorbell was wired to a 12vac transformer in the basement that also powered the whole house humidifier. I connected the Blink and attached the back without mounting to the door frame for testing purposes  (BTW that wasn't trivial.)  When pressed the app would alert, the doorbell itself would chime once, but the wired chime would not chime. Repeat press nothing happens. Apparently the transformer output needs to be between 16v and 24v. If the voltage is less than 16v the door bell goes into some sort of "event mode" and becomes partially functional. Replacing the transformer with a compliant one is not worth the expense, effort and time. I'm returning.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2021

Review Text: I ended up returning the Blink doorbell.The video quality was OK ...  but, needs a wider angle lens.  When a person rings the doorbell all you can see is their belly ... not their face.  Obviously, this could be solved with a wedge.Installation was easy and it wired perfectly into our existing chime.The main reasons for returning it:1) Did not receive notifications when someone rang the doorbell.  It would initially work then quit. I tried resetting the doorbell (three times), logging in/out (three times also), re-installing the app.  Nothing worked.2) The motion setting would kickoff a video recording whenever a car drove by even with the sensitivity set to the lowest. (Of course didn't get any notifications either -- but it did take lots of videos).

Review Title: I had previously used a RING video doorbell.  Now I use the Blink Video Doorbell
Review Text: I had previously used a RING video doorbell. Tired of that.About a year ago, I install the latest Blink Wireless Camera System inside my home and outside in several locations. Review Text: After a couple of years dealing with a Ring Doorbell Camera, I decided to try the Blink Doorbell Camera.  What a difference!  Blink has made all the difference.  Ring had constant connectivity issues, long lag times and poor video quality as well as a requirement that you have a paid subscription to record any events.  The Blink solution was less expensive to begin with and has no problem with connectivity.  Recording events does not require a subscription and allows you to store events and videos locally on an SD card.  Less initial cost, no subscription requirement and solid wifi connectivity wins the day!  Now, when I ask my Echo Show to "show me the front door", it does so quickly and without the dreaded "cannot connect" message.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2022

Review Title: Not sure what the problems are...
Review Text: I installed this doorbell today and have been impressed so far.  It was extremely easy to set up through the app and eventually you get to the directions to place the doorbell outside.  Many reviews state that they have had a hard time attaching it to the wall.  I was having a hard time as well, until I realized it was upside down, and then it literally took me 30 seconds to attach it to the wall.  We went wireless so it was a quick snap and go deal.  I am very impressed and am very pleased so far.  The hardest part will be keeping track of the "key" to remove it when the batteries die (hopefully in two years).  Other than that, it works with my Alexa Show (even though it calls it by the manufacturer name instead of what we named it) and lets us know when the neighbor we attempt to avoid is coming.  All in all, a very affordable video doorbell and we will be looking into the cameras to watch our dogs when we are gone.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2021

Review Text: The negative reviews appear to be misleading given the price point of this product.  For the price, you won't find a better home security product.  I have one installed at my house and just ordered another for my parents.

Review Text: has some of the worst motion detection ever. goes off for cars driving along the street 500ft away but doesn't go off for delivery people walking up to my door. goes off for bugs flying in front of it, but doesn't go off for people in my driveway. records random still frames of nothing. audio is choppy and loud. makes random noises like there's someone banging on the door but nobody is there. installation was a breeze and it works seamlessly with my old analog doorbell chime, but returning this because if I wanted a doorbell I could have saved $35. monthly subscription absolutely not worth it. another example of a company being bought up in their infancy to eliminate them as competition.

Review Text: I received it and unboxed it and it looked great! I downloaded the app and setup my account but when it was time to connect the doorbell to the app it wouldn't connect. I spent about 2 hours and even contacted tech support and it didn't work.. They ultimately said they will send a refund once they receive the camera back. Needless to say, I'm looking for a different doorbell that I can purchase because blink just ain't it for me!Update:I gave it another try and was able to get it to connect. It works great! Review Text: I have been a blink customer for a number of years now, I have over 6 cameras on my system.  Overall I would have rated this product 5 stars… I love the the look of the door bell, function, the feature of using your existing wired door chime and the cost.  It was very easy to install and setup the video door bell.Now the down side of the version that I got, I bought the white doorbell version to match my exterior trim or our house. I ended up needing the corner mounting bracket due to the location of where my old door bell was located at on the entry door frame.  The mounting bracket is black (you would think they would send a matching color mounting bracket).  I don’t like the zebra look of the black and white, and I ended up painting the mounting bracket white to match the color of the door frame trim and doorbell.The other issue I have with the blink products (doorbells and cameras) is the hardware that is shipped with them, they are subpar.  The heads of the screws strip while turning the screws making them useless to use, (and that is installing them with predrilled pilot holes). I have always replaced them with higher quality screws when installing the cameras due to this issue, it is frustrating.Overall with the 2 annoying issues noted above, I would still highly recommend this product.  Maybe Blink would benefit with a little market research asking existing customers about what they like and dislike about their products before rolling out new stuff.  If they did that, I would like to participate in that Market research.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2021

Review Text: Because its price is so affordable, I was prepared not to be impressed....WRONG!  My next door neighbor has a Ring device also made by Amazon.  With no disrespect to Ring, the Blink has the exact same functionality, picture quality, great slim look, and integration with Alexa.  What is even better, is that the Blink "one ups" the game by bundling (at least in my purchase), the Synch Module and BINGO!---no more paying monthly for storage, because storage can be on a USB plugin, at home, not in the cloud. So my little Blink can do everything "the big boys" in terms of cost, with added value not even offered by the competition.  GET ONE NOW!... You will not regret it.

Review Text: This is an overpriced doorbell. Only thing that works on it is the sound when someone pushes the button. Can never get the live view to load from our phones or Echo Show. I have even tried putting the module 1 foot from the door bell and it still wont load. We used the free storage trial and that was the only way to see what was going on, but that wasn't viewable tell a minute later. Now our trial is over which means the video is useless because we cant see live or see the saved video. We also have a blink mini camera that wont link to our account. Tried contacting customer service about it and all I got was 3 emails over the course of a month and a half basically saying the same thing and to reset and make sure the Wi-Fi is good. Which I did all 3 times. So not a every helpful customer service. All in all not happy with the product as it is a VIDEO doorbell and I have ZERO video, unless I pay the monthly .

Review Text: I don’t know why it took me so long to hop on the home security camera train. Earlier this year I bought a multipack of outdoor blink cameras and mounted them outside. So I decided to add the camera to cover my front porch area as an extra layer. So far so good. Easy to install/mount and add to system. Clear high quality vision during day. Review Text: Blink customer support blames my internet provider. My internet provider blames Blink. It does alert me when someone is at the door. It does take clear video and pick up audio. If I click "Live" I can see and hear everything going on at my front door. Because of that, I kept the unit. BUT... I CANNOT ANSWER THE DOORBELL REMOTELY. There is a delay, and I get an error that the system is busy. Because of that, I doubt I'll buy again. Maybe next time, I'll try Ring. IDK. Review Text: The Blink Video Doorbell with Sync Module is average as best. Installation and set-up (with Alexa) was relatively easy. Motion detection is crap as there are false alerts constantly, especially when it gets dark out. This has led me to have to disable the motion alerts at night (scheduled through the app) and reduce the sensitivity to the point where it is almost pointless. Both with and without the Blink Subscription Plan the doorbell works basically the same and I don't feel the need to pay for it, given the average, at best, performance. What is absolutely abysmal about this wireless doorbell is the battery life. After installed for 2 months with the supplied Energizer lithium batteries, the batteries died. There was no real warning as the app alerted me the battery was low and within a couple of hours the doorbell was non-responsive. For those keeping score at home (me), 2 months is 22 months shy of the stated 2 year battery life. This is false advertising by Amazon.

Review Title: Amazon is selling convenience for $10/ month with Blink Cameras
Review Text: As you can see from the photos, once your trial ends, thats when the real problems begin. For one the live video recording is no longer a feature only viewing live feed is an option. Second, once you only have a USB stick instead of cloud, then all videos move onto the ' Home Security' tab. Here is where the headaches begin.One, you can't delete mass footage, only one by one, however the Cloud tab has this option. Two, you cant see the thumbnails of each video, so if you are trying to build a timeline of strangers walking outside your house, goodluck going back and forth. Three, when you decide to delete a video somewhere further down the list, it will reset to the most recent video, and finding where you left off is near impossible when you have a lot of footage because THE THUMBNAILS ARE GONE.Its like Amazon is forcing people to pay for simple time savers. I've never felt more scammed in my life. I Bought three cameras plus the doorbell camera and I now definitely don't even feel like using it anymore. THess cameras are not user friendly after the trial ends. I already pay for prime every month. Why the hell would i pay another $10 a month for simple features?? Honestly the 60 day cloud storage is not needed, AMAZON IS ONLY SELLING CONVENIENCE FOR $10 A MONTH.DO NOT BUY THESE CAMERAS, SAVE YOUR MONEY AND GO WITH ANOTHER OPTION LIKE ARLO.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2021

Review Title: Out of the box not working
Review Text: UPDATE: Upgrading the review to 4 stars as Blink support reached out to me directly after a few hours of my initial concerns and did everything possible to get it resolved. After sending me a new doorbell and sync module we came to realize a defective sync module was needed. So far great product and works really good. I would give it a 5 star if it had face recognition :)Was very excited for this doorbell and reviews, as soon as I finished the setup in the app the doorbell shows as a white screen,and live feed or thumbnail says unavailable. Review Text: I have 5 Blink cameras that I installed with no trouble. I saw the Blink doorbell was available and was very interested. I was disappointed because my doorbell got stuck in transit and took a long time to receive. I installed the doorbell yesterday and it was very frustrating. Come on Blink it shouldn't be this hard to install a video doorbell. I struggled for a few hours trying to get the doorbell on the mount. I was ready to give up and my neighbor came out and helped me secure it to the mount. However, what am I going to do when I have to change the batteries? I hope it doesn't take hours to put back up. I wanted to order another doorbell but I think I will wait, in case and hopefully, improvements are made. I like the quality of the camera but the installation is awful. Don't know if I would recommend to my family and neighbors, until improvements are made. Many of my neighbors have Blink cameras. The doorbell should be as easy as the camera to install. I hope Blink listens to all of the reviews and makes positive changes. This doorbell could be excellent just needs some tweaking.

Review Text: So i bought this at best buy on sale, thinking it would work well for an apartment with no wired hook up. I was very disappointed to find out that in order to have live video you have to have it wired in to an existing door bell. Its advertised as its not needed to be wired for live video feed but when using the batteries all you are able to see is the still pictures of the movement. Wish this could be better.

Review Text: I find the image quality & motion detection to be really lacking. I would hear people at my door before this would alert to there being anyone there. The nighttime vision on it wasn't good at all, but even the daytime vision wasn't clear enough for it to pick up license plate numbers of vehicles. It also wasn't consistent on what motion it picked up at all, sometimes it would alert me to a car passing by or someone walking in front of my house & other times I'd get nothing from it. My free storage trial is up & I'm just going to find another device that works better.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2022

Review Title: Look Into Other Options - Poor Construction
Review Text: First and foremost, the provided screws are junk. The Phillips head strips easily. Make sure you buy extra screws and better screws for mounting securely..Second, the weather seal prevents you from getting this connected to the backplate mount. No matter my efforts, impossible with the weather seal which is truthfully needed in my install application...Third, why are the top two clips of the backplate and for that matter the backplate PLASTIC... Takes a small hit with a hammer in a blind spot and well problem solved for disabling...Only reason why I am keeping it is that this is a temporary fix till I find a better constructed device that is able to remain weather sealed... For that reason, I am not returning and getting my money back but truthfully the plastic construction and design flaw out ways ANY POSITIVE this has... Due to the weather seal issue and design flaw of the seal, you're kind of smart yet knowingly paying even more with a sync module a subscription fee for an extended warranty...
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2022

Review Title: Updated review. Was looking forward to seeing how this would work and was very disappointed.
Review Text: **Update to my original one star review. After writing a poor review I was surprised to receive an email the next day from Haitham. He apologized for the issues and frustration I experienced as well as for the time I had spent trying unsuccessfully to install the doorbell. He offered to send me a new one at no charge to try in case the one I had was defective. He was very helpful and seemed to genuinely care about fixing the problem. I was impressed to see a company go out of their way to make sure a customer was happy. It’s rare these days for any company to care about their customers or consumers. I will wait and see how the new doorbell works out and I will update my review assuming my experience is better but for now I am impressed by the way they have tried to correct the issue.** My mom ordered this because she is home alone a lot of the time and wanted to know when someone was at the door and who it was before opening the door. I consider myself to be pretty tech savvy and I can usually figure out a solution to an issue with most things. I have installed other cameras inside and outside of her home that have worked great with few to no issues. I assumed this doorbell would be the same and I was sorely mistaken. After following all of the instructions step by step i wired it to her existing wires for her doorbell and could not get it to work and chime like a normal doorbell. I tested the voltage and it tested exactly where it needed to be but still nothing. I thought maybe it was defective so I planned on just using it with the batteries until I could get a new one. I have to say that whoever engineered the mounting plate for this is under qualified to say the least. I mounted the bracket as flat as it could possibly be and no matter how hard I tried I couldn’t get it to click into place. I adjusted it and tweaked it for over an hour after reading some of the reviews I read several that said it takes an extreme amount of pressure as well as just the right angle as you are pushing it on to get it attached correctly so I tried again and of course the cleats that hold it in place broke. Luckily I was able to find another bracket on an online marketplace for cheap so I bought it and went through the process all over again only for it to break again. I’ve been an Amazon customer for as long as it’s been around and I’ve never left a negative review on anything but I feel like this is something that needs to be said so other people don’t buy it thinking it’s just a simple 10 minute install. There are major design flaws in with this that I really hope they can work out. It’s a very affordable and from the ones that I’ve seen that they were able to get them installed and working correctly they look like it’s exactly as they are promoted but unfortunately for me that was not the experience I had. I’m considering just buying another one to try it and see if I have better luck. I hope I do but if not I will have no choice but to go with RING. I hope anyone that buys one has a better experience than I did and for those who have one that functions the way it’s supposed to you should consider yourself lucky. I hope more R &D goes into this that will remedy the flaws. A doorbell should not be something that turns into a major home improvement project.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2021

Review Text: If a car goes down the street with its lights on, it will announce someone's at your door. Review Text: The stand alone video doorbell works as intended. It will require a sub without sync mod. I exchanged the standalone for the doorbell w/ sync mod. Sync mod opens up lots of features not avail to the standalone product. Sync mod also eliminates the need for a sub since you have local storage. It offers live view, privacy and activity filters, and the motion detection response time is greatly increased. Packaging also includes a corner wall mount, which cost $10+. For an additional $24 its worth the upgrade. The standalone product is nice for entry level but it's kinda like owning a TV without a remote.

Review Title: This system works great especially for the cost.
Review Text: Forget the whiners who have trouble.  The system works good and is easy to install especially for the price.  .  Just pay attention to the instructions.  A couple of pointers  1.  After you mount the plate for the doorbell (and wires to the chime if desired)  carefully line up the doorbell and push hard to the surface then tap it down with the end of your screwdriver or similar.  Not too hard or you'll break it.  The same is true if you push down too hard. It has to go in AND down to lock the cover on.  Don't try to remove without the special tool if you need to or you'll break it.  2.  As for the camera mounts once you have the stand mounted and remove the rubber cover exposing the cover screw, you have to line it up and use a good amount of force to get it to catch.  Something like a light karate chop.  Make sure the screw for the cover is ALL the way in or it wont catch.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2021

Review Text: I have been a Blink user for years and enjoy the easy add to the app.  We got the back installed fairly quickly, but trying to attach the front camera piece to the back was an ordeal. Review Title: Does not use wired power. Battery powered only.
Review Text: I bought this new doorbell on its release date. I found it to be misleading. It is only powered by batteries which was unclear on the packaging as it states “wired or battery connection”. It wasn’t until I pestered Blink customer support that the fourth agent actually stated it only runs off batteries. If you live in a moderate to high traffic area your batteries will need to be replaced every three weeks. Also, the settings in the app displays that it is a wired connection not battery which is also misleading as it leads one to believe that it is not consuming battery power.If you are on the fence about ring or blink doorbell… go with ring.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2021

Review Text: Tried to install my new blink doorbell.  Instructions were great to follow and easy.  Everything was given in step to step description. Review Text: This is a great product. Easy to install. There is a $3/month fee to save videos on a cloud, but the the main hub can accept a thumbdrive to save videos. After Christmas, I plan to get several of these for our house.  Uses AA batteries, easy to replace, so no wiring. Download the app on your phone, and you can see your property live 24/7.Construction is heavy and sturdy, it doesn't feel like cheap crap. There is a custom steel tool used to change the batteries. Review Text: I got this to replace my Nest doorbell camera as I thought it would work better with Alexa. But it has a lot of problems. The video quality is poor and the sunlight really blows out the image. I could not get the camera to steam to more than one device (Alexa Echo show and iphone for example) at the same time. The second device would not connect and just gave an error message. Had to take extra steps to connect through blink. Amazon owns blink, why can't I just use it directly? This should all be part of the alexa app. I was expecting that if someone rings the doorbell the video would be displayed on my alexa devices automatically. It does not. It does not appear you can save footage to both the cloud and the sync 2 module at the same time. I don't see an option to schedule quiet time to prevent the doorbell from ringing (like at night or for example if you have a sleeping baby.) Also, the max drive capacity you can use on the sync 2 module is 256 gb, and if you try to use a larger drive it ignores the drive entirely. The volume on the speaker is also too low. Sadly the nest doorbell cam (first generation) might be hanging around a bit longer.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2021

Review Text: I purchased 2 of these prior to launch. Let me just start by saying that I am in no way new to the Blink eco system . I was an early adopter way back when they launched on kickstarter in 2014 and I own multiples of every single generation . So I am fully aware of the hardware and software limitations and work arounds. For this  doorbell : the positive ? 1) Price 2) speaker volume. Cons ? 1) The mounting system design and materials . All of it is made of very cheap plastic. Even the mounting involves  very thin brittle plastic tabs that offer no positive click when installed . The “ key “ to secure  it to its base is a joke . It just pries a  thin plastic latch off of a plastic nub.  There is no doubt that in 1 year when it comes time to replace the batteries … all the plastic tabs will now be brittle from uv and break !( I was afraid I’d break them on day one ! ) the worst ?  The amount of false alarms from motion are incredible . No matter how you adjust the sensitivity and the zones … every time a car drives by and the sun reflects off the car … bam “ someone is at the door “ ! This is an issue with every single generation of BIink cameras . But at least with the xt,xt2 and outdoor you can try and angle it and point the camera away from trouble areas and minimize false alerts . With this one - by the time you adjust the sensitivity to reduce false alerts … you then won’t set it off until you are within a couple of feet . Ring ( the amazon company that gets all its  love and attention ) is way way better at reducing false alarms . It can be done. So in the end - turn off motion alerts completely  - they are not worth the 10-20 false alerts a day ! And plan on this being a disposable product when you break it in a year or so trying to change the batteries ! Blink : At least put some metal reinforcing to the “ key “ area on the bottom . A couple of years after announcing this product … and this is what’s unveiled ? Yawn ! Let’s hope That Amazons “ step child “ gets some Ring software developers to refine what very well could have become the best value in doorbells . At this time however, if you live on a busy street or less than 100 feet from a road … prepare to be annoyed !
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2021

Review Title: Worse doorbell than the RING sadly.
Review Text: I had the ring doorbell for a few years and started to wonder if the blink might be better. So, I bought a blink doorbell. I have 8 blink cameras already so I assumed this would be a good product.Sadly, it's WORSE than the ring in many aspects... too many. 1. there's no chime to plug in to an outlet so your whole house can hear the doorbell ringing. They say that it works with alexa (if you have those products) and will ring on echos and dots in your home. Well, that's great but what if you don't have alexa OR can't get the blink to work with alexa? I can't get blink to work with any of my 6-8 shows, echos and dots. So, the only place I hear it ring is on my phone. What if I'm not near my phone?2. It rang recently on my phone and I tried to talk to the person at my door. He could hear me but I couldn't hear him. So annoying.3. The cover is really hard to remove to charge the battery.4. My neighbor rang the bell and looked right into the camera. I'm watching him (during the daytime) on my phone and can't even tell it is him! The camera quality is terrible.5. Doesn't work when wifi goes out.I'm so glad my 1972 home still has it's ancient wired 12v doorbell. It's original to the home and always worked and always will work. Technology can be too frustrating to be worth the hassle. I believe in the case of the blink and the ring doorbells, this is true. If someone rings my bell and I don't answer, they can come back or leave the package or do whatever. I don't need to talk to them while they're standing there and I'm likely busy driving or doing something more important than worrying about someone who is at my door.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2021

Review Text: We’ve had some porch pirates in our neighborhood steal packages from right in front of our door. We ask around and found people with video doorbells had less incidents like this. Heck, even if this didn’t work it would still be an excellent deterrent.The picture quality is excellent, and the set up is not bad either. I already had a sync module 2 so it seamlessly integrated with my other cameras by simply scanning the QR code. It comes with two AA lithium batteries which is awesome. Batteries last a long time in all my Blink devices.Love the Alexa integration with my Echo Show and Fire TV. It does take a few seconds to switch over to the camera, but otherwise it works perfectly.Hallway lights in our apartment building are on 24/7 so I haven’t had the opportunity to test the night vision. My 2 blink outdoor cameras are outside and the night vision is excellent.The plastic bracket  is a little tricky to attach. I’m assuming it has to be very tight and login to keep a weather seal around the inside. Don’t be afraid to give it a little bit of force. Push it in and up and it will lock in. I didn’t screw it into the door frame because I’m in an apartment and we’re not allowed to do that. We used some Alien Tape and it’s holding up there wonderfully.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2021

Review Title: Very good, but maybe a showstopper issue
Review Text: I won't go into a long description of features because you can find that elsewhere.Instalation was smooth and my current system read the qr code, added the doorbell camera, and updated the firmware as normal.Here's the showstopper that may lead to a return.  The doorbell camera cannot be put of a separate schedule from the rest of the system.  I have 4 other Blink cameras covering the property.  The system arms at 10pm and disarms at 7.  I would like the doorbell to be on all the time.  It can't do it.  I called tech support and they said there was some kind of a kludge to do it but it wouldn't work very well and he said they have no plans to ever give the doorbell independent functionality.  If you want that, you have to buy the Ring doorbell, also owned by A, and that's the reason to buy the higher priced product.All that being said, the Blink doorbell may be for you if you keep your whole system armed all the time or if it's the only security camera you need, perhaps for an apartment or condo application where you're not covering a larger property.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2021

Review Title: Doorbell works lag time for camera is too long
Review Text: Doorbell works.  Lag time for camera is too long, like 10 seconds!!! That’s outrageous. I moved the the sync module2 to a position just on the other side of the wall from the doorbell and even moved my router to about 15 feet from the sync module. I hooked it up to my existing doorbell wiring and set up the app to ring my existing doorbell as well as the echo dot and on my iphone. That all works great. Camera is useless unless you just want to record an intruder braking down you door. The police could use it for evidence after the fact but you would know anything except someone is at the door just like before I had this piece of trash. It is less expensive than one that actually works but if your going to hook one up it will save you lots of aggravation to fork out a few more bucks and get Amazons other doorbell and pay the $30 dollar yearly subscription and it works great from what I hear.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2021

Review Text: This has very limited use over a regular doorbell. If you can’t get to your door, you can look on your camera and talk with whoever might be at your door. However, there is a delay between when the doorbell rings and the link notifies you on your phone.The live view will show you what a package looks like if it’s been delivered to your door, but typically Amazon will send you an email with the same information. And, unless you purchase another little piece of plastic to put behind the doorbell, you may not even be able to see the package anyway. This is the kind of thing that should’ve been included with the unit from the beginning.Finally, as a security device it is only useful if you purchase a contract so that whatever happens is recorded and you can view it later. I would’ve liked to see some minimal recording available without purchasing an additional contract.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2022

Review Title: Waited to buy video doorbell - Blink for Home is a awesome video doorbell
Review Text: When everyone was introduced to the Ring doorbell, the cost kept me from purchasing one. When the Blink for Home doorbell came out I preordered one.  Once Amazon was ready to ship, the doorbell came within 2 days. At first, I was concerned, being nearly 70 years old and in poor health, about being able to install it properly.  After watching the video and following the step by step instructions, I had the Blink doorbells installed and working in minutes.  This was the easiest Wi-Fi device setup I’ve ever attempted.Once I had the doorbell installed I was impressed with the quality of the picture/video being sent to my tablet and smartphones.  I’ve shown my wife how to view the images on her phone and tablet. She now is happy we’ve have this device. This is a product I will tell all our friends about, encouraging them to look into. That you Blink for an affordable high quality product.

   I agree with just about every other review, for basic home doorbell detection this thing is jam up for the price. however installation was miserable and unless you're somebody that likes to read all instructions from top to bottom 1st, you'll find yourself taking it back apart. Review Title: Cameras aren't sensitive enough to catch thief. Amazon no longer stores deleted videos
Review Text: I just got off the phone with Blink, because I needed to retrieve an accidentally erased video. They will no longer restore deleted videos. I was told that even if the Police or the FBI needed it, and the customer approved, they will not restore it for any reason whatsoever.My reason for a 2 out of 5 stars:1a) The camera won't record someone pulling a CAR into my driveway, but will record a car going by on the street beyond my driveway. Not a joke. No matter the sensitivity settings, even if I block off the street, it will still oftentimes record the street traffic. Heck, it oftentimes records people taking walks on the sidewalk ACROSS THE STREET!  But not a 5,000 lb vehicle in the center of my driveway, which is in the center of the camera view (brand new, clean lens camera BTW).1b) I set up MULTIPLE cameras at a friends house, and no matter what, if a person walks into the camera view from around the side of the house, the cameras will NOT pick up the person walking, until about 5 seconds into their walk. By then, literally, they can EASILY slipped into the back sliding glass door being undetected by the camera. If anyone wants proof of this, I will HAPPILY go to the friend's home and record with my iPhone the entire scene, and then upload the Blink videos, along with the iPhone videos so you can compare. We actually were able to get a person into the home undetected by TWO Blink cameras. (and yes, sensitivity was even tested on HIGH many times)SOLUTION: If Blink can make areas in the field of view less sensitive, they should be able to do the opposite, and hyper-sensitize areas that are most important to the owners.2) No retrieval of deleted videos. THE SOLUTION: Every Blink owner from this point out, should never delete another video EVER. They won't charge you for it, because it is unlimited storage!  So just let it stack up, and if you ever need to go back, it'll be there for you!  It's a pain to erase a few hundred videos every few days, so why not just leave it there! Amazon will have billions of videos they're going to have to store as a result, and maybe then, they'll allow you to retrieve something deleted to get people to start deleting again.3) If you want to have a conversation with someone at your door through the blink camera and your iPhone (WHILE YOU ARE ACTUALLY IN THE HOME ON THE SAME WIFI), it sounds like you are thousands of miles away, because of the delay. Can't think of a better way to make someone think you aren't home!I do like the Blink system when it came to ease of install. The app is fairly easy to use as well. But they do have some serious issues to correct. Hoping Blink/Amazon will put a team on it and get these issues addressed.

Review Title: Hardware is great; app could use some work

Review Text: It’s great! There is a subscription, but I think it’s only like $1-$2. It senses motion nicely. Night vision is great too! You can make it chime really loud too. This is handy if you have a smaller place and don’t want to buy to extra sync plug in!! It is also very sturdy. You might feel like you’re gonna break it when you have to put/replace the batteries, but you won’t. It’s just to make it harder for people to remove from your door without permission. You’ve gotta be rough on purpose! If you want to use batteries it works just as well! But be prepared to change the batteries often. Depending on how often mine record I change them every 2-3 weeks. Worth it not to deal with wiring it in to me. One of the main selling points for me. It also has all features of the ring doorbell on the basic plan, EXCEPT being able to view live feed at any time. You can only view live by clicking on your push notification within 60 seconds. To me this is fine, usually if I don’t get there in 60 seconds the person is gone anyways. (Usually delivery)

Review Title: Bad video quality, 30 plus false notifications, no better than a piece of trash taped to my door.
Review Text: So I bought this device and the sync 2module because some strange things have been happening around my home. I was able to get the sync module connected fairly easily and then the doorbell connected to the module fairly easily. Immediately upon opening the app and clicking on the camera icon I started getting failure messages saying camera was busy or thumbnail failed. So of course I called customer support and I was on the phone with him for honestly over 3 hours. And of course they walked me through every ridiculously basic troubleshooting step regardless of if I had already tried it or not. Every troubleshooting step was  focused on my network, I'm a professional field instrumentation engineer, so I'm fairly competent installing a video doorbell LOL their troubleshooting steps were almost insulting . There's definitely nothing wrong with my network and I explained that every other device connects to it just fine... I even had to download an app so they could test my network up and down speeds. After all that I was finally transferred to a higher customer service level where the man told me he saw several problems in their server. By this time it was nearly 11:00 p.m. so I got off the phone, assuming he would at least clear the flags he saw on their network . Apparently he didn't because it's still not even remotely functional.... this was just an overall bad experience.Occasionally I'm able to see a live view or 2 but it never records anything, the video quality is crap, I get 30 plus false person/movement detected notifications a day, I didn't get a notification when Amazon delivered my order, and I am unable to set motion zones, lol. I would much rather have a first generation ring doorbell which is honestly a pretty terrible device. In fact I've had two of those and neither of them have lasted more than 3 months. But at least for those 3 months they functioned.I just purchased a eufy doorbell and indoor camera so I will let you all know if it's any better.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2022
