Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2022

Review Text: Can't endorse the Blink Video Doorbell with a Sync 2 Module. I have other Blink cameras (outdoor, indoor and minis) on a Sync 2 module that are battery or electric powered. Those work great! The Doorbell is a completely different experience. The batteries have only lasted 2 months. First time the batteries failed I called customer service and had them replaced. Two months later, the replacement set has failed. I do understand that the settings used in the app, as well as number of trigger events, can affect battery life which I dialed back some with the second set of batteries.Operationally it has not performed to my expectations. There is a delay in triggering to record which sometimes fails to capture me pulling in the driveway nor walking up the sidewalk. We have had deliveries and it doesn't start recording until the driver is walking away from the door and halfway down the driveway. Other times it records fine. I do understand that there is a delay (20 sec) from one trigger event to the next but this is not the cause. Did get a cool picture of a bee checking out the camera (daytime, a bit blurry).Then other times it will start triggering when there has been nothing to cause a trigger. I also notice the recordings in this case are much slower speed than a regular recording. I called customer service and was told that the camera is constantly connecting and disconnecting from wifi. Hmm...the sync module is approximately 6' from the doorbell and the router another 10'. Our other Blink cameras and sync module are approximately 20' from the sync module and 25' plus a different level from the same router. These cameras have no problems.I've also had problems with the doorbell notification sound coming to my Android phone. The notification arrives fairly promptly. The sound is inconsistent. When the button is pushed, sometimes it will chime on my phone and other times it won't chime on my phone even though I have received the notification message. When it does chime, it is quite loud on the doorbell and my phone.Picture quality during the day is excellent. Night time, even with the IR turned down, is grainy.I just find that the Doorbell is too inconsistent for our use.  It entirely may be our set up/logistics somehow that is not ideal for the doorbell and may work more reliably in another setting. I really wanted it to work but after three calls to customer service and no resolution; I just give up. Our other cameras are great and will keep using them. Our other wifi devices work well also.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2022

Review Text: Be aware that this chimes from the actual doorbell even when wired, and not necessarily from the bell mechanism inside your home.I have close neighbors so I turned the chime off completely so people wouldn’t be disturbed.Took a while to set up, I’m not going to lie. The most difficult part was getting it connected to secure wifi, but after a bit of research was able to figure it out. (If you’re using a VPN, turn it off while you do this).Easy enough to physically wire and install the plate, though you may need to be a bit rough when getting the doorbell and the back plate (screwed to your wall) to latch correctly.I thought something had broken, but it just needed a hard wack to get it to connect. (Not ideal but it works).I love the app and the reasonable enough subscription price.Easy to save videos if needed.You can chose which parts of the view are ‘active’ so if for instance you don’t want the camera to start recording everything in its peripheral scope (like a busy street), you can simply unselect it.You can purchase additional blink cameras and monitor all from one app.

Review Title: No auto live view like ring has and EXTREMELY slow to show manual live view which makes it USELESS!!
Review Text: So, I am a tech type dude so I thought it would be awesome to have a video doorbell that shows me whos at the door when the doorbell rings and I or my wife could talk to them in real time while sitting on our asses, too lazy to get up and look through the peephole like we have for decades. I bought this thing and bought an Echo Show so I figured it was all good. Well, let me just say that YES , when the doorbell rings , the Echo Show tells me someones at the door, but NO, it does NOT support showing you the front door unless you then TELL it to. There APPARENTLY is no way around this according to everything I have read and tried but THATS NOT ALL FOLKS.... the response time between issuing the "Hey Alexa, show me the front door" command and actually getting to SEE the front door averages between 15 seconds and 1 minute. The same problem exists when you use a mobile device and click on "Live View" whether you are at home or somewhere else. LAME.  Now, I have already done ALL the usual stuff we do when something tech-like doesnt work as expected such as resettting, moving the wireless equipment etc and my home network is FLAWLESS with brand new router, modem etc and 300mbs internet, all with great wifi signal throughout the house. For what I paid for this crap, I expected more. My mistake. For the record, I looked at how my friends comparable RING setup worked for him, and NONE of these issues exist. The response time is decent, the auto live view works great, and he has no complaints. I LOVE Amazon, so I figured going with a product THEY were willing to put their name on would be a no brainer but unfortunately this time I was wrong. I am about to return this garbage.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2022

Review Text: We bought 2 of these - because our house didn't have working doorbells ... and we couldn't hear people at the door. But, it takes a while to get things done while unpacking.The day we put them up, we lost internet for 3 days.  They don't work without internet.Finally, we had them up and running.They are S L O W  .... I watched the mailman ring the doorbell ... set down the packages ... and leave.  As the truck was driving away, my phone chimed ... about 20 seconds.My son has enjoyed them.  He can talk with me from the garage door or front door.  I can open the Blink app to watch the live video.  My husband even gets the doorbell while he is driving around town.Maybe we need to get the services that go with these ... I didn't think about extra monthly charges when I ordered them.... service is by Blink, a company of Amazon.My "Show" doesn't seem to be able to connect to the devices .. one of the big reasons that we chose Blink doorbells is so we could see them from our Show devices.Overall, not impressed.I've never gotten the motion detection to work.  Night vision has not been tested.But since they are fully installed, I'm not removing them to send them back.

Blink versus ring, who gets GPS in there video doorbell first for that simple fact it can be pulled off the wall and taking 10 feet from your house and go off-line it doesn’t serve much of a purpose other than hopefully catch a glimpse of the persons face before dying

Review Title: Blink app crashes, no customer service available, speaker horrible.
Review Text: We bought the blink door bell In December of 2021 because we were having issues with packages missing and it was at a good price andnworks with our Alexas. However we started having last issues last week with the speaker glitches and when I was to speak the sound would break up. Couldn't understand what was being said. Then the blink app has a bug and the app crashes every time I look at live view.  Now we can't even use it. Worthless. I have called,  left messages, opened a technical support ticket on line with blink and have not received a return call or email from customer service.  When you call your on hold and then goes to leave a voice mail that states that they are also having issues with. You can't speak to anyone. I have tried several times. I have spent good money on their indoor and out door camera door bell system and for it not to work is very upsetting. A waste of money. Now if blink would like to get back to me on this review and try to help and correct the problem I would be glad to give a better review on properly working products, I would be glad to. We our officially out of the 90 day warranty and if that's all the life the product has then I don't suggest purchasing it.

The media could not be loaded.
                




   Watch my "picture roll" video to judge for yourself.The daytime view of this camera is good. It's clear, captures decent motion, and the notifications only have a few seconds lag time.The night view is utterly useless. Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2022

Review Text: The sync module that is supposed to show live view works when it wants to. You can sit it directly on top of router and it will show strong signal strength and it works intermittently. What a joke! Why buy a video doorbell if it’s missing the video aspect? You can soft or hard reset it, delete devices, reinstall app, remove batteries, update firmware, move the router next to Jesus himself and the live video works when it wants. Tried app on multiple phones—-both Apple and Droid as well. Still an issue. So if it’s not my WiFi, then is it their server? The app itself? Amazon attempts to send a replacement and guess what? It shows as delivered but there is a “superfood” in my package and Amazon claims the item is missing. Long, hard, sigh. It will show clips of motion detection, but what good is that if someone rings the doorbell and you can’t SEE who it is? If you wait for live view, you’ll turn into dust waiting. If you wait for live view, a burglar already entered your home and is eating pie in a tee shirt. Good grief this was a pain. The sheer amount of pain to even place the backplate. You have to be The Rock to smack the backplate on there so hard. Don’t even attempt to mount this if you’re frustrated. Instant headache. And if you want to connect your Alexa Show? Good luck. It shows nothing and gives a message that video is not responding. The Alexa skill helps in no way possible. Customer service? Blink sent an email and NEVER responded. I had better luck with Amazon. You better hope nothing happens because they will not help you.Pros: Good if you want to see what happened in short bursts of motion detection actually records.Cons: Terrible app. Terrible customer service. Terrible module. Good grief why did trying to get this to work waste my time on this precious earth?I hope this helps someone cause this product was pure frustration.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2022

Review Text: I would by this again if I had to.

Review Text: ***UPDATE*** I read reviews that mentioned a 10-second delay. This is true. I can my neighbors coming & going. There's a delay from the time motion is detected to the time you get a notification on your phone. You can't tap in to live feed right away - there's another delay. Once your free trial ends, so does the recording and with the delay to tap into live feed so does any chance of seeing something when it first happens.Arrived on time. It was easy to install. I didn't get the Module to go with it but I might get it in the future. Picture quality is great. I don't understand why the doorbell sound on the device is so loud. I wish I could turn it down. The area to the left of the stairs faces west - sun isn't even shining that bright yet. I haven't had it a full 24 hours yet but I am impressed so far. Just hate how loud the doorbell is outside.

Review Text: Having a minimum retrigger time of 10s is useless as the longest a motion event can record is 30s. That 10 seconds in between recordings can be very vital for security measures. Had I known about the  unnecessary  limits to the motion event recordings I would have spent the extra money and bought a ring doorbell. And I’m not the only one that has this opinion and has had this feature mess up recordings during real life security events like a burglary. If you want a camera you can use to verify when mail, packages, or guests arrive it would work fine. But I would not advise Blink systems be used for security purposes. And the problem would be VERY easy for Amazon to fix on their backend with a firmware update. I will be buying a ring doorbell camera as I should have the first time

Review Text: When I first got the camera it was pretty awesome and easy to install. Everything connect perfectly the first try. After about 15 days the battery died (motion detector). I changed the battery and the camera started acting up immediately. Motion sensor wasn’t detecting motion, camera would randomly detect motion and go off and then the red light would come up and shut off after a few seconds until the camera finally just stopped working. I’ve tried resetting it, I’ve tried deleting the camera and reinstalling it to my blink app, I’ve tried deleting the app all together and nothing. I even tried leaving the batteries off for a whole day and tried connecting it the next day and nothing! I can’t stand this thing and I’ll probably return this and trash the home camera I have in order to switch over to Ring or another company all together. On top of it all the motion grid that allows you to set up “inactive areas” DOES NOT WORK. I live in front of a somewhat busy street and the cars set off the camera all the time. I marked the whole street and everything above it as an “inactive area” and then I’m instructed to press the doorbell button to set the changes immediately or wait 24hrs for it to do it on its on. I press the button and the cars still set off the camera, day and night. Waited 24hrs, still no changes. Not satisfied and extremely agitated.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2022

Review Title: Super easy to install.  I've had ring, I like Blink better!
Review Text: This was easy to install and I grouped it on my existing Gen 1 Sync module that I use for cameras.  I'm fine without separate scheduling for the camera and the doorbell, although it would be great if Blink would update the software and allow separate schedules.  I mounted near the front door using Scotch doubled sided foam tape (extra sticky!) and it works great.  No drilling required! Of note, I found it impossible toe attached the doorbell to the installation plate before mounting the plate. BUT I figured out if you mount the plate FIRST, then attach it following the Blink instructions on their website - I had no issues connecting them. I had a Ring doorbell previously and the camera finally died. This does most of what Ring does for a fraction of the price.  It's like that microwave that has all the bells and whistles  but all you use is the 2 minute timer. HA!  Hope this is helpful to someone.

Review Text: We decided to replace our existing video cameras and add a doorbell camera. We decided to go with Blink. Everything has been a let down. By the time we get an alert that someone has rung the doorbell, the person is already driving down the street.  Supposedly the doorbell camera will run off the existing wires and even verified that our existing chime supplied the recommended power. Once hooked up, it showed thru the app that everything was OK with the external power. After several months, we got an alert that the batteries were low. I checked the app and it said the external power was OK. The next day the doorbell camera went offline. I changed the batteries and hooked it back up. The app showed it back online and the external power was OK, but we have not been able to access the video since.

Review Text: I live in a 6 unit apartment building, on the second floor, and I tried everything with the motion sensors to not be so sensitive because it was going off like 50 times a day.  I at first used a double sided tape to make sure it was working correctly, and then when I did the permanent mount to the bracket it was an inch different, and I was absolutely not able to reset the photo/grid for the activity zone.  I have it set to 2 (out of 10), and the activity zone set to 1 square, so a person would need to be within like 4 feet of the door (it’s basically aimed at the sky).  And it still has motion issues.  It’s now only used as a theft deterrent as people think it’s running when it’s not.  This would be a great product for a standalone home where the street/driveway are far away from the view of the motion sensor.

Review Text:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   I was really needing a doorbell with camera and at the moment I couldn't afford a super expensive one but I still wanted the security in my home and I decided to purchase this one since it had good reviews and it was at an awesome price, I really do like even though I would change a few things I really can't complain just because of what I paid for it I feel like o got way more than what I expected. The day vision on this thing is awesome its super clear and so is the the sound as you can see in the video, but the night vision is horrible, you can't really see anything unless the person is standing right in front of the camera or you can get a way better vision if you have lights on outside, the one thing I have problems with is that my house doesn't have a chime pre installed and I can't just add one like you can with the ring doorbell so that sucks because I really need one, on the plus side I can connect the doorbell to my echo devices to be alerted when someone is at the door, the other thing I dont like is that the video and sound are about 5 seconds off so when someone is near the doorbell they will be closer to the door than you think and that's what I dont like that people are actually able to get to my door way before the blink notifies me and when I talk to someone through the app I have to wait to hear what they are telling me. I will still continue to try this item out since lately the sensor has trouble getting triggered when someone aproches my door and it doesn't notify me or it doesn't start recording until its a little too late, the battery life is awesome it really does last a very long time and the doorbell is very easy to install as well as the app its also very easy to use.

Review Title: it was bought for alexa and the integration is terrible. It works OK for the blink application.
Review Text: I had experience in cameras installation (3 from different manufacturers and all are working well but not integrated with Alexa). This Blink camera was bought as a present for an elder friend for direct integration with Alexa. Installation of the Blink software was easy and the camera worked well. Connection with the Alexa was also easy, and my problems started: after some time of inactivity (10 minutes or so) Alexa loses the camera. I reinstalled that couple of times with the same result. Because it is a present I changed the camera to another one and reinstalled everything from zero point... with a similar result: it stops working after 10-15 minutes of inactivity, i.e. it doesn't send any signal to Alexa after the button was pressed and ring bell played. The motion detection regime actually helps - Alexa loses the camera after hours not minutes))) Everything - motion and ring bell - is well reflectd in the Bell application, so the problem is certainly in the integration with Alexa. The worst issue is that to make the system alive one must delete the camera and reinstall it again (btw, the suggestion came from my communication with the online service), which is hard (almost impossible) for the person I made this present to. So, I am very disappointed by this product and do not recommend it for integration with Alexa - I wasted hours to make the system work and failed )
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2022

Review Text: Yesterday I had my fourth Porch Pirate incident.Today I have a Blink video doorbell.It took my daughter and me about 20 minutes to install it. That included unboxing, downloading the app, working our way through the app, trying to locate an electric screwdriver, the whole nine yards.Hot Tip for Connecting It: At first, the doorbell wouldn't slide onto the plate. Then I got in there and really forced the screws connecting the plate to the doorframe those final few millimeters. Then it worked just fine.And it you're wondering if it can easily be stolen: Yes and No. Yes if someone wants to come along with a hammer or crowbar and rip the whole thing off of the wall. No if they just want to grab and go. Once you fix it to the plate, you need a special small key to get it back off. Don't lose that!The doorbell feature worked instantly. We had to poke around in the app to get the motion detection to work. That's the part I'm actually interested in. I figure the video doorbell itself is the single biggest deterrent to more thefts, but actually getting someone on camera if they do steal something? Golden.The motion detector has been in overdrive. Our house is very near the sidewalk and the area it encompasses is quite large. I expect a great many false alarms of movement detected nowhere near my front door or porch. I'll have to check to see if there's a feature limiting how many feet out motion is detected. If it's not there, that would be a great addition.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2022

Review Text: I have another brand of doorbell, and thought it would be an "upgrade" to go to an Amazon brand. Nope! There are so many issues. First, when you make a change to the settings, it requires either 24 hours to pass, or for the doorbell to be pressed. That's insanely stupid, and has no logical purpose. So I "arm" the doorbell, or turn on motion detection, and it sits 24 hours before turning it on!? What's the purpose of wifi connected devices if they expect you to be there to use it? Secondly, the app sucks. It's hard to use, and doesn't always notify. Third, the night quality is way lower than other brands. Fourth, unlike other brands, you can't look at live mode unless "and event" is happening. Maybe I just want to look at outside the front door!? Especially since it fails to notify me many times. Or, someone pushed the doorbell, and I missed it but they are still there and I want to talk to them. It makes you wait 60 seconds for a "new event." The thinking here is backwards. Certainly not what I expected from a company like Blink. Blink needs to really step up their quality.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2022

Review Text: I live in an apartment complex and we have a problem with kids loitering to smoke in the stairwell in a smoke free building. This camera has helped immensely to deter the kids mostly but also helps me identify them if it gets to the point that I have to call for help. The sensitivity can be adjusted as well as the length of the recording. You can also stop the live feed if it's not important. Mine is battery operated as it's not connected to a doorbell so be prepared to change out batteries as needed. I recommend the high endurance AA batteries. I have had it over a month and half now with Energizer Ultimate Lithium batteries and the device is still functioning at full capacity, set at level 6 sensitivity (about 5 to 6 feet from the door) and recording 15 seconds of live video at a time.

Review Text: I got my Blink doorbell not long ago, a few months ago. So far, I think it's a-OK doorbell for its price. THE batteries only lasted 1 MONTH before exchange. After I exchanged them, they only lasted a WEEK. Also, the doorbell does have pretty decent features, just that it DOESN'T have a live view UNLESS you have Blink Sync Module 2. Without it, you only get a live view for a few minutes & being able to talk through the doorbell when motion is detected. With Sync Module 2, you get a live view whenever you want, get to talk through the doorbell, and save the battery life on the camera/doorbell. The night vision is FINE, not the best for the price the doorbell is, but it's OK. Other than that, I think the Blink Doorbell is an a-OK doorbell.

Review Text: At first glance, this camera hits all the marks,  with cloud storage/local option, motion detection, night vision and wired installation.While many have complained about the mounting, if you follow the included instructions, it's a piece of cake. I have called and emailed their support team,  and found wait times were acceptable and their email responses timely,  even during this pandemic. They have the option of viewing your camera configuration via a toggle in the app to help them support you. You can shut it off at any time,  or it will revert back to of automatically after 24 hours. Either way,  they can not are your live video or clips.Here's where they missed the mark:1. It takes a bit of time to detect motion.  Not exactly seconds, but it does cause you to miss the start of the video event.Blink: The solution would be to pre-record continually,  but only save a few seconds of video prior to the recording when motion is detected. I know why Blink didn't do this,  it's because of the next issue.2. While this unit is wired,  it does not supply power to the camera,  rather it relies on rather expensive and environmentally unfriendly disposable (non rechargeable) lithium batteries. After owning my camera for just over a month,  it is time to replace them. Blink claims up to a year,  depending upon use.  Technically,  1 month is up to a year,  but not the issue. I live on a busy street,  so it does record quite a bit.  Isn't that what is supposed to do? You can play with settings to mask areas to not detect motion,  but that doesn't make sense to me. I have a video camera so I can see the comings and goings in the front of my house.  There is also the option to arm/disarm but who wants to be bothered to have to turn it on and off and who is to say a video event won't happen when you are gone and presumed disarmed?Blink: Please make a module that can be installed to use the power already present in the wired doorbell circuit to power the phone maybe even include a small LiPo cell to float charge for times when power is out or the button is pressed.3. Video clips are configurable to 10-30 seconds long.  If a particular motion lasts longer,  you have to wait 10 seconds for it to retrigger and continue recording, but you miss 10 or so seconds of video.Blink: With a powered solution and the sync module,  it should be easy to configure continual motion recording bound by motion,  not a predefined amount of time with a firmware and app update,  but again. I'm sure the power is the limiting factor.Blink seems to have an active presence in their reviews and questions. Hopefully they will listen to their customer suggestions and turn an OK camera to a top of the line product.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2022

Review Title: Not flimsy it works but removing the bell would make you think your breaking it so that’s flimsy
Review Text: Update: My battery says low, it’s been exactly 1 month of usage so now I’ll need to replace the batteries. But I get many alerts and yes I do watch live videos throughout the day so 1 battery per month is reasonable for the amount of use my bell is used. No one really rings the bell because I don’t have visitors Only maybe delivery person might ring it once in awhile. Also at night people faces shows up as a white light. So You can’t see who it is at all. Now That’s not kool.Well In the settings I tried several times to adjust ringer volume to low but it won’t save it at all. It’s either no ring sound or loud ring sound and nothing in between. Needs  a fix.Unable to share bell with others so I’m guessing You will need to give them your login info. Not kool! It does not have pre recorded messages where I can just press a option to tell visitors a quick message with out opening my mouth. That’s not too good for people with disabilities where they can’t speak to others. Hopefully in the near future this feature would be added.And there is no glow on my bell So that visitors could see it’s actually a bell so they could push the button. Maybe it’s to save the battery life so it’s understandable BUT when there is a wired option you would think you wouldn’t need to rely on batteries. So installing the wired option just doesn’t make too much sense at all. Unless people just don’t want there old wired bell’s wires to show or something. So thatWould be understandable. Blink shouldn’t have there customers believe that they have a wired option where you don’t even need batteries for it to operate. That’s the only reason I bought the bell because I thought I really could use it on Wired Power. So I still will need to rely on batteries but at least I won’t need to wait for batteries to charge. So that’s good and is different from other video bells too. Nice idea!If I keep the bell I hope the batteries won’t run out super fast and I hope they add some  pre recorded messages so customers could  just click on a response to have the visitor hear and respond to. Remember everyone can’t speak and some  just don’t want to speak to visitors sometimes. So give us those pre recordings. Example-  Hello please leave package right here. & Hello please give me a min to come to the door & Hello I can’t come to the door at the moment but please leave a message if you need to Thank You!It could be a really nice bell if these issues were fixed and improved. The Picture quality is nice at daytime and just okay at night.I’m debating on if I’m returning it or not since wires don’t supply power to the bell which was the only reason I bought it. Also some people have vacation homes and can’t always  get there to charge or replace batteries. Please improve the bell to make the wired option really run off of electricity.Another option for this bell would be to use it in the house as a video intercom for when I want to speak to my family when they are upstairs’ or downstairs. But I already have devices that does that so hopefully these options would be available in the near future.I really don’t think this is HD quality and infrared doesn’t work that well. I noticed the difference from my other branded bells.  But at least it runs on just 2 AA lithium batteries which could be simpler for some users, so maybe that’s why it’s not the same or better than other brand bells. So it’s unique in its own special way.When Blink decides to make another bell hopefully the term  wired really means wired aka runs on electricity and the button will stay lit so visitors could have a clue You have a bell. And perhaps it would have crisp HD video quality and several pre recorded response messages, different bell tunes , a rechargeable battery option because I’m not too sure if it’s safe for regular battery to be combined with a wired option. And hopefully it would be waterproof too and is able to be shared with family members without them having full access to be able to change the settings.I kinda do recommend this bell to some people who just wants an affordable simple video door bell who don’t mind regular ( not so sharp) video quality.Also HD not crisp and you  can’t share with family.Without the cloud planIt does work without the subscription plan but you can’t record, or save the recordings when you do a live viewing and they punish you also by not allowing you to see camera icon, bell icon or the yellow dot that Allows  you to know you have a new motion alert. It’s just a play icon with the motion icon even if someone rings the bell.

Review Title: It’s works great for the price
Review Text: We already had a few blink cameras so when this doorbell came out we decided to try it. The doorbell itself work great. It’s the system that fails. The only way you hear the doorbell is on Alexa devices so if you’re far away from an echo you can’t even hear it. So you basically have to fill your house with echos. There’s no plug in speaker option just for the doorbell. The load time for live view is RIDICULOUSLY SLOW to the point someone can already be gone by the time it loads. On top of the fact that you now have to pay monthly for it to save a clip of who rang the bell. While my cameras I don’t have to pay for ! The only good thing I can really say Is that for the price it works. I do appreciate that with it linked to echos they can announce when motion is detected. I recommend saving your money and trying a different system.

Review Title: Two of these have been great to track deliveries and visitors
Review Text: We have a front door that drivers keep leaving packages at despite an easy to read "Please deliver all packages to back door" sign mounted at eye level in front of the steps to the door. We also have a non-functional front door with steps, railing, and door knob all removed that they've left packages under. Sometimes even on the door to our deck on the opposite side of the house from the driveway (with no sidewalk leading there). We got 2 of these doorbells to see where TF they go in the front of the house when packages are not delivered to the back door as directed, and to monitor the back door. The front door had a wired bell with a bad button so it barely worked. The rear door did not have one so we previously used a simple wireless doorbell. After missing a UPS package that required a signature, we found the chime batteries were dead and decided it was time. With the Blink cameras we could at least monitor battery life via the app, and get alerted to a delivery if we weren't close enough to hear the chime. Or if the package was just dropped without ringing the doorbell.We love being able to see what's going on, or what activity there was near a door, and even get an alert when someone pulls into our driveway due to the range of coverage.However, the documentation is confusing. With both wired to our existing chime the cameras report "external power OK" instead of "Battery OK", so I'm not sure how to monitor battery life. Documentation on that is lacking, and the notification settings don't match what I see in Android 12. Documentation states the doorbell always runs on battery though, so the change in monitoring is confusing at first glance until you dig through FAQs for the official answer:The Blink Video Doorbell closes the power circuit of your existing chime system, it does not provide power of any kind. If the chime system loses power for any reason, the doorbell only plays the Blink Chime sound and your existing chime will not activate.I don't recall if this was covered in the FAQs/documentation I read before buying, but I found out during the install that I didn't need to make any changes to the wired chime like with Wyze (requires you to bypass the chime making it no long function so the doorbell can be powered) and other models. Install was so much easier than I expected, aside from having to run a new wire to our back door just to tie that doorbell into the wired chime. Now we'll be able to add another doorbell to our side door to monitor the deck without any wiring, and the sync module saves us the monthly cloud fee.Motion capture has been a bit weird. I have field of view blocked off from the house side of the front sidewalk to the top of the view to ignore the street and nearby tree branches. Yet we still get motion alerts from the occasional car passing by on the street. Seems more frequent at night, especially vehicles with reflective paint/stickers (police cars, school buses, etc). Front door view is kind of dark, despite a nearby street light, but I don't want to turn up the IR intensity if it'll generate more alerts from traffic. I also walked the dog across the entire front lawn (the whole area I have set to monitor) during the day and it did not trigger a motion alert.In the end, it's great getting the alerts we do. It was more than we got before, and the doorbell chimes should be more reliable now in addition to getting the phone alerts when out of hearing range of the wired chime. All for a reasonable price, with no monthly fees building up.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2022

Review Text: I’m really impressed with the wireless capabilities of this doorbell. It has the following benefits:1. Easy to use2. Clear images from camera3. Took me less than 5 min to installOne tip that I have, which others have with getting the seal to work is this—you need to align the doorbell to the plate by: 1) angle the doorbell at around 70-80 degrees (towards you), 2) you need to firmly press back into the plate and down. If you have arthritis of the hands, this might be quite difficult to put enough force down to get the backplate to click.Also, it should be noted, anything wireless and operated by a battery will have some lag time in the app (that’s the nature of product engineering when you’re running an electronic device that doesn’t have a continual source of energy like a power cord). So, it’s to be expected to have some sort of a lag or few second delay for the video to show up on the app (I have gigabit internet) and it still lags a little but nothing to the point where I wouldn’t want to use this device.Note for product UX testers at Blink: I would recommend trying out this product with folks of different abilities of hand usage and I would also probably recommend testing a slew of  instructional videos that show different angles of how to properly get the backplate snapping in.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2022

Review Text: We were gifted a couple of Blink outdoor cameras. After setting them up, we discovered that they were pretty amazing. But sadly, even though Amazon owns both, they couldn't be added to our existing Ring Doorbell video account. So...the Ring plan has now cancelled and that doorbell has been moved on to one of our kids and a new Blink Doorbell has been added to our new Blink Plus account.The Blink Doorbell is much more affordable than the Ring but still produces excellent video and sound quality and does everything the Ring did.No complaints really except one: Blink needs to separate the doorbell out from the cameras so it still senses motion and send alerts and records video when the outdoor/indoor cameras are disarmed. Which we do when we are outside in the backyard so we don't get constant alerts and run the batteries down on the outdoor cameras. BUT it would be nice to know if a package arrives or someone walks up to our door because the Blink Doorbell is also disarmed. It WILL record and alert us, but only if someone pushes the button on the doorbell. This should be an easy fix for the code monkey boffins typing away in Jeff's basement.The other complaint (only tangentially connected to Blink) is that Amazon needs to fix it to so when we purchase a Blink product as Blink Plus Plan subscribers (yes, it is linked to our Amazon account) that the Amazon website/app automatically applies the 10% discount to our order. It is currently a pain to have to contact customer service and have them make the adjustment every dang time we buy a Blink item.

Review Text: I was really excited to buy this because of the price but I can see now that it was not worth it. Anything will trigger the camera, including simple light changes. I am so tired of seeing a bunch of notifications pop up about movement outside only to discover that it is a completely still frame of nothing. Just a simple light change in the sky.However, there is also the issue of the camera taking forever to connect to my phone or my echo shows to show me who is at the door when the doorbell is rung. More than often it will alert me that someone is at the door when they ring the doorbell, just to tell me connection failed when I pull up the app on my phone to see who it is. Anyone who rings my doorbell has to wait a long time for me to finally pull up the live feed and see who they are and be able to talk to them.The clips only go up to 30 seconds in length and then take a while to start recording another clip of there is still motion detected.Overall, the camera quality is 3/5 in my opinion. Most of the faces still show up blurry unless the person is standing directly in front of the camera. Not very good for someone who is trying to keep an eye on their property and catch someone who steals packages.

Review Text: This worked well for a couple months but then it started having issues. The Sync module keeps dropping our wifi signal and doesn't automatically reconnect, just sits and blinks (ha, maybe that's where they got the name?). Customer service and tech support have been worthless. All they do is help us reconnect the Sync module, which works anywhere from 10 minutes to an hour, until it goes offline again. Ridiculous. I work from home all day, it's not a wifi issue.And the motion sensing capabilities might be ok, but by the time I get the notification and open up the app and camera on my phone, it's been 30-45 seconds and anything that was on the camera is long gone. I'm not sure if that's a Blink fault or just a fault of home motion sensing cameras in general.We got this for a Black Friday deal, now it's mid-April and I'm ready to return this stupid thing and get a Ring. Not happy.

Review Text: Summary: I gave it three stars simply for two huge reasons. Number one, the back is nearly impossible to get on and off I actually accidentally broke mine and now I have to hot glue it every time I change a batteries which scares me someone is just going to take it off… number two and probably the BIGGEST complaint I have…. It does NOT alert you when the batteries die.Full picture: I have to thank this camera as it probably saved my life this year. A homeless woman forced her way into my apartment without my permission. I had this camera turned off at that point because I had felt extremely safe in my apartment until that day where she forced her way into my door despite my pleas to leave me alone. That same night I turned on my camera. To my disbelief she had the nerve to harass me at odd hours of the night and day for the next two weeks. I have this camera to thank for knowing that it was in fact her creepily staring straight at my door swaying and begging I let her in to “talk”. I have no idea what her intentions are, but I do know that this camera helped me put a stop to the harassment I was experiencing. NOW the reason I gave it such a low rating is because my camera randomly stopped working today. I wasn’t given any alerts it just stopped. After everything that’s happened and still occasionally seeing the woman pacing outside of my complex I panicked not knowing why it wasn’t working and how long a replacement would take to arrive. After stressing all day at work, I took it off the wall peeled off the hot glue from the last time I had to open it, and  it turned out that the batteries were dead… I had checked the app multiple times throughout the day and the battery status displayed as “OK”. I feel that it should give you a low battery warning but mine simply did not, now, if I had not had this event happen to me I would have given this camera five stars, but until my lease is up I am reliant on this device to keep me and my loved ones safe.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2022

I got one all set up and ready to install by my front door when I read on the doorbell FAQs online that it still operates on battery even when wired to your existing (or new) doorbell transformer. Review Text: First and foremost, this doorbell has a very loud ear piercing feedback coming from it. I submitted a ticket, because clearly you can't talk to a person, within 24 hours of installing it. It's now been about 5 days and they are still troubleshooting it! Frankly, that is terrible in my mind because no one has called me and they only communicate with me once every day or two. Meanwhile, I couldn't communicate with someone who came to my door if I needed to, which negates the entire purpose of this doorbell. As much as I hated my Ring doorbell, so far it runs circles around the Blink doorbell in terms of a communication device.All that said, the video itself looks fine although I probably should install a wedge so it points down more.  Motion sensors are sensitive and I'm still trying to find the sweet spot, but I'm sure I will. The ability to block out areas to not sense is nice and easy to use.Until they can fix the above mentioned issue with the ear piercing squeal, This will remain as a two star review.

I wish Blink would step up and make this an option, with out it the app is useless for notifications  Ive contacted customer support and the response was the old "we value your input and this suggestion is being passed on to the developers"  Thats a crook of BS. Review Text: I initially became interested in a doorbell camera as I am a 23 year old female who works from home, and my husband leaves every morning at the same time to work. I have had “creeps” stopping by my door & trying to get inside. I decided to get the Blink doorbell camera because of the price and couple of reviews I seen regarding quality. I also like that you simply pay $9.99/month for all cameras on 1 module, to save & view all videos. These fees are amazing compared to any other brand like Ring & such. The picture quality is also okay, it’s not 100% clear, but clear enough that you know exactly what’s going on. (Can’t complain for a camera that was $50)The lithium (strongest/longest lasting batteries) batteries were only good for maybe 2 weeks before they died. I then have had to replace the batteries minimum once every week now. (With minimal motion activity setting off my camera, so it’s actually barely in use) My money is now being spent strictly on batteries. Which are pretty expensive to be continuously buying every week.Motion sometimes kicks on when absolutely nothing motions the camera (must be the wind, haha), and I’ve also had people walk by my door, and the camera only started recording as soon as the back of their last foot was leaving the picture frame… lol..Always be careful when changing the batteries. I have dropped my camera multiple times now as when I go to unlock the bottom piece to detach the camera, it immediately just pops up and the camera goes flying no matter how gentle I am.  I don’t have a problem with it other than the things I named, but when it’s time is ready to be replaced, I for sure will be getting a better more quality camera than the Blink. It’s pretty defective. But it does what you need it to do for the time being until you can invest in something better.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2022

Review Text: We originally purchased a Blink XT2 Outdoor/Indoor Smart Security system with 3 Cameras, with cloud storage included, 2 years ago.  We thought that we could add extra cameras later since Blinks's disclosure that we could add up to 10 cameras on our existing system.  We usually do our homework before any purchases these days because a lot of items seem to miss or omit descriptions of an item.  When we purchase the Blink doorbell we thought we could add it on to our existing system!  We were not aware that we had to purchase a Blink Subscription Plan at the time.  After a 30 day free subscription ended the doorbell we are getting a message that: No clip recorded" "This camera is not recording because you do not have a Blink Storage Plan".  We also cannot return the doorbell camera because time has expired on it.  This is just a warning to those that were caught unaware that blink now charges for their new systems.  I did contact Blink's customer service and was told that we would have to purchase a Blink subscription in order to use the camera.  Now we have a useless $49.00 camera that does not work. Not too happy about this!!!!

Review Text: I had the same mounting issues many reviewers have pointed out. In my case the middle and bottom clips engaged but the top ones would not, resulting in a gap at the top. I followed the directions starting by angling it top first, making sure the slots lined up with the tabs and then pushing it flush and down until it clicked. After many frustrating attempts, I removed the mounting plate and tried to see if the clips would even engage off of the wall. Again, the bottom and middle clips engaged, the lock at the bottom clicked, but there was no way to get the top ones to engage. I also tried the hints from other reviews to press really hard against the wall while pressing it down into place but that failed to engage the top clips. I suspect mine may have had malformed clips at the top because they looked different from the middle and bottom ones. Amazon support told me a replacement mount is not available and told me to return it and buy another one. After reading the many reviews about mounting issues, I decided to just return it and not get another one.
